story:
merMade? What is that?

My name is Kylie Bush. I am the owner and operator of merMade LLC, a spa and party center designed specifically for children ages 3-tween. 

Let's get the first question you have out of the way. 

No, I did not spell mermaid wrong, (well technically I guess I did)  

Mer as in "sea" and Made as in "made over".

 Do you see what I did there?

 Now you are probably asking what we do and why should I get involved?

 Well my story goes a little something like this:

A Girl and Friend have an awesome idea (lightbulb) to open a kid's spa and party place in Cape May, NJ where there is little to do with children other than the beach, mini golf and few awesome kid's camp programs. How many times can you ride a Ferris Wheel in one summer? Am I right? Off season cut all aforementioned activities out of the picture completely.  Girl and Friend plan and plan and plan and then decide to plan just a little more. Things are looking good right? Wrong. Friend's husband's job gets transferred and Friend moves wicked far away leaving Girl sad but determined to make all of the hard work and effort that was put into this work! Many said it couldn't be done, especially by a Girl. BUT and this is a really big but...with a very supportive husband, family and kickass friends to lean on for support and inspiration Girl found herself a real deal business owner! 

Holy Cow!! Take that naysayers! 

(I'm pretty sure you can guess who Girl is by now...wink)

"The first year of business is the hardest" they say, "They" are correct. 

With an already short busy season in our seasonal resort beach town and getting held up with permits and repairs our doors didn't open until mid June 2015. (For all of the Game of Thrones Fans out there, this one is for you)  Winter is coming! 

It is coming and we want to still be here for you and your children! Picture it, it is cold and dreary out and your kids are bouncing off of the walls. Wait!  It's raining too (that always makes the little ones extra rammy). Now where to take these darling children? The movies, no too expensive. How about merMade? Yes! A perfect place to entertain the kiddos.  What will be going on at merMade that I will want my kids to attend you ask? At merMade we offer private parties and a wide variety of mini spa services including mini manicures, ice cream pedicures, fun hair styles, shimmering makeup and glitter tattoos. We also have create your own spa products such as sugar scrub sundaes, lip gloss and shimmering body lotion. Fun right? All of the products we use are the highest quality children's products available, made in the USA and cruelty free. They aren't cheap but hey, if I wouldn't put ithem on my kids I'm not putting them on yours either.


Why do Mermaids get to have all of the fun?

Our goal is to expand our services and events to be coed. All of those Pirates and Super Heroes need a fun place to hang out too. Sea Slime Pedicures and Fun Face Paint, Treasure Hunts and Dinosaur Digs are all part of our expanding vision. To expand we need more space and moving takes money unfortunately. With your help we can get more room to accommodate a bigger space allowing larger groups for parties, which has been our biggest hurdle while booking birthdays. Who knew there were so many politics to guest lists for children's parties, it's easier to invite people to a wedding! We can host girls, parties, boys parties and coed parties when we expand. We will be able to have a more comfortable space for parents and adults to relax while the children are busy. We will host weekly events, including movie nights, arts and crafts, story hours and have live special guests. We want to continue our kid's yoga class and instill that true beauty comes from within and everyone is beautiful in their own special way but sometimes it's fun to pretend to fabulous and covered in glitter. We want to be here to let your kids have real life interactions and experiences instead of being glued to electronic devices constantly. 

Your help raising funds will go toward moving expenses, inventory of the quality products that we currently use. Buying create your own spa product stations that are gender neutral and geared toward boys, creating an adult lounge space, event supplies, deposits and permit fees, Marketing, Marketing, Marketing! You will be putting smiles on children's faces which is the main reason we started this in the first place!!!

We want to give back too!

What kind of big jerks would we be asking for your help without giving back to our friends, family and community? 

  • 10% of the total of all funds raised will be donated to Animal Outreach in Cape May. (If all goes well we will be West Cape May Neighbors)
  • Check out our Perks! You helping us makes us want to meet you!

Leap and the Net Will Appear

Is this business perfect? Not yet, it's a work in progress and probably always will be. I am putting every part of my heart and soul into making this the best it can possibly be. I will not give up on my dream. With my experience of 15 years working in high end spas, spa management, parenthood and making mistakes and learning from life's lessons I am equipped to take on the many challenges ahead. It also helps to have a good accountant.

A good friend told me once "leap and the net will appear". I have leapt...

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Like us on Facebook at MerMade Kids and Instagram #mermadekids
  • Spread the word using Indiegogo share tools!
  • Visit our website www.mermadekids.com
  • If you don't  fund us please consider donating to Animal Outreach of Cape May

Thanks for reading!!!

story:
So What's the Story?

I recently accepted the really awesome opportunity to start my very own Mary Kay business. I am SO excited about this, and very excited to tell you how you can help me get there!

Some more background information here--- In just a few short months I am going to marry a ridiculously amazing fellow, and we are going to relocate to Coeur d'Alene so he can continue going to school and pursuing his degree. We are so excited to start this new chapter of our lives, and I am excited to get a good start on a small business that I know I can fully utilize and/or fall back on as needed for financial support and security.

We know things will be tight for a while as we work to get a grasp on living as independent adults, and having to think about things like rent, bills and everything else that goes with that, so I can't wait to get my Mary Kay up and running so I know I can count on it!

What We Need & What You Get

My ultimate monetary goal to get this started is $1800. This is the entirety of the amount I will need to join Mary Kay as a Star Consultant.
I can guarantee that, barring the possibility of raising more than I technically need, this is the sole cause for which this amount will go towards.

Now Here's the Fun Part!

What do you get out of this?
By now you may have noticed the list of perks off to the side. I am SO excited to be able to offer these perks, because they all rely 100% on my own talent, abilities and determination. I want nothing more than to be able to start my Mary Kay business through artistic tactics that my backers can benefit from.

So here is how it's going to work. I am going to spend the next three weeks spreading the word, gaining backers, and promoting my campaign. And then, in the several weeks following, I will make good on those benefits. Sending things off, delivering, whatever it takes to get you your awesome benefit! If you want your benefit by a certain day (following the end of the campaign, of course) or in time for a special occasion, etc, just let me know and we can ALWAYS work something out!

Have questions concerning any of the perks?
Shoot me an email! ---> brass_bird@hotmail.com

Risks & Challenges

More than anything, I want everyone involved with this campaign to be as informed as possible! Even if I do not completely meet my goal, I will still be able to get my business up off the ground, with the remaining funds likely coming from savings or a loan.

I want to avoid at all costs going into debt over this, or even having a card or loan to pay off. My future husband and I will be starting fresh, and the last thing I want to bring into our marriage is a credit card that needs paid off!

Other Ways You Can Help

-Spread the word! Let your friends and friends of friends know!

-Share on your Facebook pages, blogs, Twitter, whatever social networking platform you prefer! Any sharing is good sharing!

In Conclusion

Again, I am so very excited about this opportunity, and so excited to be able to offer you awesome benefits in return for helping me start this new chapter of my life. I can guarantee some truly terrific stuff in store for you!

-Amanda

story:
You are a republican.

You want the British monarchy abolished and a full republican constitution established.

You want to register your strong republican sentiments in the 2015 General Election

You want to see the British Electorate have a chance to register its republican sentiments

You want to see that countrywide general election publicity for British republicanism used as the springboard for the ongoing participation of republicans in national British politics

If you want all these things we want your help

We have put a target of  £10,000 from this first fund raising campaign. Why put a low upper limit?

In reality if we get £1000 we will get us two republican candidates.

£1000 will be used for paying the £500 pound deposit for each candidate and after that anything beyond for all the publicity we can achieve. 

We will get immense value from each single candidate.

                                  www.democraticrepublicanparty.co.uk

The Democratic Republican Party was registered with the Electoral Commission on 28th February 2012.

We are the only organised, well-supported, active republican party

We have an excellent, comprehensive website.

We send out regular acclaimed DRP Newsletters read by media and political figures as well as our by supporters and members

We have a determined committee with a growing committed membership. The General Election 2015 is the opportunity for the DRP to make a significant breakthrough.

We want your help to fund as many as possible parliamentary candidates to stand in the election

Of course, we will not get any MPs.

We expect to lose most of the deposits of £500 that each candidate has to pay to stand (They keep the deposit if they get more than 5% of the votes cast.)

What we do expect to get is a massive boost and publicity for the republican cause and for the Democratic Republican Party

At every constituency where we stand when the returning officer announces the result the name of the Democratic Republican Party will be heard in millions of homes throughout the country

If only a tiny percentage of these millions of viewers become supporters, this will swell republican ranks enormously

With a DRP presense in the May election, British republicans will have made their presence felt in a parliamentary election for the first time in over a hundred years.

It will make republicanism again a force in British politics – one that will surely grow from strength to strength as disillusionment with the old politics become more entrenched by the day.

We have a number of candidates ready to go and to stand in their local constituencies. 

The DRP is not just a single issue party.

We have a full platform of policies that our members will be able to debate in the future.

We hold to these five core principles which define the party

               
We present a detailed discussion of these on the website

You can explore the policies on the website. And don’t forget to comment. Virtually every page has a place to register your public comment.

The last day for registering candidates is the 14th April. So we need donations before that date to pay the deposits of £500.

Following that this fund raising campaign will continue right up to the day before polling day. It will never be too late for new publicity initiates.

Britain has a proud republican history.

The new future of republican party politics in Britain starts here .....

story:
The Miners Arts and Music Center is a charitable social club on a working class estate in North Manchester. Built in the 1890's as a wash-house/social centre for Miner's working at a nearby pit, it had been left derelict and neglected for many years. A small group of dedicated community members began its restoration in 2011, they have made great progress but the work still continues.

We need £5000 to repair the roof. this will enable us to provide better and dryer facilities for community groups, organisations and creative people who rely on our centre.  Support creativity in the community, pledge your support.

We need £5000 to repair the roof.  this will enable us to provide better and dryer facilities for community groups, organisations and creative people who rely on our centre.  Support creativity in the community, pledge your support.

story:
Uplift and educate the disadvantaged

Hi. My name is Connie Muller, and I am the National Sales Manager for a national microlender in South Africa by the name of Bridge.

Bridge Online Presence  :  http://www.bridge.co.za

Connie Muller LinkedIn  :  Click here  https://za.linkedin.com/pub/connie-muller/1b/a3b/249/en

As part of our contribution to the community, we are involved in a variety of services that aim to uplift and educate disadvantaged residents in need in the local areas of our 50 branches thought the country, starting with the Tshwane Metro (3 x branches).
Some of the services include:
- Sport Initiatives ( Sponsorships)
- Rewards Initiatives (School Projects)
- Financial Education Drive
- Family Wellbeing and relationships, women and children (Focus Groups)
- Health and Safety (Focus Groups)
- Unemployment ( Training, Skillsets & Income Opportunities)
A wide range of educational upliftment, training etc is available.
Facilitation of Job creation between employers, suppliers and job seekers.

One of the first projects has been to create an infrastructure where people can receive education and training extending over a range of community needs.

Bridge, a national corporate in the financial services industry has willingly donated floor space, tables, chairs and computers for this purpose at their Sunnyside branch in Tshwane (Pretoria), and a number of other branches throughout the country.

The Bridge community portal currently provides for the following:
1. A range of focus groups such as mentioned above.
2. Income opportunities
3. A range of training

The campaign to further fund the project is to provide the following:
1. PC connectivity to internet to provide free online training
2. Tutor and supervisor costs
3. Course fees for students taking paid courses.
4. Equipment maintenance.

South Africa has a high unemployment rate, and the informal sector is very underdeveloped.

There is a need for skill development at all levels. The following pictures show the typical kind of community that we work in.


Current Facebook Group started to support project:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/tshwanecommunityservices/
The Facebook page can be found at:
https://www.facebook.com/resultswithpeople

The following pictures show the street view of the Tshwane branch and learning center inside.


What We Need & What You Get

We need $50,000 to fund 50 x branches and their community portals which averages about $1,000 per branch to get them going. Some branches are larger, have more space and resources and other are substantially smaller, so it will vary per branch

*** Any funding exceeding the above will enable us to provide more training and resources to those in need. The goal of $50,000 is therefore relative and can be scaled upwards considerably.

The funding will be used over the following range of expenses:

  • Paying for a broadband line and an internet connection at each branch.
  • Sponsoring students doing both online and offline courses aimed at building skillsets to either empower them as entrepeneurs or get them ready for the workplace.
  • The above training is mainly provided by outsourced service providers who will require payment.
  •  There is also the required job function of a community portal supervisor at the larger community centres such as the Tshwane centre above and this needs to be provided for financially.
  • Maintenance of the PC's.
  • General operating expenses.

Unique Perks:

  • Free, and discounted online training programs developed by and contributed by the training service providers. This list will keep on growing over time.
  • Discounts on selected services such as those offered at businesses like: http://www.go2webdesign.co.za
  • Free or discounted business coaching programs.
  • A donation now will be a lifelong investment in training programs and selected services.
Where the money goes if the goal is not reached:
  • If the goal is not reached, the program will still go ahead but fewer portals will be funded initially.
  • For example, if only $2,000 is raised, it will enable about 2 x portals be be launched, or 1 x larger portal.
  • That being said, this campaign will be repeated as regularly as is needed to keep the community portals maintained and growing.

The Impact

Your contribution will make the following difference:

  • You will be instrumental in teaching people how to fish, rather than just provide a fish.
  • These skills will provide income and living standards for the unemployed, disadvantaged, individuals and families.
  • Connie has been doing similar work in communities for 20 years, and has a good working knowledge of how to get projects like this off the ground.
  • Your contribution will provide the basic needs such as food, clothing and shelter, but not just by contributing cash - rather by upskilling and assisting people to either find employment or to develop and exploit their skills as entrepeneurs .

Risks & Challenges

There is not much in the way of risk in this program other than the following:

  • The current sponsor Bridge is for some reason unable to provide the premises anymore. In this case we can move existing operations to either a new sponsor and environment, or acquire a low cost premises for the purpose.
  • The biggest risk and challenge is to be completely underfunded, which could delay the launch of the project even in one branch.

Other Ways You Can Help

Perhaps you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please get the word out to all your friends and contacts and make some noise about the campaign.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Warm regards.

Connie.

Free, and discounted online training programs developed by and contributed by the training service providers. This list will keep on growing over time.
Discounts on selected services such as those offered at businesses like: http://www.go2webdesign.co.za

Free or discounted business coaching programs.

A donation now will be a lifelong investment in training programs and selected services.


Where the money goes if the goal is not reached: If the goal is not reached, the program will still go ahead but fewer portals will be funded initially.
For example, if only $2,000 is raised, it will enable about 2 x portals be be launched, or 1 x larger portal.
That being said, this campaign will be repeated as regularly as is needed to keep the community portals maintained and growing.    The Impact Your contribution will make the following difference:  You will be instrumental in teaching people how to fish, rather than just provide a fish.
These skills will provide income and living standards for the unemployed, disadvantaged, individuals and families. Connie has been doing similar work in communities for 20 years, and has a good working knowledge of how to get projects like this off the ground. Your contribution will provide the basic needs such as food, clothing and shelter, but not just by contributing cash - rather by upskilling and assisting people to either find employment or to develop and exploit their skills as entrepeneurs .    Risks & Challenges  There is not much in the way of risk in this program other than the following:  The current sponsor Bridge is for some reason unable to provide the premises anymore. In this case we can move existing operations to either a new sponsor and environment, or acquire a low cost premises for the purpose.
 The biggest risk and challenge is to be completely underfunded, which could delay the launch of the project even in one branch.    Other Ways You Can Help Perhaps you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  Please get the word out to all your friends and contacts and make some noise about the campaign. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!   Warm regards.Connie.

story:
The Civil Campaign to Protect the Dalieh of Raouche, also known as Dalieh Campaign, is soliciting your support to sponsor the campaign in advocating the plea to save Beirut’s last coastal open space, Dalieh.  Its latest initiative is the organization of an open-idea competition.

Under the patronage of the Lebanese Ministry of Environment, the competition invites multidisciplinary professionals and students to forward visions for spatial and institutional proposals for Dalieh. 

(Scroll down for Arabic text and Budget Breakdown)

(انتقل للأسفل للنص بالعربي ولتوزيع الميزانية)


About Dalieh

Dalieh is a unique natural site along the coast of Beirut. It is the last of the coastal headlands, overlooking the emblematic Sakhret el-Raouche, the landmark natural rock formation that dominates Beirut’s view from the sea. It includes a prosperous biodiversity, a rich diversity of geomorphological features, as well as archeological remains. For decades, this area has acted as an active gathering space, and encompassed a vibrant informal economy revolving around fishing, popular fish restaurants, boat touring, peddling, and scenic photography. Families and friends had found in this space a natural destination for weekend picnics, lovers a quiet and idyllic setting, sea-goers a strategic swimming and fishing destination, and communities an adequate setting for the celebration of their festivities.

Perhaps one of Dalieh’s most enduring and distinctive characteristics is the unscripted quality of its setting, allowing for multiple, overlapping –yet never conflicting – activities to occur. For long, the area had operated as an open-access shared space where order was secured through tacit agreements rather than public policing. This is because Dalieh does not fulfill the legal definition of a “public space”: the site is not publicly owned and its activities are not regulated or controlled by state authorities. In Dalieh, property is held privately and the organization and management of social practices, activities, and/or conflicts are worked through informal agreements.

Having practiced and used the area for generations, city dwellers had paid little attention towards property ownership and/or management. However, following a number of recent events, a few of the area’s users became aware that Dalieh is privately owned.  Since summer 2014, rapid transformations have abruptly interrupted Dalieh’s social and economic life: fishermen were evicted, their stalls and restaurants demolished, and a new fence now limits access to the area (and the sea) and obstructs the view. Numerous clues point to the looming threat of a luxurious private development to take over the zone and stitch it to similar developments that have mushroomed over the past decade along the city’s coast.


Who we are

In an effort to halt these transformations, the “Civil Campaign to Protect the Dalieh of Raouche” was established in March 2013 to advocate for the preservation and enhancement of the role of Dalieh as an open-access shared space for all city dwellers and visitors.  The Dalieh Campaign is a coalition of individuals and non-governmental organizations who share a strong commitment to the preservation of Beirut’s shared spaces, ecological and cultural diversity, as the pillars of the city’s livability.


About the competition

This idea-competition has been initiated by the Dalieh Campaign to provide a platform to advocate for the protection, preservation, maintenance, and enhancement of Dalieh as a shared openspace: unique in its ecological and geological features, and accessible to a wide public of users irrespective of national, gender, ethnic, religious, social, or other belongings. Teams of multidisciplinary professionals and/or students are invited to articulate visions for possible spatial, programmatic, and institutional arrangements in the area of Dalieh.

We urge colleagues, friends, and city dwellers invested in the possibilities of inclusive, ecologically responsible, and socially diverse urban futures, to respond to this call.  We encourage participants to channel their professional skills and imaginations in the formulation of actual schematic designs.  We expect these designs to be starting points for visioning exercises that can build broader coalitions advocating for livable and inclusive cities, ruled by the principles of social justice rather than narrow economic interests.


بهدف التصدّي للتحولات التي تطرأ على الدالية، تطلق "الحملة الأهلية للحفاظ على دالية الروشة" مسابقة من أجل طرح رؤى للإحتمالات المختلفة لتنظيم الموقع. هي دعوة مفتوحة للمصممين/ات، والمخططين/ات، وعلماء البيئة، والفنانين/ات، والقانونيين/ات، وغيرهم/ن - لصوغ إطار للتدخّل، من شأنه الاستجابة لتحدّي الحفاظ على الدالية  كمساحة مشتركة ومتاحة للجميع في المدينة. المسابقة برعاية وزارة البيئة

عن الداية

الدالية منطقة فريدة على ساحل بيروت، تجاور صخرة الروشة وتشكّل معها المشهد الصخري الذي يهيمن على منظر بيروت من البحر. وتعد من الرؤوس الساحلية النادرة نظراً لما تضمه من ثروة غنية بالأنواع النباتية والحيوانية بالإضافة إلى الآثار. ولطالما شكلت الدالية ملتقىً يحتضن نمطاً اقتصادياً عفوياً نابضاً يجمع بين صيد الأسماك ومطاعم السمك الشعبية ونزهات القوارب والباعة المتجولين، كما التصوير الفوتوغرافي. ترتادها المجموعات والعائلات وجهة تلقائية لنزهات نهاية الأسبوع، ويعثر فيها العشاق على جو هادئ مثالي، ومرتادو الشواطئ على بقعة نموذجية للسباحة والصيد، أما المجموعات المختلفة فاتخذت منها موضعاً ملائماً للاحتفال

لربما كان أبرز ما يميّز الدالية هي طبيعتها الشعبية والعفوية، والتي تتيح ممارسة أنشطة شتى تتقاطع ولا تتصادم. فعلى مدى العقود الماضية، شكّلت المنطقة ساحة مشتركة مفتوحة للعامّة ذات وضع خاص منح بوجب اتفاقات ضمنية خارج إطار قيود الدولة. فالدالية ليست فضاءً عاماً من الناحية القانونية، فلا هي تقع من ضمن الأملاك العامة ولا يخضع ما يجري فيها من أنشطة لأي تنظيم من قبل المؤسسات الرسمية

وحتى عهد قريب لم تدرك سوى قلّة من مستخدمي/ات الدالية كونها ملكية خاصة. ولقد ترددت الأجيال على المنطقة وانتفعت بها من دون أي اعتبار لملكية العقار أو حق إدارته. لكن ومنذ صيف العام 2014، بدأت تطرأ تحوّلات سريعة عطّلت فجأةً وتيرة الحياة الاجتماعية والاقتصادية في المنطقة، فطُرد منها الصيادون، وهُدمت أكشاكهم ومطاعمهم، واستحدث سياج يحد من الدخول إلى المنطقة والوصول إلى البحر كما يحجب الرؤية. هذا وتشير أدلّة عديدة إلى تهديد يلوح في الأفق، يتمثّل في مشروع استثماري لتطوير المنطقة على طراز فاخر، يلحقها بمشروعات أخرى مشابِهة تكاثرت في العقد الأخير على طول ساحل المدينة


من نحن

"الحملة الأهلية للحفاظ على دالية الروشة" هي ائتلاف مكوّن من منظمات غير حكومية وأفراد اجتمعوا معاً منذ ١٣ آذار ٢٠١٤ للمناصرة من أجل الحفاظ على دور الدالية وتعزيزه كمساحة مشتركة ومتاحة لكافة سكّان المدينة وزائريها. يجمع الائتلاف بين الشركاء التزامهم/ن القوي بالحفاظ على المساحات المشتركة في بيروت، وكذلك حماية التنوّع البيئي والثقافي كأساس لإمكانية العيش في المدينة

يضمّ الائتلاف مواطنين/ات، أهلاً وأبناءً وبنات، من الصغار والكبار، ملتزمين/ات بحماية مساحات بيروت المشتركة، وبالتحديد الواجهة البحرية فيها، بصفتها ضرورة للحفاظ على إمكانية العيش في المدينة. كما يضمّ الائتلاف أفراداً ومجموعات بيئية وثقافية ومدنية، تعمل بالسبل القانونية والمدنية على حماية موقع الدالية كمساحة مشتركة، مجانية، ومفتوحة للعامّة.

وانطلقت الحملة في تشرين الثاني من العام 2013 عبر نشر عريضة على وسائل التواصل الاجتماعي، تطوّرت في ما بعد الى حملةٍ اتخذت من"إرفع ورشتك عن روشتنا" شعاراً لها. وفي خلال العام الماضي، عملت "الحملة المدنية"  على توجيه الرسائل الرسمية إلى الوزارات المعنية، وتنظيم النشاطات في الدالية، وإعداد أبحاث قانونية وبيئية، وتصميم الشعارات والصور والفيديوهات للترويج للدالية


عن المسابقة

انبثقت فكرة المسابقة كمنهج للمناصرة من أجل الحفاظ على الدالية مساحة مشتركة مفتوحة للجميع من دون أية اعتبارات للانتماءات القومية والجندرية والإثنية والدينية وسواها. وتتوجه المسابقة بالدعوة لفرق المهنيين/ات متعددي/ات الاختصاص والمواطنين/ات المعنيين/ات من أجل طرح رؤى مغايرة لإعادة تنظيم الدالية مكانياً وبرمجياً ومؤسسياً. وعليه، فإننا نتوجه إلى كافة الزملاء والأصدقاء وسكان المدينة من المهتمين/ات بإمكانية رسم مستقبلاً حضرياً غير إقصائي مسؤولاً من الناحية البيئية يسمح بالتعددية، ونحثّهم على الاستجابة لهذه الدعوة. كذلك فإننا نشجّع المشاركين/ات على توظيف مهاراتهم/ن المهنية وقدراتهم/ن الابتكارية في صوغ تصميمات تخطيطية فعلية. نأمل في أن تغدو تلك التصميمات بمثابة نقطة انطلاق لنقاشات تصوّرية قادرة على تشكيل تحالفات واسعة النطاق للمناصرة من أجل بناء مدن غير اقصائية وملائمة للعيش، تحكمها مبادئ العدالة الاجتماعية بدلاً عن المصالح الاقتصادية المحدودة



Budget Breakdown

story:
We believe, that it’s time to change our perspective on how we look at digital content. 


For hundreds of years we have been framing works of art, especially paintings and photographs. Why have we been doing this? Of course, it looks better! But why?

Frames separate any content from the rest of the scene. They make it easier for us to stay focused. Our eyes stop scanning around once they have found a clear border. In the end, frames help our brains save energy. They calm down the scene. Especially scenes with lots of details such as movies, photos, artworks, Excel tables and so on.

They make us more efficient!

Modern TV‘s  and displays, like the Apple Thunderbolt Display, are designed with glossy borders or cases to frame the visible area. This may look good - but it doesn’t make any sense. Glossy surfaces reflect light, and this makes it even harder for our eyes, they are zooming in and out the whole time, trying to stay focused, and this isn‘t efficient or relaxing.

This is stressful  - and means a lot of unnecessary work for our brains!

The organic frame is our solution to getting rid of  distracting light reflections and to start enjoying digital content in a feel-good atmosphere that is efficient and relaxing at the same time. 


Make something beautiful out of your TV. 


Can you imagine the difference?



Thoughtfully designed

We have put our love and passion into developing and perfecting the Organic Frame.

Now we are proud to present a product, that helps you to stay relaxed and focused while creating or enjoying digital content. The matt organic material guarantees brillant colors and less disturbing light reflections for an unique viewing experience.

The overall design and its flawless one piece construction create an enjoyable feel-good atmosphere and blend the screen naturally into every environment.

• Helps to stay relaxed and focused

• Creates an enjoyable feel-good atmosphere

• Flawless one piece construction

• No disturbing light reflections

• Brilliant colors because of the matt organic material

• Universal Mounting System for easy attachment and removal

• Keeps your remote’s functionality

• Organic recyclable material    


Colors & Styles

Currently we offer two styles and colors. Black and white, with and without ornaments. 



Select your Perk



Universal Mounting System

For super easy attachment and removal within seconds, we developed the UMS - short for Universal Mounting System.

Elastic foam inserts in the corners of the frame guarantee a secure hold on various case designs. This little detail gave us the ability we were looking for to offer you a product, that fits most of today's available TVs.

                   


Requirements for your TV

The Organic Frame fits to most of the current available TVs.
Nevertheless there are some requirements to meet so that we can asure your TV is supported. In order to guarantee a perfect fit of the frame on your device, the front surface of your display's case must be almost flat. Also the width of the case must be within our specifications you can see below. Thank you for your understanding.

Specifications

32" UMS supported width of your TV's case: 2 to 65mm

40" UMS supported width of your TV's case: 2 to 75mm

46" UMS supported width of your TV's case: 2 to 85mm

50" UMS supported width of your TV's case: 2 to 95mm

55" UMS supported width of your TV's case: 2 to 95mm



What and when?


Team

Daniel Plänkers - Co-Founder & Designer
Daniel studied design and has more than 10 years experience as an Art-Director. He realized a true mass of amazing projects for international clients. Watching him finding creative solutions is pure fun and looks super easy. As long as he has enough to eat!

Simone Schüttbacher - Logistics expert & our sunshine
Simone was born and raised in the beautiful Alps of Austria.  With more than 10 years of experience in international logistics she will handle all incoming tasks with patience and a smile on her face.

Marc Seubert - Founder
Marc studied engineering and design and has worked in the creative industry for several years before moving to Salzburg, Austria to work for a well-known beverage brand. As a former manager, responsible for product development, he brings lots of experience to drive our project. 


With your support,

we want to start our little revolution by reaching the 25k funding to cover the initial production costs.  


You get,

new friends! We love what we do! And we also love people who share our vision. Besides this, you get the perk you have chosen and a 20% lifetime discount on all our future products. Fully refund of your money if we couldn't reach our funding goal or you are not satisfied with the quality of your Organic Frame.


Possible risks & challenges

We have put our love and passion into developing and perfecting the Organic Frame, however there will always be improvements and innovations that we hope will be informed by your feedback. By pledging to support our project you are doing so with the understanding that this is a new product that you are making possible.

Manufacturing
We are working closely with our manufacturer who is able to produce our Frames at a very high quality. However, to produce on a larger scale will require increased tooling and production equipment and this is where some delay could occur.

Fulfilment
Despite the best planning, there may be factors that we cannot control such as transport or supplier delays. While we hope that your support on Indiegogo will enable us to begin production on a commercial scale we have no idea as to whether it will be 'usual business' for us or an overwhelming demand. If more people than we anticipate want an Organic Frame we may have to scale up the factory. However, we will endeavour to produce the product quickly and make sure that the early backers are given priority to receive their Organic Frames.

Product adjustments
After extensive testing of the latest prototype and materials, we think we have a product that is ready for market. Adjustments may be made along the way (as we can’t think of everything). This will result in a better product but may delay production or shipment in some cases.


Thank you

Super thank you for watching, backing and sharing our campaign.
Special thanks to Judith Schaber for supporting us with her beautiful illustrations. www.judithschaber.com
Have a good time. And please tell as many people as possible.

story:
Short Summary

Two dads, who are also scout leaders and web design/programmers, brought you the first free online scout advancement tracking system three years ago. Upcoming program changes in the BSA means that while we continue to support the existing Cub Scout program in ScoutTrax.org, we are building the new program to be released on our site by June 1st 2015! We need your help to enhance ScoutTrax.org with these changes to provide our users with a leading edge experience, all while keeping it free.

We are a non-profit, free for everyone, online advancement tracking system that currently supports over 27,000 scouts, parents & leaders in taking the headache & guesswork out of tracking Cub and Boy Scouts in the BSA program.

What is amazing is that we have spent no money to advertise. All of our user base comes from word of mouth or searching the internet.

With version 2 of ScoutTrax complete, most of our time is now spent in supporting members and responding to their questions. We have been making big changes to accommodate the BSA's program updates. The best way to release a quality product by the deadline is to get more professionals to help us finish these changes. We are raising this money to get that extra help. 

What We Need & What You Get

If you are a scout, parent or leader in the BSA, you had us at hello.

  • Contribute nothing and we're still giving the site to everyone - free!
  • Help us meet this goal and you will allow us to get more help to program the new scouting changes on time.
  • Help us surpass our funding goal and we will start adding the following features:
  1. Multiple parent & read-only log ins with calendering.
  2. Add counselor access & sign off. Great for camps and merit badge "pow wows." 
  3. Auto fill, one click, virtual Blue Cards and printing. You know you want it.

The Impact on Scouting

  • Make it easier for you. Sometimes big non-profits forget the basic needs of their volunteers. ScoutTrax is actively filling those needs.
  • Keep the scouts' records at their fingertips. Records will never get lost.
  • Make scouting a much better experience and keep our youth engaged in a great program.

Risks & Challenges

There are no risks. We have taken all of them by donating 3 years of development... over 1000 hours! You will just help make it faster, better and stronger!

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can contribute; that's why we have to keep it free. You can help by:

  • Telling every scout, leader and parent you know about ScoutTrax.org on Facebook, email, text, tweet - heck even face to face. Tell them to try it out and contribute if possible.
  • Visit ScoutTrax.org and play around in our virtual cub troop of famous cub scouts. Use the username; pack and the password: pack
  • Visit ScoutTrax.org and play around in our virtual 11-18 year old scout troop of famous eagle scouts (includes Team, Crew and Ship). Use the username; troop and password: troop
  • When you're ready, watch the videos on how to set up a troop and start the path of easy, free tracking!

story:
Who we are...

Pop's Place is a culmination of personal dreams and market demand. After a successful 30 year corporate career and my current employer of 16 years downsizing and sending work over-seas informing me that me service is no longer needed i came to a cross-roads in my life. Do I go out and get another corporate job or do I follow my dream? 

Two very prominent thought came to my mind... "Do what you love and the money will follow"... and "fill a need and you will achieve great success"...

Having been a cigar aficionado for over 20 years, a purveyor of fine scotch and a lover of great foods, a cigar lounge was naturally a dream I've always wanted. Even better it's a dream shared with my sons, allowing Pop's to be a multi-generational family endeavor.

After extensive market research and need assessment, it was determined that Pop's Place fills a very large need in the local community.

We have the dream... we see the need... we have the motivation... And thus Pop's Place Cigars, Spirits, Sounds and Small Plates is born. 

Why Pop's Place...

Have you ever taken your significant other out for a great dinner on date night just to end up back home after you eat watching TV in your sweats because there is nothing to for you to do? Imagine a place where you can go and relax, smoke a cigar, sip a fine bourbon, listen to live music and maybe even do a little dancing without the Boom, Boom, Boom of loud music and over affectionate 20 year old's getting sick in the parking lot.

Pop's Place is a high-end cigar and music cafe' offering premium and boutique cigars, live music, drinks and small plates in a high-end atmosphere serving guest in the 35-60 year old range. Patrons will be allowed to enjoy their cigar while listening to live Jazz, Classic Rock and other popular genre's of music as well as enjoying our casual lounge style seating and dance floor.

Pop's Place will feature an extensive bourbon, scotch and wine list as well as local craft beers and craft cocktails developed exclusively for Pop's. The menu will consist of small plate foods created specifically to cater to our clientele.

This is our first round of funding, intended to get the plans for Pop's Place in motion while we continue to move towards our grand opening later this year. 

By contributing to Pop's Place you'll help fuel and create an industry geared towards the mature adults who need to have a good time in an elegant atmosphere away from the typical 20-something club scene. 

We are offering some amazing Perks, including T-Shirts, Our Wall of Fame, Gift Certificates, Private Lounge Memberships, Cigars and even free trips! 

It isn't easy to start a business from scratch but with over 40 years of culinary and business management experience combined with a love of fine cigars, great music and premium drinks, our team at Pop's Place has never been better poised to make this venture a smashing success with your help!

If you can't donate today, feel free to share our story with your friends and family! Contact us on Facebook or email me directly to see how else you can help out. 

Won't you join us in a remarkable revolution of change helping fuel an industry geared towards grown up entertainment? Join us today and end the date night doldrums!

All The Best...

~ Gerry

story:
Short Summary

https://www.facebook.com/events/1610563769203199/


I live in the Bournemouth area and have been following the events in Calais and the conditions refugees are living in. I have joined up with some other people who are also concerned and motivated to help.  Our aim is do what we can to aid the situation for some of the individuals living there. It is estimated 4000 people are currently in Calais living in temporary shelters. There is a lack of basic supplies, food, shelter etc. Aware we can not change the whole situation in Calais, but looking at what we can do as opposed to what we can not do, so raise a little, raise a lot, it will all be going directly to aid displaced peoples living in awful conditions. We are aiming to take food, shelter and clothing out in a convey leaving 23rd October.
What We Need & What You Get
We need;
Money to fund travel costs - Vehicle, fuel and channel crossings 
Food - Easy to store and easy to eat as cooking facilities are limited
Blankets, sleeping bags, tents and tarpaulins
Medical basics
Mens shoes and clothing - warm winter wear and waterproofs 
If we raise a little and it is not cost effective to travel to Calais all goods and moneys will go to Somerset convey leaving on the same date. If we do collect enough we will be driving a van (maybe 2, lets think big!) over to Calais and distributing directly to refugees living there.
The impact of any contribution however small or large can not be underestimated, these people are literally 30 miles away and a cold winter is coming.

As the situation on the ground is a volatile and rapidly changing environment we will be liaising directly with the local organisations who work directly with refugees to ensure that the supplies we are bringing are the most needed at that time.

Local organisations are: 

http://www.laubergedesmigrants.fr and http://www.secours-catholique.org


 

The Impact

As the winter approaches the difference warmth, shelter and food (basic survival needs that most of us take for granted) could be literally life-saving for some people. 

The only protections from the elements are tents and improvised shelters constructed from pallets and tarpaulin, some of which sleep up to 40 at a time. Winter is just around the corner and volunteers are increasingly concerned about the lack of men's shoes, warm clothing and sleeping bags.

Those in the camp are forced to rely on charity for their survival but resources are stretched to breaking point. A makeshift hospital in the camp treats up to 90 people a day, some with serious injuries. Medical supplies are desperately low.

Every day those of the camp’s residents who are able to do so visit the Jules Ferry day centre in hope of receiving one of the government funded free meals. Some queue from 11am until 6pm; however there is only enough food for 2,000 people and countless leave empty handed.

Many of the refugees are malnourished.


The U.N. has described the situation in Calais as a "Civil Emergency" and called for a “comprehensive package and.... a sustainable response.” Sadly this is not forthcoming and the day to day lives of those in the camps is in the hands of volunteers and the generosity of people such as you.

 

Risks & Challenges

The situation in Calais is volatile and rapidly changing, we are staying in contact with local aid organisations to ensure that the money we collect can be used to buy the most appropriate and useful supplies needed at the time.

If for any reason we are unable to make our journey due to political/legal changes that impact the borders and the camp we will donate any funds collected directly to the organisations working with refugees in Calais.



Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not all people can donate financially so please get involved by
* Sharing our page  

https://www.facebook.com/events/1610563769203199/

*Collected items listed on this page
*Offering spare time to help sort and pack items
*And inform other people so they can get involved
Thank you!!

*And inform other people so they can get involved
Thank you!!

story:
Gambia is one of Africa's smallest and poorest nations.

Poverty is widespread, pervasive and predominantly rural.

Underlying the high poverty rates is the country's relatively lack of economic diversity, which makes The Gambia highly vulnerable to increasingly erratic rainfall, food price volatility and financial crises.

The consequences of rural poverty include widespread food and income insecurity resulting from weather-induced crop failures and shortages of cash.

I am trying to raise money to build a well for a rural community called Jalambang.

With a well, this community will have water security and will be able to farm allowing them to become more food secure.
story_txt:
Gambia is one of Africa's smallest and poorest nations.

Poverty is widespread, pervasive and predominantly rural.

Underlying the high poverty rates is the country's relatively lack 
of economic diversity, which makes The Gambia highly vulnerable to increasingly 
erratic rainfall, food price volatility and financial crises. The consequences 
of rural poverty include widespread food and income insecurity resulting from 
weather-induced crop failures and shortages of cash.I am trying to raise money to build a well for a rural community called Jalambang.With a well, this community will have water security and will be able to farm allowing them to become more food secure.

story:
#whyiloveAfrica

Welcome to the #whyiloveAfrica campaign! #whyiloveAfrica is an initiative to change the negative perception of the African continent, and instead showcase all that is AWESOME about Africa.


Three reasons you should support this campaign:

  1. You LOVE Africa! (the culture, the food, the fashion, the beauty...there’s so much to love)

  2. You’re tired of the continent being portrayed as poverty-stricken, war-torn and backwards and want to do something CREATIVE about it.

  3. You want to be a part of a powerful global MOVEMENT.


What is #whyiloveAfrica all about?

My name is Julian B. Kiganda—proud African and founder of Bold & Fearless. I was born in Uganda and moved to the U.S. with my family as a toddler. It wasn't until my teenage years that I learned to embrace my culture. But that only happened once I came to understand the diversity and beauty of, not just my country, but the entire continent.


Unfortunately, the media often portrays the continent as dark and hopeless. And this is why I've spent so much of my life working to break down stereotypes that persist about Africa. Over the years, I've led projects and organizations which have worked to change the negative perceptions of Africa. On my site, Bold & Fearless, I regularly feature Africans who are re-shaping the continent's brand.




Why is branding important?

When it comes to success, perception is reality. That’s why corporations and countries invest billions of dollars every year in their brands. As a brand strategist with more than 17 years of experience, I understand the importance of combining stories and images to shape public perception of a brand. 

The beautiful thing is, with the advent of social media, we have the opportunity to tell Africa’s stories on our own terms without having to rely on media which is often biased. If you look at how the Apples, Chinas, and Nikes of the the world have become respected and highly profitable entities, one key to their success was investing resources into promoting their brands.


Did you know?

  • 6 out of the 10 fastest growing economies in the world are in Africa;

  • There are 29 billionaires (and hundreds of millionaires) on the continent;

  • There are more 100 million Africans on the continent using Facebook. But these facts are usually eclipsed by the negativity of mainstream media.


This is why I was thrilled to accept the invitation to join the Brand Counsel of Brand Africa, an organization based in South Africa which is working to transform the image of Africa. Excited to get to work as a Counsel member, all I planned to do was attend the organization's annual awards event this October in South Africa recognizing the biggest and best brands in Africa, but then…


Then I realized, this trip needed to be so much more. So the trip has turned into a movement. A movement I need you to join. 


Why does this matter?

  • If we want the next generation to appreciate and embrace their roots, we have to show them images and tell them stories that foster cultural pride.

  • If we want to attract more investment and opportunities to the continent and help economically empower more individuals on the continent, we have to showcase the side of Africa that many never see.

  • If we want to truly help Africa rise, we have to understand that image is everything. And then, we need to do our part to change it for the better.


How the Funds Will Be Used

  • Getting to South Africa (travel & accommodations: You'll be able to join me virtually on my trip as I broadcast it LIVE on Periscope and share on social media, inviting the world to see the beauty and diversity of South Africa as the first stop on the #whyiloveAfrica tour);

  • Producing the #whyiloveAfrica book (e-book and print versions): This book will paint a picture of Africa through the eyes of those who love the continent the most--YOU! It will feature the stories, food, fashion, natural beauty, culture, music and arts, and all those things that make Africa amazing. (For donations of $100 and up, you can get your own digital or print copy of this gorgeous book.);

  • Launching the #whyiloveAfrica T-shirt line (see below for the first two designs in the series);

  • My goal is to exceed the $5000 fundraising target and expand the scope of this project to include the #whyiloveAfrica web site, traveling exhibit and video series. This is just the beginning. And you can be part of it.

(SEE PERKS TO FIND OUT HOW YOU CAN SNAG ONE OF THESE SHIRTS!)

Why Me? Why You?

YOU can help me tell Africa's story and be a part of the solution to make sure the world gets to experience what you and I already know about the beauty and diversity of the continent. As an old African proverb states:

"If you want to go quickly, go alone. If you want to go far, go together."


Join me in letting the world know why we LOVE Africa! #whyiloveAfrica

(Beach huts in Capetown, South Africa)


Ways to Join the Movement

Join me in letting the world know why we LOVE Africa! Here’s how

  • Donate (as little as $5 counts!)

  • Share this campaign to help get the word out;

  • Use the hashtag #whyiloveAfrica in your social media updates. Photos, quotes, or writings posted using this hashtag may be considered by our editors for the #whyiloveAfrica 124-page, full color coffee table book to be released on or before December 15, 2015;

  • Follow me (@BoldFearless1) on social media and/or join my mailing list to stay posted on updates on this campaign.


Risks & Challenges

I've worked hard to reduce any risks to completing this project. I’m collaborating with an amazing campaign team that has more than 60 years combined experience in photography, design, public relations, community outreach and communications.


Thank You!

Thank you for joining me on this journey and contributing to transforming the image of Africa. When it comes to creating change, an African proverb states:

"You must act as if it is impossible to fail."

Let's go!

Julian


ADDITIONAL PERKS

When give a donation of $25 or $75 you get a digital download of these powerful, African-inspired Bold & Fearless Quote Cards to keep you motivated towards your goals!



Campaign Partners

story:
Midtown Miami Residents STILL Fighting Walmart!!

Rumors of our death are greatly exaggerated, and here we are nearly 4 years later since Walmart announced their plan to build in Midtown in October 2011!

While we did lose the last round of this long fight, but we have another round coming up that is the most critical to this process. And we need your help with the legal fees to file on this Thursday.

OK..I get it, so what do you need so much money for?

We are passionate residents and stewards of the City of Miami, but activism doesn't pay our bills. In fact, we have only raised money once from the general public, and only for $2000 instead.

But we need $25,000 to pay for counsel, filing fees and exhibits (mostly for counsel) to appeal to the state's 3rd District Court of Appeals this Thursday.

We waited until the last minute to ask, because we would not ask without having actual attorneys - Dubbins & Kravetz - who not only offered to take the case, but started working immediately giving us time to raise the funds.

The bottom line is that we need to hire competent and well versed counsel to take on this monstrosity. And that costs a ton of money even with a HUGE discount from the legal team. 

As it turns out, neighborhood activism is not cheap!

Unlike prior efforts to fight big boxes, we specifically refuse to "institutionalize" our efforts, or turn them into political office or some catch-all non-profit group centered on fundraising.  Your money will go straight to Dubbins & Kravetz and to their costs and the court's filing fees and nothing else.

And you should see what we are up against. At the last commission hearing for this issue, Walmart had so many lawyers, lobbyists, managers, architects and others in the room...that the total amount they billed was probably more than the payroll of an entire Walmart store for one year. 

At the last court appeal, they had 8 lawyers including Manny Diaz.

Did you know that the former mayor of Miami, Manny Diaz, is the named partner for Walmart's legal team?

Did you also know that it was under his administration that Miami 21 was paid for and written...and now he is the one trying to undermine it because he gets a nice fat check. 

Sounds great...but I am broke and just can't contribute.

We understand...times are tough and wages are stagnated (cough cough Walmart)...but you can still help...Share this campaign to your social network, like us on Facebook and sign our petition! 

Thank you!!!#NoWalmartInMidtown

But I thought this was over and Walmart already won?

Nope...our last round in the District Court of Appeals did not go well, but that's why we went out and found new counsel, in fact 2 brave attorneys who have pledged to set aside their other important cases and file our appeal ASAP by this Thursday when it's due. 

More importantly, we recently discovered a memo from the City of Miami Attorney's office saying that Walmart's permit to build will expire on November 21st, 2015.

We intend to invalidate that permit by fighting it in court, and by winning!

Why does this even matter? If you don't like Walmart just don't shop there?

Walmart proposes to bring 40% more big-rig traffic to Midtown than the zoning code allows. Even worse, they're planning a parking garage entrance on North Miami Avenue less than 100 feet from the intersection with 29th Street. 

If you've ever driven through that area during rush hour, it's a traffic nightmare stretching from 28th street all the way to 38th street where the highway entrance starts. 

If you just have a personal opposition to shopping at Walmart then by all means exercise your right to silently protest with your dollars and spend elsewhere. 

But this fight is about more than just a philosophical objection to Walmart. It's more than just the traffic nightmare their oversized super center is sure to impose into Midtown Miami

This is about a mega corporation flexing its political muscle. 

In cooperation with City of Miami staff, Walmart has throughout the course of this process violated numerous elements of the City of Miami design code. 

We seek to hold them accountable. 

They have every right to open a store in Midtown Miami, but they don't have the right to build a structure that is STILL in violation of our local regulations! 

Even the City's itself admitted that they screwed residents by forcing a plan with a major variance through and giving Walmart an illegal permit. Watch: 


But they bring jobs!!?? We need jobs!!!

Well no actually...You are being lied to. Walmart is a net eliminator of jobs. There are a whole bunch of studies about it. Here is a good one!

And the jobs they do bring are notoriously underpaid, part time, and heaven forbid you try and unionize or the plumbing will magically burst.

Listen man...I just stumbled across this page cause a buddy linked to it and I don't even live in Midtown Miami...why should I care?

Simple. This is all a mathematical equation for Walmart. They have legal fees in the budgets for their store planning. The higher that line item goes, the less of a likelihood that they continue to take over every corner of America like a fungus. So you may live in Anywhere, USA...but by helping us...you may be helping your own community one day.

And hopefully in the near future when MSNBC runs a story about the neighborhood activists that beat Walmart, you can pause the screen, take a selfie with Rachel Maddow and blast it out to your friends saying "HEY!!! COOL! I was a part of that!"
So This Is It. Help Us Out With This Final Countdown...

story:
About us

We are the Extreme Sports Club Scorpio, from Zenica in Bosnia and Herzegovina.

Edin Durmo, is the founder of the Club.  Together with his team, he works as a guide on the mountains of Bosnia and Herzegovina. Backcountry skiing, mountaineering, sports climbing, canyoning, hiking are his specialties.

The nature of Bosnia and Herzegovina is wonderful. Its mountains are wild and untouched. Even if they are not too high, they present a unique environment, which has not yet been discovered by mass tourism.

However, Zenica, where Scorpio is based is one industrial city in the centre of Bosnia and Herzegovina. Unemployment, the legacy of the conflict in Bosnia and Herzegovina, poverty are all problems affecting Zenica. These problems are aggravated even more by a difficult environmental situation, which is caused by a huge steel works company, which is polluting the environment of the city.

Why we need your help

Scorpio is a Club responsible towards its community. Edin dedicates parts of his free time training young mountaineers, who are members of his club. In the city, he has built a climbing wall in a public school, where twice a week, the members of the Club can learn and train rock climbing.

Having in mind the difficult situation of Zenica, Edin created its own sports center. It is in a hilly area called Smetovi, 400 meters above Zenica, away from the pollution and fog.

This has become Scorpio Educational and Sports Center. It serves schools, clubs, NGOs, boy scouts, who have now a unique area to be in touch with the nature and develop outdoors and climbing skills. The Centre is also a training ground for the BIH Mountaineering Federation. The main feature of the Centre is its Adrenaline Tower a 12 meter tower with numerous climbing routes of all levels, both leading and top rope.

The center was build from Scorpio’s own resources. We are now planning to expand and repair the climbing area, which was damaged by the bad weather and harsh winters.

We have already started working, but we need your help to complete this tower. Besides repairs, we are building a special climbing area for children who take their first steps on the rock. This is going to be the ideal escape for the youth from Zenica from the pollution and grey concrete in the city.

We need your help to complete this. We calculated it is necessary some 12,000 Euros to renew and expand the tower, any amount you can give us will be of great help. We will be really thankful for this.

Spread the word

If you like nature and rock climbing,  if you like our work, just spread the word and let your friend know about our small centre in Bosnia and Herzegovina

story:
Think Before You Move

Chess & Community is a 501(c)(3) non-profit youth empowerment organization committed to developing leadership and promoting the success of at-risk youth in Athens, Georgia, and the surrounding areas. Our motto, Think Before You Move, encourages youth to evaluate their circumstances and plan steps to overcome them. CC uses chess as a therapeutic model and an instrument for encouraging academic achievement, community engagement, and the utilization of critical thinking skills.  

Classic City Knights

The goal of this campaign is to take the Classic City Knights, CC's resident chess team and mentor group, to compete in the annual Bum Rush the Board chess tournament in Washington, D.C. (http://www.wblinc.org/bum-rush-2015/). This annual trip to Washington, D.C. will be a life-changing, eye opening, and educational experience for these students. They will get the opportunity to meet other youth from around the country to share in solutions for empowerment. Not only will they compete in the chess tournament, but they will also get an opportunity to tour the Nation’s Capital, Howard University, and North Carolina A&T University. 

On November 13-16, 2015, we will take 12 middle and high school students from Athens, Georgia, to Washington, D.C. for an annual chess tournament and touring of the Nation’s Capital.  The students will be chaperoned by three adolescent development mentors. We are seeking $5,000 to contribute to the following:

•  Round-trip transportation rental for students and chaperones  

•  Fuel costs (approximately 1,250 miles) and insurance

•  Experienced driver

•  Tournament fees

•  Hotel and food costs

•  Team t-shirts

•  Washington, D.C. tour guide 

In the event that we are unable to reach our maximum goal, we will reduce the number of students that we can take on this trip and limit other spending costs. The  success of the trip will ultimately be determined by what we are able to raise.  We have already begun local campaigning in hopes of covering expenses not mentioned.    

The Impact

We are extremely proud of our students.  They continue to stay focused on their personal goals by engaging in community projects, service learning,  and other events.  For many, chess has become the model for strategically planning their lives. This annual trip to Washington, D.C. serves as a reward and source of motivation to encourage our students to continue on their positive paths.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you prefer to become an in-kind sponsor by providing transportation, t-shirts, lodging, etc., please contact Lemuel LaRoche at chessandcommunity@gmail.com. 

Thank you for your support.


Founder and Executive Director Lemuel LaRoche, MSW, earned his degree from the University of Georgia. LaRoche has over 15 years of experience in adolescent and community development. He serves as a mentor, chess instructor, and life coach for many teens in communities across Northeast Georgia.

We are extremely proud of our
students.  They continue to stay focused on their personal goals by engaging in community projects, service learning,  and other events.  For many, chess has become the model for strategically planning their lives. This annual trip to Washington, D.C. serves as a reward and source of motivation to encourage our students to continue on their positive paths.  

Other Ways You Can Help 

If you prefer to become an in-kind
sponsor by providing transportation, t-shirts, lodging, etc., please contact
Lemuel LaRoche at chessandcommunity@gmail.com. 
Thank you for your support.

Founder and Executive Director Lemuel LaRoche, MSW, earned his
degree from the University of Georgia. LaRoche has over 15 years of experience
in adolescent and community development. He serves as a mentor, chess instructor, and
life coach for many teens in communities across Northeast Georgia.

story:
Hi there,

Thank you for taking the time to join my Campaign, my name is Tessa, i'm a 31 yr old mother of two boys ages 5 and 7. My  objective is to raise money to open the first retail store for Sapodilla Skin Care. Sapodilla Skin Care is a natural skin and hair care line, located in NY. My goal is to provide your skin and hair with the safest skin and hair worthy products. These natural products are loved by many, go ahead and follow our instagram page(@sapodillaskincare) and find out for yourself.

We are proud to have an almost 8k followship on instagram and it continues to grow. As a new company this is rather exciting. We are looking forward to the next phase of business and that is to have a store where people can come touch and play with our delightful products. Who doesn't want to spend an hour or so trying out new skin and hair products? 

As of now we sell on line at www.sapodillaskincare.com but as fun as this is, we want to interact with humans. We want to see the excitement on your face as you see, smell and touch our amazing yet unique products, we have to offer. Can you blame us for wanting to see the excitement we know you'll have? We want the store to be as interactive as possible. We'll have happy team members that enjoy the products we sell such as our, Body Butters, Body Scrubs, Body oils, Bath salts, Hair Butter and so much more.

With your help we will have a store that wants you to come in and play. We'd like  a nice store front in a busy area with nice display windows. Picture macy's around the holidays, all eyes on them. We need to have all the proper equiptment to continue to make your products and also all the ingredients that are natural and healthy for you. It does takes a lot but it is worth it. Your help will provide funding for the Lease Equiptment, Marketing, Ingredients, Labels, POS machines, Printers and all the things that you dont get to see as a customer.

For bragging rights we recently had the oppurtunity to distribute our products on a few Jetblue Airways flights. This was an amazing experience and it lead our company to more sales and has given us a platform to be noticed. It's hard for a small business to gain recognition but when a major company like Jetblue gets involved, you know you've got something good. We are thankful.

Our ultimate goal is in giving back and this will be more than possible as our brand becomes more profitable. Please help us  to make this happen and we promise, you can come play with all the different products at the first store we open. We will be more than happy to have you. Any help we get is going to go towards this project and it will happen because we know a good thing when we see it.

Thank you so much for taking the time to read my campaign and I appreciate your time.


Tessa A.

Sapodilla Skin Care

story:
About Puppy Pal

Hello,

My name is Dee. I am a certified and licensed Dog Care Provider, with over 10 years experience, dedicated to helping animals receive quality care in the comfort of their own homes.

Located in Prince George, British Columbia, Puppy Pal provides a variety of services for in-home visits: exercise, affection, bathing, feeding, grooming, medicating, and comforting company. No matter if it's over an extended work day or a two week vacation, Puppy Pal can provide individualized love and care for pets in their homes.

We, fully certified in dog selections, also offer consultations for adoption assistance; we'll find the right temperament, exercise needs, health, suitable pet care equipment, and more, to give you and your furry friend the happiest lives.

Learn more by visiting Puppy Pal's website here: http://www.puppypal.info/


Target Goal

 To allow me to quit my current job and make Puppy Pal and the quality care of animals my full-time job, my goal is $9,600 CAD.


How Your Impact Helps

Contributions will go toward:
  • the purchase of pet care supplies 
  • advertisements for Puppy Pal
  • launching Puppy Pal up on its feet as my full-time job
  • matching homeless pets with well-fitting families
  • making sure pets are not abandoned and potentially euthanized in overcrowded kill shelters 
  • giving pet guardians comfort knowing their furry friends are safe, given the quality care they deserve, and cozy in their familiar environments
  • making my small-business dreams a reality after I've struggled so long with illnesses that nearly claimed my life 

What You Will Receive

In addition to my sincerest thanks, there are perks for your kind contributions!
$1: Message in a bottle. Send me your story and I will anonymously share it with another backer! Spread your story forever. All backers are encouraged to share their stories with one another. Start a support group!


$5: Photo Fame.  Send me a photo and become a part of the workplace! My personal home-office will be decorated with all the backers who helped make a difference!



$25: Puppy Pal Stress Ball. Receive a Puppy Pal stress ball with your donation! If life gets stressful...just squeeze!


$50: Backers T-Shirt!  Receive a custom Puppy Pal backers T-shirt with your donation! Don't like how the shirt looks in the photo? No problem! Just tell me what you want on it, and I'll make it happen.
Over 500 designs are at my disposal.
Shirts can come in white, black or grey.



$100: Custom Fleece Walt Disney Hoodie!

Receive a Custom Fleece Disney Hoodie with the character of your choice!

Shirts can come in White, Black, Grey or Blue.




In addition, all backers will receive a personal Puppy Pal thank you card!


Other Ways You Can Contribute

There are other ways you can contribute-spreading the word will REALLY help! Just taking a few moments to share a link will make a world of difference. 

Thank you!

story:
Join us in bringing a used bookstore & community space to Grand Rapids' Avenue for the Arts

We're opening doors at 315 S. Division Ave, Grand Rapids, MI this November. Here's our dream for Bombadil Books:

  • A co-op style bookstore built on memberships
  • Used & rare books, binding & restoration services, and community events & workshops
  • A community space, passionate about collaborating with other local businesses and nonprofit organizations to create a vibrant Grand Rapids

Most of all, we look forward to being a vibrant part of Avenue for the Arts and the continued re-visioning/renaissance of downtown Grand Rapids. 

What We Need & What You Get

We want to open doors and have an amazing inventory and a space that leaves people feeling inspired. By making a donation, or becoming a member, you help grow our book inventory, build our bookshelves, and create a vibrant community space. 

Membership means you are a part of, and believe in, our community. It's about loving poetry readings, First Fridays, and chatting about your favorite books with friends over coffee. We'll take regular donations, too, but being a member has some pretty great benefits.

Membership Benefits

  • Cost of your membership is given back to you in bookstore credit. Yes, you read that right. Whether your membership is $10 or $50, we'll give you that much credit to spend in the store (must be spent within one year of membership purchase date). Every year you renew, you get credit again. 
  • Membership allows you to trade books with us for in-store credit. Bring in the books you're not reading, we'll give you a price, and you can use that amount toward in-store purchases.
  • Membership gives you 10% of all book purchases. 

Please note you do NOT have to have a membership to shop in our store. 

Adult Membership - $20/year

For anyone 18+. 

Student Membership - $15/year

Just show us a valid student ID.

Family Membership - $40/year

For families of 2 or more. We're open to how you define family.

Community Membership - $50/year

For any local business or human being who really love books and the Avenue for the Arts community.

Any donation over $50 qualifies you for the membership of your choice AND that amount in book credit AND an awesome Bombadil Books t-shirt (handprinted by us). Available only while we're doing Indiegogo. 

The Impact

Having a quality, used bookstore located on the Avenue for the Arts tells the world that Grand Rapids is a city that cares about literature, art, and community. We hope that Bombadil Books will become home to writers, artists, and other creatives, and a place for them to express and share their craft. 

Risks & Challenges

Some people say that the world of print, and small businesses, is dying. If you're anything like us, you want to be a part of fighting against that. While we know that owning a small, used bookstore will be an uphill battle, we believe in our community, and its love and support. Grand Rapids is an amazing place. We know that small business is valued there, and that art and literature are appreciated and sought after. 

If you help support us starting Bombadil Books, we promise that we'll do everything we can to make it a lasting endeavor that impacts the Grand Rapids community in a positive and magical way. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute cash, but still believe in what we're doing, you can help by spreading the word. Share our Indiegogo page with your friends and family via phone calls, emails, or social media!
