story:
We want to help you be "Rooted in Strength"! But we need your help, too!

You might be asking yourself, "Why the video?" The answer is simple. Dutch would never want you to get caught pushing too many pencils, and he knows that there is only going to be one spot in Tacoma that can withstand such a mighty blast and ensure that your health doesn't fall victim to Dillon's suit and tie job: Town Athletics. 

As the title of this page indicates, we will be a Community Rooted in Strength.  The meaning is described in detail below, and we hope that you take the time to read it. But before we get to that, we want to make sure you understand why we are running this campaign. In short, it is because we are a brand new, locally-owned small business that wants to provide you, our future members, a top of the line fitness experience. Securing the financing we need to meet this goal has been challenging, but we did it, and we invested blood, sweat, tears, and a significant amount of our own capital. However, there are some finishing touches we would love to include, like showers for all of your cleansing needs. We know what Town Athletics can be for this community, and it's a vision that has been years in the making. With every dollar we raise here, we are one step closer to guaranteeing that when we open our doors to the public, we're offering exactly what this community deserves.      

Why "Rooted in Strength"?

We have been told by some that a slogan like "Rooted in Strength" may be intimidating to new members or members who have never experienced Weightlifting, functional fitness, or a group exercise environment - that it may come off as, "if you are not already strong, then you need not apply." This could not be farther from the truth, however, because this line of thinking assumes that "Strength" in this instance means how much weight you can move. For us at Town, though, it means much more than that. 

It means being rooted in the strength of our communities. 

First and foremost, we are rooted in our gym community. When you come to Town, you are joining a family. Our workouts are completed as a group because there are few things more motivating than having other like-minded and supportive individuals surround and encourage you. Group workouts aren't about being the best, or the first one done. Watch any functional fitness competition and you'll see that the person that gets the loudest, most enthusiastic encouragement is usually the person coming in last. That is what is so great about a community workout: It's not about where you place; it’s about motivating you to do the best that you are capable of, and it's on us as coaches to help guide you to your maximum potential. Whether your goal is to lose a few pounds while working out with friends or to perform at a competitive level, we will guide you and our community will support you. This is why one of our expectations at Town is to introduce yourself to other new members. Does this mean you will be best friends with everyone at the gym? Probably not, but it does mean that we are all in this together, and just like a family, we will be dysfunctionally functional. You will love some of us, and others maybe not so much. We can ensure one thing, though: We will foster a supportive environment. 

Beyond our gym community, we are also rooted in the strength of our local community. We at Town not only work in Tacoma but live here as well. We support small, locally-owned businesses and collaborate with other locally-owned gyms. While they may be competition, by definition they are not "the" competition because we share the same mission. That mission is to help people realize that they can move and feel better than they thought possible, and that their athletic potential didn't end when they left high school. But this can't be done while watching TV and walking on a treadmill; it needs to be a calculated, thoughtful progression. Just as you didn’t start your career without any training, you won't start your path towards fitness, strength, competition, or otherwise without training. Luckily, that is where we come in. 

This brings us to our second strength: We are rooted in the strength of our coaching. We at Town treat coaching as a profession. We are all nationally certified in one form of coaching or personal training or another. You might be saying, "yeah but anyone can take a class and get a certificate," and you are correct. However, none of us are content with simply framing a piece of paper. We tirelessly work towards and study to become better coaches and teachers, because in the end, that’s what we’re doing: Teaching. We not only understand how the movements break down, but we also understand how to motivate the end user. It is because of this that we have written into our business plan a yearly, call it mandatory, education stipend. We never want to become content or assume we have all the answers, because I promise you, we don’t - but we will continue to work to that end because we are passionate about it.

Passion: This is our third and final strength in which we are rooted. Town is a passion product - one of many months, or rather years, of planning and work. None of us are involved with this to get rich. Don't get me wrong - we still want to run a successful business - but we didn’t put in the work, sweat, and tears because we needed a job. We did it because we love it and we live it. One of the most rewarding things we get to experience is watching a member do something they never thought possible, or to watch a community grow from the simple shared desire to be healthier and perform better. 

Are we Rooted in Strength of the muscle variety? Of course, and I think our programming proves this. Without a solid foundation of muscle strength, body awareness and movement are not optimized and all activities beyond the walls of the gym become more difficult. Will you get stronger training with us? Absolutely. Will your level of confidence improve? Definitely. Just remember: You don't have to come in the door with a theoretical level of strength. Just trust in the process and we will get you there. 

So again, why "Rooted in Strength"? Because being rooted in the strength of these building blocks are who we are as a gym, and everyone is invited. 

With all of that said, we need your help to get our gym started on the right "root" and help our entire community become "Rooted in Strength." 

Any donation, large or small, is a huge help, and it will all go toward making our gym the best in the community. Thank you in advance, and we'll see you in the gym soon! Stay Rooted!

story:
Portland, Oregon; Rochester, NY and now Richmond, VA.  What do these cities have in common?  They all have professional cuddlers! 

Welcome to the crowd-funding campaign to open The Holding Company, RVA’s first professional cuddling salon.

                       

What is professional cuddling? 

Exactly what it sounds like, and yet so much more.  In a nutshell, a professional Cuddler offers soothing touch and comfort in a safe, calm environment.

                               

Sessions may include whatever makes the client happy and relaxed, such as spooning in bed, talking over tea, reading to each other while snuggling on the sofa, even “movie night”.  (There is one exception: nudity, kissing, and sexual touching are NEVER allowed.)

                                 

There is no denying the power of touch, the way a hug can change your whole day, the stress-relieving power of a good cuddling session.  Numerous scientific studies have affirmed what we all instinctively know from birth - touch makes us feel better.  It lowers blood pressure and reduces stress by increasing oxytocin and lowering cortisol levels in the body. 

Why do these businesses exist?  

In this electronic age, we are constantly connected to and yet isolated from one another.  The fundamental need for pleasant company, meaningful conversation, and platonic comfort goes unfulfilled for many.   We may carry on six conversation at once, but still not truly connect with another person.

                       

                          

For my part...

I am lucky to have many people in my life with whom I can share the gift of touch.  Not everyone does.  Some people are widowed, divorced or otherwise single.  Some are separated from their love ones by school, work, or military service.  Sometimes you’re so stressed that you don’t even realize how badly you need comfort.

Recently, I had a bad batch of luck.  My car blew up and the mechanic said it would cost over $1,000 to fix.  A certain project finished at a financial loss and to make matters worse, I was robbed of all my money and a cell phone the same night.  Then, as I was just about to fall asleep, glad that the day was finally over, I was informed that a friend of mine had died suddenly.

I picked myself up by my bootstraps and went on with life, thinking that I was okay.  As I recounted my woes to a sweet and matronly friend, she hugged me without preamble and I almost broke down crying.  (Ask my family, I’m not a crier).  I had been so determined to “hold it together” and “be strong” that I didn’t realize how weak I really felt.  Many of you reading this can relate to that, I know.  That one hug, which lasted less than ten seconds, gave me renewed strength to face my troubles.

                             Got questions?  The image below has answers. 
                          Right-click and select 'open in new tab' to enlarge.

I have also born witness to the transformative, restorative power of a good cuddle.  One of my dear friends is quite close with my sweetheart, they having been friends for years before I met them.  She is also an Army wife, whose husband seems to be deployed more than he’s home.  That is not an easy thing, being a military spouse, and I don’t know how she does it.  Often when she came over, she would immediately curl up in my sweetheart’s lap on the couch for half an hour or so.  Then she would be relaxed enough to enjoy her visit.  My sweetheart could never replace her husband, but thirty minutes of a warm, cuddly body did her a world of good.  She and her husband are the reason that The Holding Company will offer a discount to current and former members of the military and their spouses.

What your funds will do:

License, et al:

First things first!  The Holding Company needs a DBA, business license, and to be incorporated.  All of these things should run $150.  Luckily, I've have some experience with these applications and a guru to turn to if I have questions.

Rent:

The Holding Company will begin in a cozy, economical space, such as a salon suite.  These suites have many advantages – they are turn-key ready, include all utilities, and are in great locations throughout the metro area, such as Carytown, Midlothian and Short Pump, making expansion a more accessible goal.  These lease for $1,000 a month.  We want to raise six months' worth of rent, to know that rent is covered while we grow The Holding Company.  After that, sink or swim, we're on our own!

Website:

You may as well not exist if you're not online these days.  $150 will cover the first year's web hosting and domain registration.  Not only will the site tell you everything you need to know about The Holding Company, but you can also book your appointment from the convenience of your keyboard.

Branding:

We want to look as good as we’ll help you feel, so $500 will go toward having a proper logo designed by a local graphic artist and the printing of business cards, brochures, appointment reminder cards, etc.

Ambiance:

“noun: the character and atmosphere of a place.”  Using our superior price-shopping, bargain-hunting and even sewing and crafting skills, we will create a soothing environment in which to snuggle.  $750 will be used to furnish and decorate the salon, complete with drapes to block harsh light, a temple bell or nature sound alarm clock, a comfy place to sit or lay, and a kettle, mugs and teas.    We'll even have books to read!

Phone:

The business will need a phone and we anticipate a lot of calls, as well as the need to stay connected to email and social networking – like you do.  We're estimating a need of $400 for a mid-range prepaid cell phone and six months of unlimited service.

Insurance:

The Holding Company is going to need liability insurance, a must for every business.  That will cost $1,000 for the year.  We'd like to pay that in full to know that it's set up and out of the way.  As my father once said “We have lawyers today like people in the old west had guns.”

Security:

For the security of everyone involved and to fend off the speculations of prostitution that dog other professional cuddlers, video cameras will be in use during every session.  Thankfully, these days, it only takes a little know how and a trip to Radio Shack to set up a digital camera and recorder.

How We’ll Save Money

A penny saved can indeed be a penny earned, and the more we do with each dollar contributed, the faster we can open for business and get to cuddling.
  • We'll use a computer we already own and open source appointment/customer management software;
  • In-house website design will save hundreds of dollars;
  • I already own several hours worth of soothing instrumental music;
  • You are looking at a bona fide bargain hunter!  If there is a way to save on the things we need, I'll find it.
Also, we have structured the campaign in such a way that we don't need to reach 100% of our target to be able to launch The Holding Company.


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you're not able to make a monetary contribution.  If you still want to help, put the word out about The Holding Company and let your family and friends know about our campaign.  That would be invaluable.  The more people who visit this page, the more contributions we'll receive and the sooner we can start booking sessions!

story:
The Who

I am Marissa Mannella, a recent graduate from Clemson University and current resider in my hometown of Orlando, Florida. Busy as a full-time nanny with my hands and heart full, raising funds to fulfill a calling to serve the Lord in London.  My heart has been heavy yet eager to be present again in Europe since my residing in Milan, Italy a year and a half ago.  Ever since, my mind and heart has continued to ache and desire to be there; to share that there is Hope and Joy in the name of Jesus Christ.  I want to love these people in London as Jesus loves & share His Good News of salvation through Him.  I am filled with excitement to share with you my heart, this ministry, & my calling to go and make disciples.

The City

London is one of the most active and lively cities in the world.  A place where world's top Universities establish their homes, fashion originates leading trends, and over 300 languages and cultures inter-mix, examples of London as the cultural capital of the world, while also stated as the most visited city in the world.

Such a place reaps a lost and wandering disconnect.  Impersonal space between people easily seep root, depth and value can be effortlessly overshadowed by materialism and shallow discourse.  Busyness, indeed, may be the easiest distraction to recognizing and acknowledging realism in the hearts of people.

The Ministry

A space set in the bustling city of London, to slow down and rest haste. A place to gather people and build relationships, sharing love and hope from the One who derives these graces. 

Kahaila is an established and active ministry connecting lives in this artistic district on Brick Lane in East London.  This place has a heart and purpose that runs much deeper than serving specialty coffee, it is a space where community and lifestyle meet. Taking form as a gallery for local artists, leading morning yoga classes, performances by local musicians, poets, and storytellers,  and a uniting of people to recognize and praise the grandeur and glory of our Heavenly Father.

Gathering together as a church community Wednesday nights, we celebrate and share in the truth of the Good News by which Jesus has bestowed the free gift of salvation through faith in Him.  

Kahaila's space is a mark in this grand city, embodying Matthew 5:14, we take form as "light of the world, a city set on a hill that cannot be hidden." 

And may we be so, a place to identify ourselves in and thus protrude the light of Jesus.



The Result

This is a space that recognizes Jesus as the restorer. With truth and life of scripture, we desire to bring restoration to the city of London. 

For there is much restoration to bring. 

There is a flood of broken and wounded hearts, doubts and insecurities reigning and ruling identities, these lies run free and heavy to swarm and drench the lives of people. We must fight the sweep of lies and hurt with the knowledge of truth, the Word of God. 

May our identity be founded in Beauty opposed to brokenness, Hope opposed to doubt, Eternity opposed to earthly, Salvation opposed to destruction. 
Let us stop identifying ourselves by our insecurities, doubts, hurts, and lies that hang upon our heads and reap shame. Hope has come to lift shame and rather root our identity in confidence, restoration, purity, and truth; in Jesus. 

The Help
I will be serving in Kahaila, making coffee and hosting events for local creatives in the community.  Connecting with the lives & hearts of people, sharing the truth and holiness of our Creator, to bring restoration, depth, and hope.

My heart continues to grow heavy in this season of preparedness before departure to this city.  I cannot sustain the work of God without prayer and support. 

Join me in this movement to bring restoration to people of brokenness.






Financial Support

If you are willing and able to support financially and with a heart of joyful giving, I am thankful and excited for the Lord's work with these resources.  My total goal is raising $30,000 for my one year stay and living in London. 

Efforts will specifically support my living and ability to reside; rent, food, visa, transportation, insurance, and other general living expenses.

Prayer Support

I am grateful and eager for such prayers and already said prayers for the Lord to bless and use in His great power and work.  Prayer, being eternal and from God, is the most essential and transcendent way for the Lord to guide, strengthen, and provide for me.  I believe the Lord will also use these prayers to speak specifically to your hearts on how He wants to use your talents, gifts, and resources to give Him glory and honor.  

Pray for me toward the city and the people: 

"That my love will overflow more & more, and that I will keep on growing in knowledge and understanding." Philippians 1:9; As I may tire & grow weary serving in the shop, my eyes will continue to be fixated on Him and work as a genuine-joyful act of prayer and worship;  For boldness & confidence in act and speech of the Holy Spirit; & that I may truly take on the whole armor of God, to be prepared for battle against the spiritual forces of evil and fight with the Word of God.


Let us join in this act of service and restoration together --

"And let us consider how to stir up one another to love and good works, not neglecting to meet together, as is the habit of some, but encouraging one another, and all the more as you see the Day drawing near." Hebrews 10:24-25

story:
PLEASE Click here to contribute

We've lived in Newcastle since we were students and loved it so much we couldn't leave. We are continually inspired by the different, and brilliant, ideas people have to escape the daily grind. One such idea that really grabbed us in Japan, and then London, was the cat café.

We love cats, cafes and cakes, so it was just a perfect concept. We tried it, loved it and thought that the increasing café visiting population of Newcastle must have one as soon as possible. 

We set to work on naming it, which a friend did for us. We laughed a lot, and then thought we really must call it Pretty Pussy Parlour.

Pretty Pussy Parlour is a cat and café experience for busy people that don’t have pets or cat lovers that want more! The Parlour will be a relaxed, comfortable environment for people of all ages to interact with friendly and healthy cats. 

How will it work? Customers will book 1 hour sessions in advance via our website to interact with our family of 12 cats. We’ll serve a great selection of top quality hot drinks (including soup), sandwiches and yummy cakes.

We also plan to have a gift shop in-house and on-line, stocking amazing and exclusive cat related products that we’ve discovered.

What will the Parlour be like ?


What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to raise the £25,000 that'll make Pretty Pussy Parlour come to life. The funds we raise will be exclusively used to renovate the property we've located and to purchase the furniture and kitchen essentials we need.

Renovations will include remodelling the space, installing cat runs and building the additional rooms we need for cats to take time out.

In exchange for funding we're offering a whole range of special perks; free visits to the Parlour, Tea for Two, annual VIP passes and the opportunity to sponsor one of our lovely cats.

Other Ways You Can Help

We love the idea of people getting involved in our project in other ways.

If you think you could help us with any amazing skills you have (we have lots of refurbishment work we need help with!) we'd love to hear from you and have nice perks to offer in exchange.


Press about Pretty Pussy Parlour

Evening Chronicle
The Journal
Cat Channel
Northern Drift
Startups
Get Into Newcastle
BBC Radio Newcastle
The Independent

story:
What Poverty Means To Children

Living in poverty often puts children at greater risk for health issues, lower achievement in school, family problems, mental health issues, crime, drug issues and lower self esteem. Children who live in persistent poverty are more likely to become adults who live in poverty and carry many of the same risks into their adult lives.

Our Vision

We believe that we need to come together and explore new, effective and innovative ways of finding solutions – be they big or small – to the challenges we are facing today. Our vision is to create a world where everyone is empowered to take action for positive environmental and social impact.

We hope to spawn a social movement for creating commons-oriented spaces everywhere, from Africa to Rio de Janeiro and beyond!

Prosperity's Story 

Poverty is an issue that effects billions of people both locally and globally. To combat this we donate a portion of our proceeds to recreational and social development. 

In a democracy, the well-being, individuality and happiness of every citizen is important for the overall prosperity, peace and happiness of the nation.

A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

The origins of Prosperity Apparel begin with the desire to make a difference. Prosperity represents the unique individuality that is expressed through lifestyle, fashion and everyday choices. Focused on creativity and quality, Prosperity crafts up collections that empower people. By purchasing our product your not just being fashionable your also making a difference in some ones life.


Your Impact   

25% of the $100,000 will enable our existing administrative costs to be covered, 75% of the $100,000 will allow us to further our mission by concentrating on: 

  • Targeting housing & development Domestically & Internationally to provide a stable living environment for children & families in poverty. 
  • Aiding in the recreational & education development for underprivileged children facing social economic issues. 
  • Building our Teen Program by expanding the diversity of teens participating, & increasing leadership, training, and learning
  • Developing more sustainable financial support and community partnership programs allowing us to continue to increase the number of children & families served                                                                                                                                     
  • Your impact will aid Prosperity in the growth and sustainment of people in poverty domestically & abroad. Prosperity is committed to thorough, transparent documentation of everything we do, and to supporting projects that could make the world a better place to live in for future generations. We hope to spawn a social movement for creating commons-oriented spaces everywhere, from America, India, to Rio de Janeiro and beyond!

Risks and challenges

All of Prosperity's financial and in-kind resources come from generous people moved by our mission. Our challenge is to secure a stable financial and human resource base to drive the mission well into the future involving more children, teens and serving more families facing serious social economic issues. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people may have difficulty contributing financially. This doesn't mean you can't contribute in some other way. You could either use our Hashtag @ProsperityApparel to shout us out or tell a friend or family member to follow @ProsperityApparel on one of our social media platforms! 

Instagram - @ProsperityClothing

Facebook - ProsperityClothing

Your Impact   



25% of the $100,000 will enable our existing administrative costs to be covered, 75% of the $100,000 will allow us to further our mission by concentrating on: 

Targeting housing & development Domestically & Internationally to provide a stable living environment for children & families in poverty. 
Aiding in the recreational & education development for underprivileged children facing social economic issues. 
Building our Teen Program by expanding the diversity of teens participating, & increasing leadership, training, and learning
Developing more sustainable financial support and community partnership programs allowing us to continue to increase the number of children & families served                                                                                                                                     
Your impact will aid Prosperity in the growth and sustainment of people in poverty domestically & abroad. Prosperity is committed to thorough, transparent documentation of everything we do, and to supporting projects that could make the world a better place to live in for future generations. We hope to spawn a social movement for creating commons-oriented spaces everywhere, from America, India, to Rio de Janeiro and beyond!



Risks and challenges
All of Prosperity's financial and in-kind resources come from generous people moved by our mission. Our challenge is to secure a stable financial and human resource base to drive the mission well into the future involving more children, teens and serving more families facing serious social economic issues. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people may have difficulty contributing financially. This doesn't mean you can't contribute in some other way. You could either use our Hashtag @ProsperityApparel to shout us out or tell a friend or family member to follow @ProsperityApparel on one of our social media platforms! 
Instagram - @ProsperityClothing
Facebook - ProsperityClothing

story:
Why We Need Your Help

Barbell Babes is raising money to help obtain the .com domain. As an early-stage startup and small business, we are not generating enough revenue to cover this cost. Your contribution will help:

  • Barbell Babes obtain the .com domain.
  • Helping to further grow the Barbell Babes community by making Barbell Babes more readily available through the search engine. 

About Barbell Babes

Barbell Babes serves as an online community to help empower women to lift heavy and think positively! Our online community currently consists of:

  • 14.401 followers on Instagram
  • 4,409 followers on Facebook
  • 837 followers on Twitter

Risks & Challenges

Barbell Babes is growing FAST. On Instagram alone, we have about 1,000 new followers a month. We don't want someone to snag the .com domain before we're able to. If someone does, the possibility of affording the domain will not be within our reach.

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Here are several ways you can:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word!
  • Follow us on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter!

story:
Convention Summary

We are the individuals from every walk of life that are committed to protecting life and family from the moment of conception to natural death. We are committed to promoting a culture of life that will overpower and conquer the current culture of death through grassroots efforts on a local, state, and national level through Prayer, Action, Voting, and Education. We will PAVE the way to a ProLife and ProFamily future.
 
By funding our annual Convention, you will be helping to educate thousands within the movement through enabling our scholarship attendance programs to be successful and by making it possible to broadcast the presentation worldwide. 
 
Our 7th Annual Convention has become a national event drawing participants from 13 States, Canada and England.
 

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding to help pay for the 2 day event on March 11th and 12th, which includes supporting the expenses for 18 world class presenters, sponsorship for youth participation and our youth focused training session and the AV capture to audio visual library that becomes available to the prolife community as a timeless resource. 

We have over 60 booths, hundreds of young people in attendance and
nationally known speakers like the Benham Brothers.  Our Convention will pay dividends for generations!

Anyone who contributes to our efforts will become part of the game changing strategy and will have the satisfaction that they are actively supporting the effort to restore a culture of LIFE to our world. 

The Impact

The Impact of your contribution will be that you will be supporting those who are often on the front lines of the pro-life fight. They will be learning from experts in fields ranging from Euthanasia, Assisted Suicide, Pregnancy Centers, Ethics in Medicine & Religion, China's "One Child Policy", Religious Freedom, Media Communication & Adoption. You will be giving these people the tools they need to help save more lives! 

This is our 7th annual event. We continue to build participation year over year.  We have met people who have helped us to create a true national network of workers in the field and we have become a force at the national pro life legislative level, which will help affect our country for years to come.

Risks & Challenges

To address the annual risk we face in meeting our overall goal (which is over $100,000 for the event) the first thing we do is PRAY!  See our online prayer sign up page which helps to ensure we are covered in prayer before and during the event. http://bringingamericabacktolife.org/prayer-page/   We know that God will provide for us, but He does that through people like YOU!
 
We face a huge challenge in raising the funding each year to meet our commitment and rely on the generosity of our national prolife community to help us succeed in this most worthy effort.  We need you to help us meet this challenge. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Although not everyone can afford to give monetarily, if you are local and are able to volunteer, please contact us.  And, of course, anyone can sign up to pray for us.

story:
Hi there, Wes and I are the founders of Farmetta Farm. Etta, in Greek, means small, and that's what we are: a small pasture based livestock farm in mid-coast Maine. We lease, rent, and own a full 80 acres of fields and pastures that we graze our critters on, all within a 2 ½ mile radius of our home. Wes and I (I'm Rose) begun farming together in the spring of ‘09 with a vision of beef, chicken, pork, lamb and eggs from healthy, grass-fed and pasture-raised animals.”


Through the time Wes and I have been farming, we've evolved from “my farm” to “our farm.” What I'm saying is that we realized we needn't take on a large mortgage in order to build our farm; we could build our farm through cooperation with our neighbors. We had great opportunities in our back yard; we just needed to ask the neighbors, can we graze our animals on your fields? Some said no; others were thrilled - that's how we began our relationship with Reid Woodbury.


Reid retired from dairy farming in the fall of 2013. Reid didn't want to see his fields, old stanchion barn, milk room, and equipment, become overgrown or to rust with disuse, and that's where we come in.  We'd been searching for a place to either buy or lease, with a barn and other needed infrastructure; now we've got it! Wes and I signed a long-term lease with Reid with the option to buy.


When Wes, Reid and I started discussions on collaborating, the two primary pieces for Wes and myself are first, a barn for animals, feed, and other needs; and second and equally important, a space in which to build a commercial kitchen for me.


Wes and I are here at this perfect junction, looking for financial partners like you to help us move up to the next level of growth.  We are ready. We've built a great customer base, taken business classes to strengthen our business savvy, and signed our lease with Reid. We researched the market (which, by the way, is ripe for the picking!).  We are ready for this next level of growth, and, with a little help from folks like you, we can do it!  


Let me tell you about the commercial kitchen, so near and dear to my heart. Finally, I can create new product lines to sell to our customers. I’ve wanted a kitchen for as long as Wes and I have been farming together…in all honesty, I can taste it! This not only will enable us to create value with the meats and bones that don’t sell; it also allows us a steady income stream during the colder months, helping to strengthen our financial backbone. We’ll be able to create jobs as our markets grow, helping our community and strengthening our local economy.


Our budget for the kitchen is as follows:

Kitchen construction/retrofit -  8, 000.

Tilt Skillet and 6 burner stove – 4,700.

Heat pump – 2,700.

Refrigeration - 2,500.

Sinks: three bay, prep and hand washing - 1,270.

Kitchen utensils, pots and pans - 445.

Lids, containers and labels – 385.


As Forrest Pritchard so aptly said in his book Gaining Ground, “The family farm will continue as long as its existence is valued. There is strength in a family, and balance. The earth appears to respond to these things. And who is to say what defines a family? Certainly not me. My best attempt at a definition would be to suggest a congregation of like-minded hearts.


Saving the family farm will forever be a process, not a goal or destination. Like any necessary chore, the work never ends. It only waits for us the following morning, or the following season. So I wake and enter the day. “


I hope that you share in our vision to bring this opportunity to fruition as we continue to work on our 21st century family farm. You can be a part of the change by helping Farmetta Farm achieve our goal.


Our campaign will be fast so that we can move forward on the kitchen starting in early April; if you can, please help by spreading the word about Wes and my campaign. Indiegogo’s share tools make this super easy! Any extra money that we raise will be used to buy a breeding sow and Jersey cow.

A special thanks goes out to our friends Angel Farris, Patricia Shea Designs, James Strickland, Jessica Falconer, Katie Jepson, and Taylor .  

Cheers, thank you & happy eating! Rose Rapp & Wes Soper

story:
Short Summary - Rhythm of the Rein is a therapeutic riding program that, along with many other populations with disabilities served, hosts an Equine Services for Veterans program (formerly known as Horses for Heroes).  Vermont is a small and rural state that has sent a disproportionate number of guardsmen and women overseas to combat. Mallory Lewis, daughter of Shari Lewis, the creator of the iconic sock puppet Lamb Chop, is a staunch supporter of our military and will give a FREE show to the military veterans & their families, but we need to raise $3,000.00 for airfare and expenses while she is here. If we fall short of our goal we will just keep fundraising - if we surpass our goal the money will just enhance scholarships we can offer. 

  Our veterans often slip through the cracks once they get home, and supports they need are not always readily accessible. We offer them a holistic, healing experience at NO COST to them. Please watch the vimeo documentary done by retired navy SEAL  Robert Foley. He is a voice the veterans can connect to and so eloquently brings to life the amazing healing power of horses. Our mission is to bring his voice to veterans, allow them to experience  healing with horses, and then have them connect with their brothers and sisters and share their experiences with them to help THEM with THEIR healing process.  We know this works - the veteran pictured on his horse with the American flag frankly admits he was close to suicide himself and if not for our program he would not be here today. He was over 60 when he first got on a horse's back - as he says - "horses literally saved my life." You can watch his story that ran on Channel 22 news through this link -  

 http://www.mychamplainvalley.com/sitesearchq=rhythm%20of%20the%20rein

Help others attain the same. If you cannot contribute at this time at least help by spreading the word and encouraging others who can help us fund this venture. We never have failures, just detours.

Learn more about us at www.rhythmoftherein.org 

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Breaking down the barriers to accessing Technology

Technology is a great enabler. It puts the power in the hands of people who need it the most, changing their lives for the better. That's why we are embarking on the largest global Citizen Science initiative to eradicate poverty.


Beacon is undertaking an audacious mission to transform the lives of people in deprived communities and those who are most vulnerable in society. We aim to empower each person we reach through BEACON with the skills and capabilities to solve the personal challenges they face, whether it be a mother in Sudan struggling to feed her family or a young person who is homeless who faces an uncertain future and needs the support to help them find employment. We aim to do this through supplying technology based kits, gadgets and educational resources to supply sources of electricity, energy, food and health services to deprived communities around the world who need it the most.

Every child and adult has the basic human right to have access to technology that can provide them with food security, energy security, a comfortable home, fresh clean drinking water and sanitation. The BEACON project aims to change the status quo and make a valuable impact to improve the lives of millions of people around the world through simple, innovative technologies. And we need your help to do this!


2.5 Billion people live without sanitation and safe 

drinking water

In the 21st century, half of the world's population lives in poverty, 1 billion of which are children. Families are forced to send their children out to work and vulnerable people are shipped into slave labour. Hunger is the number 1 cause of death in the world, killing more than HIV/AIDS, malaria, and tuberculosis combined. These shocking statistics represent a failure to provide modern day solutions to common problems which can be solved quite simply though technology and innovation.

Breaking down the barriers to accessing Technology 

Technology is central to everything in our modern lives yet the majority of the world's population live in poverty without basic access to clean drinking water, food, health care or education. We believe that technology can improve people's lives and give them limitless opportunities to help them achieve their personal aspirations. Yet access to basic technology is a challenge in developing countries and to vulnerable people in developed countries. 


Who we are

We are a team of social entrepreneurs, technology developers, scientists and educators who have come together through our work with deprived communities and vulnerable groups. We have seen first hand the difference technology makes to people's lives, in how simple basic tools and knowledge can guide disaster relief efforts and rebuild communities in war torn regions.  Quite simply, technology can innovatively solve a range of challenges we face in today's turbulent society.


The Problem

Deprived communities exist in both developed and developing nations. In developing nations more than a billion people still do not have access to electricity, and cannot access a reliable source of energy. The conflict of war and an increase in extreme weather through climate change has forced millions to loose their homes and seek refuge with no financial security. A global crisis in modern times, we are faced as a society with complex issues which need to be urgently addressed. 


The Solution

BEACON will act as the catalyst of change in the way that we approach technology in breaking down the barriers to technology access and helping communities and vulnerable groups break the cycle of deprivation. We will create a global network of supporters who will focus their efforts in using technology and innovation to address society's greatest challenges, and provide universal access to technology for those in deprived communities. By developing technology kits, tools, apps and educational resources and distributing these to communities who need sources of energy, food and health services, we will provide solutions to the every day challenges that people in the developing world face. It will be through this mass collaborative effort that we will bring about change and eradicate poverty.


The Multiplier Effect - Seeds of Change

We work directly with communities and vulnerable individuals to help them change their lives. We plant the seeds of change by empowering communities and individuals with the tools to be able to change their lives for the better.


We aim to follow a four pillar approach to tackling the problem:  

Pillar 1: Create an army of supporters who share our vision and will act as "Beacons of Change" to shine light on social issues to help us achieve our goals. Through undertaking a variety of challenges, supporters will acts as Citizen Social Scientists, bringing together a variety of personal skills and ideas that will change to world and bring solutions.

Pillar 2: Develop simple technological tools, Apps, and existing technology to distribute kits, resources, items and educational materials to communities and vulnerable individuals to help them alleviate deprivation and poverty. Education is at the heart of everything we do, after all, learning is a life long journey! By empowering citizens with technical capabilities they can use their knowledge to overcome their personal and community challenges. 

Pillar 3: Build a community of trainers and community spaces who can provide support in each of their regions. Every person trained will be embodied with the capabilities and skills to train others in their communities and pass on the knowledge they have. Creating a multiplier effect, hundreds of thousands of people will be trained year on year to be able to help their communities fight depravation and receive the support through our mentorship and ambassador programme to do so, along with the support of the larger BEACON community. Through developing a global network of community hubs in makerspaces, science centres, museums, art galleries, libraries and community spaces, citizens regardless of age will be able to pick up new skills, learn practically anything, and use their new found capabilities to improve their lives.

Pillar 4: Mentor and Ambassador programme

Develop a Mentor and Ambassador programme where supporters volunteer their time to support the BEACON programme and pair up with individuals and communities to help them solve their problems and gain the necessary means to improve their lives. 



How its going to work:

We will break down the barriers to accessing technology for development. When we speak of technology it needn't be expensive or complex, the simplest of tools can be powerfully effective. For example, the Zeer pot is an earthenware cooling system which can preserve food for up to two weeks and is revolutionising lives in desert regions. It has since been adopted by communities in Africa as a way to keep food fresh and has improved the lives of thousands of people. And all through a simple technique using traditional pre-existing tools, gadgets, and kits that can be used in the most arid, extreme conditions. We have picked out a number of innovative technologies that will improve people's lives on a number of levels. Each technology is low cost, low maintenance and easy to use by everyone from the youngest of children to the adults.

Providing education and training to communities to engage people of all ages is the key to empowering citizens with skills and the capabilities they need to benefit their everyday lives. 



Classroom in a Box

We have developed a series of education resources to create "Classroom in a box" to provide educators and learners with hands-on practical learning activities. Each box contains learning materials translated into the regional language by our extensive network of BEACON supporters. The learning resources have been developed by groups of teachers for educators and have been tried and tested by students all over the world. Using a STEAM approach (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Mathematics), learners gain technical skills and knowledge through a range of practical, hands-on activities. The learning materials take a problem solving, inquiry based learning approach. Subject topics include:

  • Science
  • Technology
  • Engineering
  • Mathematics
  • Reading, Writing and Language skills
  • Coding
  • Robotics
  • Creativity 
  • Traditional arts, crafts and design indigenous to the community's region


Through our existing network we will distribute educational resources to schools to provide them with books, learning materials and fun activities. Where schools don't exist and children are working to support their families we will work with partner organisations to develop education programmes to found schools in those regions so that children have the chance to receive an education.
The education programme helps individuals develop vital knowledge and skills, work as a team, gain self-esteem and confidence. A dedicated web portal is being  developed to provide a database of lesson plans, projects, tools, DIY Kits, and technology curricula. Educators and students can mix and match activities from different subject topics to suit their needs.



Makerspaces as Community Learning and Training Hubs

In 2014, together with a number of partner organisations, the BEACON team established the Destination Discovery Network, a global consortium of Makerspaces, Museums, Science Centres, Educators, technologists and developers. Our core aim is to make science and technology accessible to all and we see this as a vital step in opening up access to education and training.  By establishing Makerspaces in community used spaces, communities can learn, gain new skills, develop their own businesses and use tools which were previously inaccessible to them. By bringing community members together to work collaboratively with support from organisations, we will create a technology literate society, empowering citizens to overcome their personal challenges.


Mentor and Ambassador Programme

We invite our supporters to join our Mentor and Ambassador programme, who act as our vanguard for engaging with communities. Our mentors and ambassadors come from a wide range of backgrounds and sectors bringing their own unique expertise and insight. By providing mentoring and positive experiences for vulnerable people the mentors guide individuals on their path to reach their aspirations. BEACON Ambassadors are often individuals who have received support from the programme and want to join to give something back and support the work being done in their region. They understand their regions problems and provide a much needed voice in local matters, where working with local authorities and communities. Support is given to mentors and ambassadors through our training programme, where participants have the opportunity to expand on their skills.

We seek to create a global movement to use technology for the benefit of all. It sounds like a ginormous task but its audaciousness lies in its simplicity!

Of course we can not do this alone and we are building partnerships with like minded organisations to support the continued efforts of fighting poverty and social deprivation. 

Kits, Gadgets and Technological Tools

Our team have handpicked a number of existing technological gadgets, tools and resources that are gamechangers in bringing food, energy and health security to millions of people around the world. Here is our favourite top five,our kits and resources are growing all the time and the list of kits and resources is available here.
Perhaps there is something that we haven't thought of yet that you can contribute to and hit us with your amazing idea or solution? Our strength lies in our vibrant community and the ideas and innovations they bring. We like to think outside the box and hit a challenge from every angle so every idea helps!


1. Little Sun Light

This pretty little solar lantern looks dainty but can supply light for up to 5 hours once charged. It works by using solar cells to power a light source and can be worn as a pendant, fixed to a bike or used as a night time reading light source. It has been a hit in both developed and developing nations and is helping micro businesses reach new customers through its sale as a product that not only looks great, but is sturdy and powerful.


2. Zeer Pot Fridge

In hot climates, food doesn't stay fresh for long, with no means of preserving food, poverty stricken families battle hunger on a daily basis. A Zeer pot is an evaporative cooled used in rural Africa and the Middle East to keep vegetables, meat and cereals fresh. They consist of two terra cotta pots, one nested inside the other, with sand placed inbetween the gap between the the pots. The trick is to keep the sand damp and to pour water onto the sand twice a day to keep the pots cool. Through water evaporating from the sand the temperature inside the pot is kept at a lower temperature, keeping the food fresher for longer. This simple technique allows communities to use materials which are natural to their traditions and can really help their daily lives. 


3. Ceramic Water Filters
Ceramic filters are flowerpot shaped and made from a porous ceramic material. Water is poured into a ceramic pot filter and percolate through the pot material where it is collected by a second container. A colloidal silver coating is added to the ceramic filter to add to the effectiveness of the filter.  The ceramic filter removes the harmful bacteria and parasites, and can be manufactured locally, making it sustainable and minimal resources required.


4. Bottle of Light

What do you get with sunshine and an old plastic bottle filled with water and chlorine? A 55-watt solar bulb that refracts sunlight! Its powerful enough to light up a home during daylight hours, environmentally friendly and inexpensive to make. The Liter of Light began in the Philippines where the movement has brightened up 28,000 homes and  the lives of 70,000 people in Manila alone. Now we plan to spread the work of this amazing initiative and take it to areas where the cost of running light during the daytime can be reduced.  With the addition of solar panels the bulb can be used at night time also.


5. Rainwater Harvesting Kits
Rainwater catchment and storage reservoirs have been constructed since ancient times in several parts of the world. Rainwater is harvested as it runs over natural ground, roofs and catchment areas. In tropical islands rain water is the only source of domestic water. As clean water becomes scarce, ad in times where extreme weather hits towns and causes flooding, water supplies become infected and a source of clean water is needed immediately. We will be distributing Rainwater Harvesting Kits to areas devastated by flooding and drought hit regions.


What we plan to do with the money raised here

We will focus on using the funding raised in our campaign to fund our three main areas of work:

Education

Develop technology kits and printed teaching materials to be distributed to schools worldwide who lack teaching resources. Up till now we have relied on donated books and resources yet we need a way to get those resources sent out to individual groups. Every £20 raised supports a family to keep their child in education and receive a meal each day.


Build a community of trainers 

Our network spans across 70 countries around the world, and our community is expanding by the day. To support the training of 1000 Teachers, Educators, and Ambassadors will cost £75,000 at £150 per training session. Our trained ambassadors and teachers will then go onto train others in their regions, thus impacting thousands more people in the process.


Create a global hub of Makerspaces for Learning and Training

We will partner with a range of organisations to establish a global hub of makerspaces for community learning and training. Each community will have ownership of their makerspace which will be open to all members of the community regardless of age and gender. 


Develop Technology Kits and resources to distribute to communities around the World 

We plan to send technology kits, and much needed resources out to communities  around the world. Our team of ambassadors and supporters will focus on supporting their local communities in implementing the technology and building the infrastructure to last for generations to come. £225,000 will be used to build the technology kits, source low cost materials from suppliers and distribute the kits and resources. 


Ways you can Help

Choose a Challenge, join a team, and implement the 

solution in your region.

By opening up a set of Challenges to be met and inviting you to propose your ideas and concepts of providing solutions, we will create some amazing and end global poverty as a society!
We will add ideas for Challenges to be met here on the campaign page so that everyone can contribute to the global conversation.

Join our Referrals Contest and win great prizes!

We are creating a BEACON Street Team to raise awareness of our crowdfunding campaign and the launch of the BEACON Community Network. The first 3 people  who can get the highest number of visititors to our page will win :
  • A VIP Pass to the Cosmica Technology Festival and mingle backstage with celebrity speakers from the world of music, technology and science
  • Some cool merchandise including BEACON CommunityT-shirts, 3D printed phonecase, pendants, LED light up wearable technology and baseball cap
  • A 3D Printer courtesy of Ultimaker 
  • A Google Hangout with our sponsors and endorsers
  • The chance to meet our Mentors and Ambassadors team, including astronauts, experts from the technology industry, technologists and futurists
We think that's quite an amazing prize, you couldn't get cooler than that!

To participate in our Referrals Contest all you need to do is the following:

1. Set up an Indiegogo account by clicking here, and then once you are finished return back to this page.

2. At the top of this page you will notice the share buttons, you can either share the campaign through social media or use the Link Button to generate your unique web link that points to this page. This link will help us to ensure we register that you are the referred person to this page. By using these specific links we can track each of your referrals, so be sure to use them!

3. Each time you share the campaign with these links we will track them and create a chart. We will provide regular updates on who is in the lead with the current rankings provided in our campaign updates.

4. The person who provides the most visits to this page will be helping spread the word about our campaign and the vision of what we are trying to achieve. Not only will you win a great set of prizes but you will be helping people worldwide to gain access to education and skills. Be part of something amazing and help us spread the message!

5. There will be ten runners up prizes of merchandise and 3D printed goodies along with a batch of wearable technology products from Adafruit.



We understand that you may not be in a position to support our campaign financially but you can support the campaign by joining our growing community and spread the word. 

You can also help in lots and lots of other ways!:

- SHARE THE CAMPAIGN LINK: http://igg.me/p/beacon-empowering-communities-through-technology/x/8915773

- TWEET using the button at the top of our campaign, TAG @BeaconTechLabs  Hashtag #Beaconnetwork

- Post about it on Instagram! 

- BLOG about it and share the link to our campaign page with your friends and subscribers! Link back to: 

- PIN this campaign on Pinterest!

- Share on Google+!

- Post a video about it on YouTube! Or share our video with your YouTube channel subscribers! 

- Post on Tumblr!

- Share this story with your local media friends! TV! Radio! Print! Social!

- LinkedIn! Redditt! Flickr! StumbleUpon!

- Tell people who are passionate about education and eradicating poverty about this campaign, the more noise we make, the more people we can reach!
story_txt:
Breaking down the barriers to accessing Technology

 Technology is a great enabler. It puts the power in the hands of people who need it the most, changing their lives for the better. That's why we are embarking on the largest global Citizen Science initiative to eradicate poverty.

Beacon is undertaking an audacious mission to transform the lives of people in deprived communities and those who are most vulnerable in society. We aim to empower each person we reach through BEACON with the skills and capabilities to solve the personal challenges they face, whether it be a mother in Sudan struggling to feed her family or a young person who is homeless who faces an uncertain future and needs the support to help them find employment. We aim to do this through supplying technology based kits, gadgets and educational resources to supply sources of electricity, energy, food and health services to deprived communities around the world who need it the most.
Every child and adult has the basic human right to have access to technology that can provide them with food security, energy security, a comfortable home, fresh clean drinking water and sanitation. The BEACON project aims to change the status quo and make a valuable impact to improve the lives of millions of people around the world through simple, innovative technologies. And we need your help to do this!

2.5 Billion people live without sanitation and safe 
drinking water

In the 21st century, half of the world's population lives in poverty, 1 billion of which are children. Families are forced to send their children out to work and vulnerable people are shipped into slave labour. Hunger is the number 1 cause of death in the world, killing more than HIV/AIDS, malaria, and tuberculosis combined. These shocking statistics represent a failure to provide modern day solutions to common problems which can be solved quite simply though technology and innovation.

Breaking down the barriers to accessing Technology 
Technology is central to everything in our modern lives yet the majority of the world's population live in poverty without basic access to clean drinking water, food, health care or education. We believe that technology can improve people's lives and give them limitless opportunities to help them achieve their personal aspirations. Yet access to basic technology is a challenge in developing countries and to vulnerable people in developed countries. 



Who we are
We are a team of social entrepreneurs, technology developers, scientists and educators who have come together through our work with deprived communities and vulnerable groups. We have seen first hand the difference technology makes to people's lives, in how simple basic tools and knowledge can guide disaster relief efforts and rebuild communities in war torn regions.  Quite simply, technology can innovatively solve a range of challenges we face in today's turbulent society.

The Problem

Deprived communities exist in both developed and developing nations. In developing nations more than a billion people still do not have access to electricity, and cannot access a reliable source of energy. The conflict of war and an increase in extreme weather through climate change has forced millions to loose their homes and seek refuge with no financial security. A global crisis in modern times, we are faced as a society with complex issues which need to be urgently addressed. 


The Solution

BEACON will act as the catalyst of change in the way that we approach technology in breaking down the barriers to technology access and helping communities and vulnerable groups break the cycle of deprivation. We will create a global network of supporters who will focus their efforts in using technology and innovation to address society's greatest challenges, and provide universal access to technology for those in deprived communities. By developing technology kits, tools, apps and educational resources and distributing these to communities who need sources of energy, food and health services, we will provide solutions to the every day challenges that people in the developing world face. It will be through this mass collaborative effort that we will bring about change and eradicate poverty.

The Multiplier Effect - Seeds of Change
We work directly with communities and vulnerable individuals to help them change their lives. We plant the seeds of change by empowering communities and individuals with the tools to be able to change their lives for the better.




We aim to follow a four pillar approach to tackling the problem:  
Pillar 1: Create an army of supporters who share our vision and will act as "Beacons of Change" to shine light on social issues to help us achieve our goals. Through undertaking a variety of challenges, supporters will acts as Citizen Social Scientists, bringing together a variety of personal skills and ideas that will change to world and bring solutions.
Pillar 2: Develop simple technological tools, Apps, and existing technology to distribute kits, resources, items and educational materials to communities and vulnerable individuals to help them alleviate deprivation and poverty. Education is at the heart of everything we do, after all, learning is a life long journey! By empowering citizens with technical capabilities they can use their knowledge to overcome their personal and community challenges. 
Pillar 3: Build a community of trainers and community spaces who can provide support in each of their regions. Every person trained will be embodied with the capabilities and skills to train others in their communities and pass on the knowledge they have. Creating a multiplier effect, hundreds of thousands of people will be trained year on year to be able to help their communities fight depravation and receive the support through our mentorship and ambassador programme to do so, along with the support of the larger BEACON community. Through developing a global network of community hubs in makerspaces, science centres, museums, art galleries, libraries and community spaces, citizens regardless of age will be able to pick up new skills, learn practically anything, and use their new found capabilities to improve their lives.
Pillar 4: Mentor and Ambassador programme
Develop a Mentor and Ambassador programme where supporters volunteer their time to support the BEACON programme and pair up with individuals and communities to help them solve their problems and gain the necessary means to improve their lives. 





How its going to work:
We will break down the barriers to accessing technology for development. When we speak of technology it needn't be expensive or complex, the simplest of tools can be powerfully effective. For example, the Zeer pot is an earthenware cooling system which can preserve food for up to two weeks and is revolutionising lives in desert regions. It has since been adopted by communities in Africa as a way to keep food fresh and has improved the lives of thousands of people. And all through a simple technique using traditional pre-existing tools, gadgets, and kits that can be used in the most arid, extreme conditions. We have picked out a number of innovative technologies that will improve people's lives on a number of levels. Each technology is low cost, low maintenance and easy to use by everyone from the youngest of children to the adults.
Providing education and training to communities to engage people of all ages is the key to empowering citizens with skills and the capabilities they need to benefit their everyday lives. 






Classroom in a Box
We have developed a series of education resources to create "Classroom in a box" to provide educators and learners with hands-on practical learning activities. Each box contains learning materials translated into the regional language by our extensive network of BEACON supporters. The learning resources have been developed by groups of teachers for educators and have been tried and tested by students all over the world. Using a STEAM approach (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Mathematics), learners gain technical skills and knowledge through a range of practical, hands-on activities. The learning materials take a problem solving, inquiry based learning approach. Subject topics include:


Science

Technology

Engineering

Mathematics

Reading, Writing and Language skills

Coding

Robotics

Creativity 

Traditional arts, crafts and design indigenous to the community's region





Through our existing network we will distribute educational resources to schools to provide them with books, learning materials and fun activities. Where schools don't exist and children are working to support their families we will work with partner organisations to develop education programmes to found schools in those regions so that children have the chance to receive an education.

The education programme helps individuals develop vital knowledge and skills, work as a team, gain self-esteem and confidence. A dedicated web portal is being  developed to provide a database of lesson plans, projects, tools, DIY Kits, and technology curricula. Educators and students can mix and match activities from different subject topics to suit their needs.

story:
*Campaign Update* 

We didn't make our goal  for this campaign...but 52 amazing people supported this effort and their contributions will still go towards making this project a reality!

You can still contribute to this project by buying tickets to the Chicken and Waffles Restaurant Build-Out Launch Party & Main Street Benefit on April 30. Get your tickets to this groundbreaking event here.


Our Story

Downtown Richmond is coming alive!  Home to the historic Winters Building and the East Bay Center for Performing Arts, Kaiser Hospital, BART, and the Metro Walk Transit Village, Downtown Richmond is bouncing back—returning to its roots as a thriving commercial district that was home to a diverse mix of businesses including movie theaters, department stores, small mom-and-pop shops, and restaurants. 

Richmond Main Street is proud to be working in partnership with Home of Chicken and Waffles to bring a family-style sit down restaurant to the new BART parking garage on Macdonald Avenue.  In addition to Chicken and Waffles, we also have the opportunity to support the build out of the entire 10,000 square feet of raw retail space with a café and coffee shop. 


Challenges & Vision

For far too long Downtown Richmond has had little to no investment to support the   development projects that are vital to the economic development of the city. Additionally, there is still much work needed to build the critical mass of support from outside our city. Restaurants and retail businesses are crucial components of a healthy, vibrant neighborhood, creating jobs and tax revenue that benefit the entire community.

No more is it okay for residents of central Richmond to travel miles outside the core of their city for a good, wholesome meal.  No more is it okay to deny residents the services they need and force them to spend their dollars in neighboring cities. 

We believe that Richmond residents deserve the services that these businesses will bring to our district.  But we can't do it without your help.


The Project

Monies raised from this campaign will be used to fund the first phase (electrical and plumbing) of the large-scale tenant improvements needed to transform this raw space into a beautiful sit-down restaurant.  


This campaign will give our historic Downtown the boost it needs to begin creating a viable district with arts, entertainment, and wholesome food which has been the plea from this long under-served community. 


Your Impact

By investing in this campaign, you will be supporting a community that has been under-served, neglected, and forgotten. Become a backer and together we can rebuild Downtown.  


How You Can Help

  • Make a contribution! 
  • Invite your friends to join our campaign
  • Share it on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and other social media
  • Tell the world about #ChickenWafflesDowntownRichmond

Who We Are

The Richmond Main Street Initiative, Inc. is a community-based nonprofit corporation dedicated to revitalizing historic Downtown Richmond as a pedestrian-friendly urban village, offering products, services, arts, and entertainment that reflect the community’s rich and diverse heritage.

With over a decade of experience working to revitalize Downtown, we are uniquely qualified to help C&W achieve this goal.  In 2012, we successfully rallied city government, property and business owners, residents and other community partners to support our work to form the only Property Business Improvement District in the city of Richmond. 

We continue to make significant impact bringing nearly 15,000 visitors Downtown last year to enjoy activities and events including:

Weekly Farmers' Market
Healthy Village Farm Stand events
Art Reception and Exhibits
Music on the Main Concerts
Spirit & Soul  Festival
Small Business Bootcamp and Workshops
Annual Downtown Holiday Festival

Your Impact

By investing in this campaign, you will be supporting a community that has been under-served, neglected, and forgotten. Become a backer and together we can rebuild Downtown.  

How You Can Help

Make a contribution! 
Invite your friends to join our campaign
Share it on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and other social media
Tell the world about #ChickenWafflesDowntownRichmond


Who We Are





The
 Richmond Main Street Initiative, Inc. is a community-based nonprofit 
corporation dedicated to revitalizing historic Downtown Richmond as a 
pedestrian-friendly urban village, offering products, services, arts, 
and entertainment that reflect the community’s rich and diverse 
heritage.



With over a decade of experience working to revitalize Downtown, we are uniquely qualified to help C&W achieve this goal.  In 2012, we successfully rallied city government, property and business owners, residents and other community partners to support our work to form the only Property Business Improvement District in the city of Richmond. 
We continue to make significant impact bringing nearly 15,000 visitors Downtown last year to enjoy activities and events including:


Weekly Farmers' Market

Healthy Village Farm Stand events

Art Reception and Exhibits

Music on the Main Concerts

Spirit & Soul  Festival

Small Business Bootcamp and Workshops

Annual Downtown Holiday Festival

story:
Six great years ago a small group of people got together in Austin, Texas to discuss the possibilities of creating a free, radical celebration during the month of Pride in which to honor the courageousness of the Stonewall riots and to challenge the corporate heteronormative structures of Gay Pride celebrations within our community and around the globe.

The hard work from this small team of queers paid off and a celebration was born called QUEERBOMB, taking place every year on the first weekend of June with a free rally and procession through the downtown streets of Austin, Texas.

We have definitely grown in size from the first QUEERBOMB drop here in Austin, Texas and the costs to put on the event have only sky rocketed. Each year we face increased fees from vendors and the city, and the resources needed to accommodate a growing community, within a rapidly growing city, increases as well. It becomes a larger financial challenge each year for us to maintain true to our mission which is to create a free, all inclusive, all ages, corporate free and sponsorship free event. In order to put on this year's QUEERBOMB we need your help in the form of a donation.

Your much needed donations will go towards :

-City fees and permits.

-Austin Police Department fees.

-Rental Fees for the space.

-Insurance for the entire event.

-Tables for all non profit Outreach.

-Walkie Talkies for Rally and Procession.

-Sound System and Lighting.

-Porta Potties (muy importante!!).

-Stage for Rally.

-Press / posters, flyers, wheat-pasting materials.

-Wristbands for all underage participants.

-Set up and strike crew.

With an expected attendance of 7000 or more this year, we are stanked and ret to roll this rally and procession out with the community standing strong and proud and fully decorated.

We greatly need your help in order to supply Austin with a free, safe, and all ages space to celebrate our radical pride. This is your celebration. You are the community. You are QUEERBOMB. Join the ranks and let's light the fuse together!

story:
The Impact

At OutpostCo our goal is not only to comfortably immerse people in wilderness, but to create a net positive company in doing so.  

What does net positive mean?

Like all attractive ideas, its essence is simple. Businesses have impacts on the environment and society. Some are negative, some positive. For a company to be net positive, the latter need to outweigh the former. To put it another way: the natural world and society should be better off with a net positive company than without one... or so the theory says.

The OutpostCo camp in Temagami is located in some of the worlds last and largest ancient old growth white pine forest.  In order to  better understand and preserve this dwindling wilderness OutpostCo is aiming to host experts from the Faculty of Forestry to come and obtain much needed metrics and mapping of this incredible and endangered last of its kind forest, and to evaluate how a conservation tourism business  can have a net positive affect.

Your donations will enable us to obtain needed data sets on the forest, ensure  work for local indigenous people  and facilitate the integration of their knowledge with that of the researchers  .  Because knowing what we have and where we want to be will tell us what needs to be done.

At its core Outpost Co. is a way for people to connect to nature in a comfortable and simple way. 

With this funding we hope to  promote and maintain the health of the ancient and endangered white pine forest in Temagami with the help of evidence based science, your support and a net positive model of Eco-Tourism.

As John Muir once said: "The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness."



Risks & Challenges

All worthwhile pursuits have their hurdles and challenges.  The greatest challenge for OutpostCo is to bring more people who are passionate about wilderness to our camp so that they can partake first hand in the preservation and furthering the understanding of this Ancient forest.  

Creating a totally off the grid, mobile canvas eco lodge in a logistically challenging area, while staying true to our goal of being net positive is another great challenge that will take time and hopefully become a model for the industry. 

Thus far we have proven that we can deliver a top notch experience and have created jobs for some of the local indigenous peoples.  Our hope is that through your help we can grow this little operation and continue to foster economic growth for the indigenous people of the area as well as contributing to the understanding of  this unique environment.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help us financially, your help is alway appreciated by just helping us get the word out about OutpostCo. and our work in creating a net-positive eco tourism business in the heart of Temagami's Ancient forest.
