story:
Who am I?

Hey, my name is Shengwei Zhao and I graduated from the University of Pennsylvania with a Master of Science in Telecommunications and Networking Engineering in May, 2014. 

You are curious about who I am.

I may be an unsuccessful stand-up comedian.


I could be the "Superman" you are looking for.


I might be an "unorthodox" magician.


I ask myself the same question.

I am a social entrepreneur currently working on my social venture Tao For Good. 

I am very grateful for my parents and have the inner drive to help women like my mom and children like me to have better opportunities to fulfill their potential. 

Tao For Good has been my  personal project for almost a year. I had this idea when I participated in the Clinton Global Initiative University in March 2014. I built the project from scratch and launched the first version of Tao For Good a week ago to test out the idea.

What is Tao For Good?

Tao For Good is a charitable crowd-funding shopping platform dedicated to giving back to humanity. Our goal is to foster social change through e-commerce business and become the marketplace for products with social missions all around the world.

Our mission is to improve women and children's well-being and provide more and better educational opportunities. We raise money for non-profit organizations we partner with that enact change. 

We help validated organizations and individuals launch cause-based fundraising campaigns relevant to our mission by contributing a portion of each purchase from our customers to the cause. We will create a sustainable social business model to achieve our mission and have a positive impact with our customers and non-profit partners.

Many social ventures which sell local or handmade products are local and sporadic and it's hard for them to reach a global audience. Tao For Good wants to build a global marketplace for these products with social missions and generate steady revenue streams for small and local nonprofit organizations which always have difficulty raising funding for their impact activities. 

What other people say about me and Tao For Good? 

“Tao For Good is an excellent platform for us to offer original and quality art-work to citizens in USA. Shengwei & we share the same values of giving first and his venture’s commitment to promoting social enterprises makes him a trustworthy partner,” said Gaurav, Co-founder of SHURUA(R)T, an e-commerce start-up based out of Varanasi, India. He currently sells his art works on Tao For Good. “Tao for Good is a much needed venture that has potential to positively transform thousands of women and self-help groups around the world by empowering them through a platform that is focused on promoting their efforts”

“This crowdfunding initiative is so exciting for us,” said Joel Duah, Founder and CEO of Mobile Health Consult in Ghana, “We very look forward to partnering with Tao For Good to improve the health of Ghanaians through preventive measures and early diagnostics.”

What's this campaign for?

I want to continue to work on Tao For Good. Working remotely can minimize my living expense and get this project going. The cost is $589 per month to live and work remotely in Bangalore, India (data from https://nomadlist.com/bangalore-india#region=in...). The money raised will help me develop the website, reach more people, set up the team, select more local/handmade products with social missions and help other nonprofit organizations. 


The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step

During the time of my working and traveling, I will visit other social entrepreneurs anywhere in the world. I will learn about their initiatives and ventures on the ground. I will use videos, photos, case studies and other ways to document my experience. I will share my experiences and lessons online. This is a great opportunity for me to expand my own thinking, build stronger networks, and learn from others in the field. 

I have learned a lot from past programs and projects I am involved in like Clinton Global Initiative University, Penn Social Impact House and Starting Bloc etc. The journey enables me to observe and interact with these successful social entrepreneurs and ventures and share what I gain with the community. 

Thank you for your support!

Should you have any question about the campaign, feel free to email me at shengwei@taoforgood.com

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Check the latest blog "A Hodgepodge of Goodness and Interview with Co-Founder, Shengwei Zhao" by Thammika Songkaeo to learn more about Tao For Good.

Here is the gist:

Q: First, why is the store called "Tao for Good?"

A: “Tao" has two meanings. First, it comes from Taoism which represents our spirit. Second, in Chinese, "Tao" means "buy". So "Tao For Good" is a good combination of our functionality and spirit.


Q: When did you start working on this project?

A: I had this idea when I attended Clinton Global Initiative University (CGI U) 2014, which took place on March 21-23, 2014 at Arizona State University. Since then, I have been trying to make it happen.


Q: How has this project evolved?

A: It definitely has evolved a lot, especially the business aspect, but the core value remains the same. I have been exploring different ways to achieve the mission (improve women and children's well-being and provide more and better educational opportunities). I think this website is the first step towards the goal. I am still on my way.


Q: How did you decide what products would be sold on Tao for Good?

The products sold on the platform are products customers actually buy from other platforms, like Amazon and Ebay. I believe customers will have no pressure to easily make an impact on our platform. All you do is to shop as usual. Our next goal is to provide products with social mission all over the world to become the "impact marketplace".


Q: If Tao for Good could have any mascot, what would it be?

Actually, I designed the first version of the logo. Part of the logo is a dove. It's a sign of hope, love and compassion.

story:
We are seven Latino owned family small businesses that have lost our only source of income in the 4-alarm fire that struck the building located on 22nd Street and Mission in the evening of January 28th. This has been a tragedy for the community as one life has been lost, over thirty small businesses have been displaced, and about sixty residential tenants lost their apartments.

Unfortunately, we have lost everything in the fire, and we are not allowed to return to the building. Most likely, the building will be demolished, and sold for a profitable return.

Most of the building residents have received public and private assistance, and have been relocated. On the other hand, small businesses are still dealing with insurance claims, and the fact that most of us were under insured. It is very disheartening to see how we have lost our only source of income after we struggled to start, and were able to run our businesses with limited resources. Some of us were just seeing our businesses grow, but now all our efforts have vanished in front of our eyes.

Below are some of the stories written about the fire:

http://www.sfchronicle.com/restaurants/article/...

http://uptownalmanac.com/2015/01/tragedy-still-fresh-developers-looking-buy-fire-destroyed-mission-market

We are looking to raise $140,000 that will help us to start over. These funds will be distributed in equal parts and will be used for relocation costs of the following small businesses: El Perol Peruvian Restaurant, Kosa Bella, Vivi Alterations, Thalia’s Jewerly, Antojitos Salvadorenos Aminta, Bay Area Fish and Poultry, and Nieves Cinco de Mayo

Your contribution will be very impactful for our families, and the community, as we employ more than thirty low income local residents.

The Hispanic Chambers of Commerce of San Francisco (www.hccsf.com), and the Center for Economic Independence of Women and Youth Foundation -CEIFWF, a 501 c3 tax exempt foundation will be the recipient of these funds, and they will not charge any administrative fees. All of the proceeds of this campaign will go to the affected businesses.

We thank you in advance for your willingness to help us start over, and leave behind this tragedy.

story:
Byron Youth Service needs your help now. Huge government funding cuts this year mean that the service may no longer be able to continue in the new financial year, which means at least 50 young people per week no longer have the support and assistance they need.
You can change that and make a difference! Your donations will keep the Cottage open and ensure that support and a safe space continues to be available.

BYS has been meeting the needs of young people and families in the north of the shire for many years through the provision of a safe space at the Cottage where programs and activities and any matters pertaining to enhancing quality of life take place. No-one is disputing it works, just the funding is gone.

In 2012 a Year 10 girls group completed a mosaic (erected at the front door) that has the words ‘Pursuit Of Happiness' and that is in essence what programs at the Cottage work towards.

What We Need & What You Get

Because of government funding cuts we are down to one worker at the Cottage, who facilitates five groups per week, provides individual support & case management, runs programs and activities and liaises with the school, familes and the community. Ideally we would love to have the funding for co-facilitators, it been the most productive model until this year. All groups also have a meal together at the Cottage, this adds to costs but is essential for participants who more often that not, haven't had breakfast.

Street Cruise, our outreach service, which is spoken highly of by young people, police, businesses and the community generally, has been reduced to only a Friday night service. Our best model for this program is a Friday and Saturday night service as well as during festivals, holiday periods and special events. 

Please help us keep these programs, which have been proven to be highly effective, operational. 

We don't have a lot to show how grateful we are for your help but we can give you some options depending on how much you can donate.
Smaller donations:
* Online acknowledgement of your donation on our website, in our newsletter and on our facebook page.
* Embossed and framed certificates for your business or private office.
* Signage on our Youth Bus promoting your business.

Larger Donations:
* Join our Contributors Walk and have your name professionally and artisticly painted onto the walkway to the Cottage for everyone to see.
* Receive a short film clip showing the program activities that your generous donation is helping to fund or nominate to receive a short thank you video message from one of the young people whose life you're helping to enhance.
* For contributors who would like to see the Cottage and meet the amazing local young people that you are helping to have a better life, a convenient time can be arranged for a visit with morning or afternoon tea, made by the young people.

Even if we don't meet our goal of $50,000 every little bit helps and all donations will go towards keeping the Cottage open, even month to month if necessary.

The Impact Your Donation Will Have

The majority of the referrals come from Mullumbimby High School and they cover young people with a wide range of issues, difficulties and destructive behaviours. Some have already had more harm, tragedy and abuse in their short lives than many adults, some are quite functional but finding life hard to negotiate ... probably no-one would disagree that modern life isn't easy and all teenagers face difficulties. If the doors of the Cottage close, many of those young people have nowhere else to go and no-one else they feel they can go to. Over the years, what's evident, is that with a bit of love and support most of these young people go on to lead positive and productive lives and then everyone benefits, they do, their families do and the community in general does.

Many of those young people come back to visit and bring their babies and children, or they come to let us know how they're doing and their successes range through pursuing careers as successful models, lawyers, business people to those who against ALL odds have completed year 12,  have jobs, have gone to Uni, are married or in relationships. Some come back because they need a bit of help again to get back on track.

Risks & Challenges

We are working hard to try and find ways to survive these difficult times, funding submissions are being written, funding events are being held and planning meetings held. Our great reputation stands us in good stead but so far our staff numbers are at their lowest and funds are diminishing. The young people from the Cottage also want to help and have held a fundraising carwash, bbq, music event and have also asked parents, where possible, to contribute $15 per term towards food ... every bit helps.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help us financially you may have valuable resources that we need, that you no longer want. For example couches, kitchenware and appliances, an efficiently working fridge. You may be able to come and help us on clean up days, in the garden, help get our failing electricial system more functional or assistance with our very old computers ..  and we all know how much young people love computers!

If you can't contribute, it doesn't mean that you can't help: Please

  • Ask people to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • And remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

If you've read all this and feel you can help in any way ... Bless you!

We don't have a lot to show how grateful we are for your help but we can give you some options depending on how much you can donate.Smaller donations: * Online acknowledgement of your donation on our website, in our newsletter and on our facebook page.* Embossed and framed certificates for your business or private office.* Signage on our Youth Bus promoting your business.
Larger Donations:* Join our Contributors Walk and have your name professionally and artisticly painted onto the walkway to the Cottage for everyone to see.* Receive a short film clip showing the program activities that your generous donation is helping to fund or nominate to receive a short thank you video message from one of the young people whose life you're helping to enhance.* For contributors who would like to see the Cottage and meet the amazing local young people that you are helping to have a better life, a convenient time can be arranged for a visit with morning or afternoon tea, made by the young people.
Even if we don't meet our goal of $50,000 every little bit helps and all donations will go towards keeping the Cottage open, even month to month if necessary.

  The Impact Your Donation Will Have
The majority of the referrals come from Mullumbimby High School and they cover young people with a wide range of issues, difficulties and destructive behaviours. Some have already had more harm, tragedy and abuse in their short lives than many adults, some are quite functional but finding life hard to negotiate ... probably no-one would disagree that modern life isn't easy and all teenagers face difficulties. If the doors of the Cottage close, many of those young people have nowhere else to go and no-one else they feel they can go to. Over the years, what's evident, is that with a bit of love and support most of these young people go on to lead positive and productive lives and then everyone benefits, they do, their families do and the community in general does.


Many of those young people come back to visit and bring their babies and children, or they come to let us know how they're doing and their successes range through pursuing careers as successful models, lawyers, business people to those who against ALL odds have completed year 12,  have jobs, have gone to Uni, are married or in relationships. Some come back because they need a bit of help again to get back on track.


  Risks & Challenges We are working hard to try and find ways to survive these difficult times, funding submissions are being written, funding events are being held and planning meetings held. Our great reputation stands us in good stead but so far our staff numbers are at their lowest and funds are diminishing. The young people from the Cottage also want to help and have held a fundraising carwash, bbq, music event and have also asked parents, where possible, to contribute $15 per term towards food ... every bit helps. 
  Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't help us financially you may have valuable resources that we need, that you no longer want. For example couches, kitchenware and appliances, an efficiently working fridge. You may be able to come and help us on clean up days, in the garden, help get our failing electricial system more functional or assistance with our very old computers ..  and we all know how much young people love computers!
If you can't contribute, it doesn't mean that you can't help: Please  Ask people to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. And remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!   If you've read all this and feel you can help in any way ... Bless you!

story:
Hello! 

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out Haute Mess Kitchen's Messes for the Masses campaign! Haute Mess Kitchen - HMK, from here on out - is an excellent little Baltimore-based company that produces seriously delicious, contagiously fun, all-natural dry rubs, seasoning blends and condiments, including our best selling Steak Candy and Chicken Scratch Dry Rubs as well as our (nearly) world-famous Bourbon Bath BBQ Sauce. 

Our philosophy is simple: Everything you eat should be really, really delicious. If it's not, why bother? We make our products with care, using only the best stuff, and we never, ever use anything we can’t pronounce because we’re obsessed with making everything we touch just right. In fact, we’re sort of obsessed with you…with your happiness, your well-being and, mostly, your dinner. 

We've been plugging along for about 2 years (that's about 3,000 jars!), with only 2 unpaid "employees" undertaking a truly archaic process of sanitizing, filling and selling our distinctive jars and the response has been amazing! So amazing, in fact, that we can no longer fill the demand for our delicious products with our own two hands! We need to grow, and we need your help! If we can't make the transition from handmade products to responsibly (and locally!) manufactured micro-batch products, this is the end of the road for HMK. A world without Bourbon Bath? Without Steak Candy?! We know! Too awful to contemplate! But, contemplate it we must...

Help us bring the Messes to the Masses!

If we are ever to become a real business with real distribution and real profits, we must change and grow. But how? After much consideration, it is clear that taking on our own kitchen lease and attempting to expand our handmade production is not a practical or realistic way forward. Instead, we are feeling very fortunate to have hooked up with manufacturing partners here in the Baltimore area who can assist us in ramping up our production (waaaay up!) without sacrificing the outrageous flavors and quality our customers have become accustomed to OR our commitment to locally produced, all-natural, wholesome products you can feel good about feeding your family, friends & selves. 

We will be working with Mama Vida, Inc. in Randallstown, MD to produce our Bourbon Bath BBQ Sauce and Punch Drunk Ketchup and, eventually, to expand our product line (Who wants HMK Mustard? HMK Bloody Mary's?? You do, that's who!). Mama Vida is a family-owned business with the capabilities to take our sauce production from 6 cases at a time to 150 gorgeous, all-natural cases at a time. Wow!  Our initial batches will cost us just about $11,000. 

Our Dry Rub products and our chili seasoning mix will be getting the royal treatment  over at Vann's Spice in Woodlawn, MD. Vann's has an international reputation for excellence and has the capabilities to transition our dry product production from 50 lbs. per batch to up to 500 lbs. per batch. For our initial production runs with Vann's, we are hoping to make 250 lbs. of each of our 4 dry seasoning blends. Not only can Vann's make our products bigger; they can make them better! With access to spice, herb, salt & sugar varietals we've never been able to get our hands on, Vann's is bringing our flavor game way, way up! We know! We didn't think our rubs could get better either, but wow! Wait until you taste this stuff! Our initial batches will cost us $10,000. 

The remaining $9,000 we hope to raise will allow us to warehouse our new quantities and market them to the grocery stores and distributors that will help us to get them into your hands, as well as paying for the alterations and expansions of our insurance and licenses. 

So, HMK, what makes you think you can move that much product?? 

We've got promise and heart and a whole lot of spunk, that's what! More specifically, we have - and have had for some time now - regional vendor approval from Whole Foods Market and interest from an array of larger retailers that value local, all-natural products. What we do not have is the capabilities to guarantee our supply chain to those retailers no matter how fast our products might fly off of their shelves. We need to make this transition to become the solid, reliable business we must be in order to undertake bigger relationships. 

But isn't there still a risk in making this much product while still lining up vendor relationships? Don't think we haven't thought of that! All HMK products offer outstanding shelf-life, even without preservatives (sort of makes you wonder why people eat preservatives, doesn't it. I digress...), so even if sales don't immediately skyrocket, we have a very comfortable 2 years to sell these products. We're pretty confident about the skyrocket-ing, though. So much potential. 

This is where you come in, hungry friends! 

We are excited and thrilled that our friends, family, customers, retailers and yes, you, might entertain the idea of making a contribution towards transitioning HMK's manufacturing process. If you're familiar with our products, you know that HMK's unique flavor profiles, all-natural ethos and commitment to quality and the health & well-being of our customers are worth supporting. As we all focus more on the quality and genesis of the foods we consume, HMK products allow diners everywhere to indulge in deep, exciting flavors without consuming chemicals, additives, flavor enhancers or any other such nonsense. You don't need it! Your body doesn't want it! Flavor does not have to be bad for you! Don't you dare let us catch you dumping MSG on your grass fed beef, y'all. We will smack that jar of additives right out of your hand! 

So, check out the array of perks that we've put forth to entice you further. From products for your own home use, to enough jars to share, to a HMK Party of your own, all the way up to helping us name & build the personality of an upcoming product, no matter what you can contribute, we hope to make it worth your while. There is no contribution too small so, while we have set perk levels in a manner that allow us to share with you while covering our costs, we hope, as this campaign goes forward, to acknowledge each and every one of our contributors with an HMK gift. Don't hesitate to reach out with questions or requests! 

What if this campaign isn't fully funded?

As if! Still, every plan needs a Plan B. Because HMK currently offers 6 products, if we have some success with our campaign but don't meet our $30,000 goal, we can prioritize the production of products with our partners (say that 3x fast!) to address production one, two, three or four products at a time. While it is our dream to go for it and transition our entire product line at once, we can still make the transition more slowly, starting with our best-sellers and moving forward from there if this campaign is not fully funded within 37 days, although that would mean that only those products we could transition would be available. We will not continue to make some products by hand while others are manufactured for us. That, friends, would be certifiably insane.
If this campaign does not earn at least the majority of the necessary funding, this is quite likely the end of the road for HMK and your contributions will be returned to you. We cannot continue to make the products at zero profit. Production requires a huge time commitment which, if you recall from high school econ, results in an opportunity cost, as all of our time invested in HMK is time away from other endeavors, both personal and professional. So far, this has been a weird experiment in community service, making BBQ sauce and more just to see the smile on your faces. That's been fun and rewarding, but it is not a business. 
Why crowd funding? Why not take a loan? In short, risk. HMK is currently one person. Kristin is her name and Kristin has a young family. HMK is also currently only worth its inventory at any given moment because we do not own a facility, equipment or other collateral against which we might borrow to finance our growth. If you're the type of investor who might be interested in partnering with HMK and seeing an eventual return on your investment beyond our fun array of perks, we need you to help us get past this first transition first. As HMK grows, there may be potential for more traditional investment. 

No money? Us either! You can still help! Here's how:

We are completely in touch with the idea that many of our customers care and want to help but may not be able to open their wallets to do so. We would still appreciate your vote of confidence and support in the form of spreading the word and sharing this campaign with your friends and family. It's easy! Just hit SHARE! Also, do continue to patronize our current Baltimore retailers. The more HMK you buy, the more they will order from us and that works out nicely. 

Thank you for supporting us and loving on small businesses. Look around our great nation and see where moving away from small business towards huge, behemoth retailers has landed us. It's ugly out in Wal-Mart world, kids. Sometimes, a better future actually means taking a step back and returning to the values that mattered a few generations ago. Support the businesses that speak to your core values and watch your community flourish! We hope we're one of those businesses! We promise, we won't let you down! Whatever the form of your support, we're grateful for it. We're grateful for you! THANK YOU!

story:
BLKandGrey

BLKandGrey. Simple, yet intriguing. Handcrafted candles. Greyhound sniffed and approved. 30% of profits benefiting local Ohio greyhound initiatives.
Though we haven't been doing this for long (since January of this year) we are really proud that we have been able and fortunate enough to donate close to $400 to Team Greyhound in less than 2 months! We can not have done this without our AMAZING customers and supporters - so THANK YOU! 
Because we have had such a positive and successful first couple months, we have been researching and getting samples of new products and clothing! This is the reason we need your help!
New products that will be released with the support of this campaign:
  • Car air fresheners!
  • Pure and natural Room Spray!
  • 100% Shea Butter scented body creme!
  • Clothing!
  • Swag! (stickers and magnets)

Here's a little about myself: I wanted to be able to do more than volunteer (handling of new dogs that have just arrived from the race track, chipping the dogs, etc) and fostering. The hard part was figuring out my avenue. I have always loved candles. In fact, when I was in elementary school, I did a school project on hand-dipped candles. So really, it began on a whim. Boredom, creativity and a vision to help greyhounds launched my business.
Lastly, I want to say if you are able to, adopt. It doesn't need to be a greyhound. There are thousands of greyhounds each year (in the U.S alone) that are retired. It is crucial for them to be saved by groups like Team Greyhound. (They) specifically are a completely non-profit organization that solely relies on donations, blankets, toys, medicine, etc in order to even operate. Donations go to medicine, vet bills, etc and also helps support a couple different prison programs in which inmates essentially train greyhounds right out of their racing career. They teach them their basic commands as well as how to "live" - they don't know what stairs are for example.
If you can't donate, please share this on social media! Let's help Team Greyhound and all the incredible greyhounds that need homes!

story:
About Mas del Encanto

We are Axel (from the Netherlands) and Sandrine (from Belgium), and we'd love you to help us build our dream. We have purchased a beautiful piece of farmland ("finca") in Spain, that we're now turning into a self-supporting permaculture farm (growing our own food, raising animals) while building our off-grid home and rural retreat on it. 

To help us achieve our goal faster, we're now offering several possibilities to invest in our project - by already booking your stay or by buying some of our products. 

What's the plan? 

We divided the whole project in several parts: 
  • Phase 1 - Rebuilding the maset ("Mas de Vaquer"), so we can go and live in it for the time being. Later on, it will be available for holiday renting. Start: December 2014. Eind: June 2015. 
  • Phase 2 - Building the masia ("Mas del Encanto"). This is the big house, which will have 3 guest rooms for our bed & breakfast. Start: March 2015. End: May 2016. 
  • Phase 3 - Establishing a permaculture farm, so we can produce our own food (and that of our guests). We're planting (fruit) trees and plants, acquiring animals (chickens, sheep, pigs, goats, rabbits and others) and tending to our herb & vegetable garden. Start: October 2014. Probably not ending soon! 
  • Phase 3 - Groundworks, ponds and swimming pool. Start: September 2015. End: depending on funding (hopefully November 2015)
  • Phase 4 - "Meeting & Meditation" building, with bar and outside kitchen. Planned for 2017.
  • Phase 5 - 2 more guest houses. Little casita's on their own private terrace, available for holiday renting or as accommodation for participants to our retreats.  

Our current budget will only take us so far; we have anticipated the building of the house but lack the funds for proper finishing. And this is where you come in (we hope). Without your help, we can move into our home in May 2016 and start saving for the rest of it; but your help would make it possible to welcome our first guests by the summer of 2016. 

What we need - and what you get

We need funding for these projects:

  • Finishing & furniture for the guest rooms and communal rooms: € 14.500,-
    The guest rooms will each have 2 single / 1 double bed, a small fridge, plenty of closet space for your stuff, a desk and 2 chairs; and of course a bathroom with shower, toilet and washing basin. The dining area will have a kitchenette, so you can prepare your own meal if you don't feel like waiting for Spanish lunch / dinner time.  
  • Earthworks to set up a working natural irrigation system: € 3500,- 
    This will include a few ponds (for water harvesting) and a swimming pond, and several canals and swales. 
  • If we reach our goal, we estimate about € 1300,- will go to Indiegogo fees. The more you contribute, the smaller the percentage we lose to those fees! 
The total funding we are going for with this campaign is € 19300,- . If we don't reach our goal, we'll concentrate our efforts into finishing the guestrooms, so you, your friends and your family can at least come and enjoy your vacation. 
The most important thing about this campaign (for you), is that you get the chance to get products from Mas del Encanto at a discount price. So-called "perks" (= what you get for investing in our project) include products from our land, vacations at Mas del Encanto and meals prepared with local produce (if possible even from our own land). 


What's so special about Mas del Encanto?

Mas del Encanto is very special to us. After doing the rat race thing for 15+ years, we are very happy to be here in Spain and living a totally different life; just as busy, but way more relaxed and closer to nature. We would love to become fully self-sufficient, and to share this with others. 

We believe Mas del Encanto can be a haven for our guests as well. Maybe you've always wanted to write a novel and would like to come stay with us for a while to finish it? Of maybe you see your children grow up in the city and would like them to learn where their food comes from, build camps in the woods and have a vacation where they forget about their tablets and smartphones? Or maybe you'd just like to get away from the world for a few days... Then our rural retreat might be the right place for you. 

We are situated between the villages of Lledo (pronounciation: "Yeh-dóh") and Cretas, in Aragon near the border with Catalunya. The region here is called Matarranya, and is known for its vineyards, olive and almond groves, beautiful biking and hiking trails, old villages and castles, and (last but not least) the mountains of "Els Ports" national park, with its ibex, vultures and other wildlife.

To us, this is one of the most beautiful places in the world - we hope you can come and join us, and share a part of our new life. 


What could go wrong?

As we've both mainly lived in cities, off-grid living in the Spanish mountains has a lot of surprises in store for us! You can read a bit about this on our blog (click here). 

Thankfully, we both have a can-do attitude towards life - and where Sandrine is very good at planning and organising, Axel is a technical and practical superman. 

If the whole project would unexpectedly go wrong and we don't get the chance to live up to our promises, we'd make sure every funder gets his or her money back. 

 (a view at the construction site)

How to help? 

If you're not able to contribute, please help us by sharing this page with your friends (real friends, Facebook friends, Twitter acquaintances or anyone you meet). 

You can also help us in kind if you'd like - please e-mail us if you'd like to trade building materials for something, or if you'd like to come and help out for a week or 2. If you'd like to contribute in any other way, please contact us!

Phase 5 - 2 more guest houses. Little casita's on their own private terrace, available for holiday renting or as accommodation for participants to our retreats.  

Our current budget will only take us so far; we have anticipated the building of the house but lack the funds for proper finishing. And this is where you come in (we hope). Without your help, we can move into our home in May 2016 and start saving for the rest of it; but your help would make it possible to welcome our first guests by the summer of 2016.  


  What we need - and what you get

We need funding for these projects:
  Finishing & furniture for the guest rooms and communal rooms: € 14.500,- The guest rooms will each have 2 single / 1 double bed, a small fridge, plenty of closet space for your stuff, a desk and 2 chairs; and of course a bathroom with shower, toilet and washing basin. The dining area will have a kitchenette, so you can prepare your own meal if you don't feel like waiting for Spanish lunch / dinner time.  
Earthworks to set up a working natural irrigation system: € 3500,- This will include a few ponds (for water harvesting) and a swimming pond, and several canals and swales. 
If we reach our goal, we estimate about € 1300,- will go to Indiegogo fees. The more you contribute, the smaller the percentage we lose to those fees!  
The total funding we are going for with this campaign is € 19300,- . If we don't reach our goal, we'll concentrate our efforts into finishing the guestrooms, so you, your friends and your family can at least come and enjoy your vacation. 
The most important thing about this campaign (for you), is that you get the chance to get products from Mas del Encanto at a discount price. So-called "perks" (= what you get for investing in our project) include products from our land, vacations at Mas del Encanto and meals prepared with local produce (if possible even from our own land). 






What's so special about Mas del Encanto?
 Mas del Encanto is very special to us. After doing the rat race thing for 15+ years, we are very happy to be here in Spain and living a totally different life; just as busy, but way more relaxed and closer to nature. We would love to become fully self-sufficient, and to share this with others. 
We believe Mas del Encanto can be a haven for our guests as well. Maybe you've always wanted to write a novel and would like to come stay with us for a while to finish it? Of maybe you see your children grow up in the city and would like them to learn where their food comes from, build camps in the woods and have a vacation where they forget about their tablets and smartphones? Or maybe you'd just like to get away from the world for a few days... Then our rural retreat might be the right place for you. 
We are situated between the villages of Lledo (pronounciation: "Yeh-dóh") and Cretas, in Aragon near the border with Catalunya. The region here is called Matarranya, and is known for its vineyards, olive and almond groves, beautiful biking and hiking trails, old villages and castles, and (last but not least) the mountains of "Els Ports" national park, with its ibex, vultures and other wildlife.
To us, this is one of the most beautiful places in the world - we hope you can come and join us, and share a part of our new life. 

   What could go wrong? As we've both mainly lived in cities, off-grid living in the Spanish mountains has a lot of surprises in store for us! You can read a bit about this on our blog (click here). 
Thankfully, we both have a can-do attitude towards life - and where Sandrine is very good at planning and organising, Axel is a technical and practical superman. 
If the whole project would unexpectedly go wrong and we don't get the chance to live up to our promises, we'd make sure every funder gets his or her money back. 
 (a view at the construction site)


How to help? 
 If you're not able to contribute, please help us by sharing this page with your friends (real friends, Facebook friends, Twitter acquaintances or anyone you meet). 
You can also help us in kind if you'd like - please e-mail us if you'd like to trade building materials for something, or if you'd like to come and help out for a week or 2. If you'd like to contribute in any other way, please contact us!

story:
Website: https://fliexer.com

Facebook: https://facebook.com/fliexer


ITS A TRIPLE-WIN IDEA!

We have partnered with African craft makers to bring you some wonderful thank you gifts for your donation. Every donation is a win-win-win contribution that:

  • Gets you a beautiful piece of African village craft to keep for a lifetime;
  • Supports African village craft makers; and
  • Helps launch and bring Fliexer to market.
Please scroll down to learn more about your gift before making a choice.

Fliexer is a revolutionary social app that connects and empowers people to share solutions and opportunities.

Fliexer empowers you to request anything, obtain the solution, and share the joy. Fliexer also provides you the opportunity to respond to requests from other people and make an income. Get more work, more jobs, more projects, more business, and more customers than you can handle, FREE.


YES! I LIKE THE TRIPLE-WIN IDEA OF MY CONTRIBUTION:

  • Getting me a beautiful piece of African village craft;

  • Supporting African village craft makers; and

  • Helping launch and bring Fliexer to market.

What are my options?


$5 -- Thank you, Early Supporter!

You have our warmest appreciation and a lifetime of recognition on your profile with the Lifetime Premier Early Supporter Badge. Design pending. Early Supporters will be invited to participate in our design process (by survey or focus group), get exclusive updates and early access to use Fliexer before the general public.

$20 -- 1 x Ghana Bolga Fan

Premier Early Supporter Badge. Plus, you get this exquisite Ghana Bolga Hand Fan. Your contribution will support the African village weavers of the Frafra tribe in Bolgatanga, Ghana, and help launch and bring Fliexer to market.

You get one fan. Colors may vary. These fans look great hanging on the wall, but are also extremely functional.

FREE US Shipping. Please add $12 for Int'l Shipping.


$55 -- 3 x Ghana Bolga Fans

Premier Early Supporter Badge. Plus, you get 3 exquisite Ghana Bolga Hand Fans. Your contribution will support the African village weavers of the Frafra tribe in Bolgatanga, Ghana, and help launch and bring Fliexer to market.

You get 3 hand fans. Colors may vary. These fans look great hanging on the wall, but are also extremely functional.

FREE US Shipping. Please add $12 for Int'l Shipping.

$65 -- 1 x Bolga Market Basket

Premier Early Supporter Badge. Plus, you get this exquisite Ghana Bolga Market Basket. Your contribution will support the African village weavers of the Frafra tribe in Bolgatanga, Ghana, and help launch and bring Fliexer to market.

The weavers use veta vera grass which is abundant in the areato create these hardy, useful African baskets. The leather wrapped handle adds to the durability.

You will receive the exact basket pictured above. Color may vary.

FREE US Shipping. Please add $25 for Int'l Shipping.


$75 -- Bolga Shoulder Bag

Premier Early Supporter Badge. Plus, you get this exquisite Ghana Bolga Shoulder Bag. Your contribution will support the African village weavers of the Frafra tribe in Bolgatanga, Ghana, and help launch and bring Fliexer to market.

The weavers use veta vera grass which is abundant in the area to create this casual purse with rolled and stitched leather straps, which also has a leather loop and knob to close the top of the bag.

The leather wrapped handle adds to the durability.

You will receive the exact basket pictured above. Color may vary.

FREE US Shipping. Please add $25 for Int'l Shipping.


$100 -- Bolga Business Basket

Premier Early Supporter Badge. Plus, you get this exquisite Ghana Bolga Business Basket. Your contribution will support the African village weavers of the Frafra tribe in Bolgatanga, Ghana, and help launch and bring Fliexer to market.

This briefcase-style shape African basket was made by one weaver who saw business men in the town of Bolgatanga carrying briefcases. There is still only one weaver capable of making this shape because it is extremely difficult to to weave the flat shapes needed. The pieces are sewn together with leather. Weavers in the region use the abundant veta vera grass to weave these incredibly hardy, useful African baskets. The leather wrapped handle adds to the durability.

You will receive the exact basket pictured above. Colors may vary.

FREE US Shipping. Please add $25 for Int'l Shipping.


$195 -- 1 x Bolga Lidded Laundry Hamper

Premier Early Supporter Badge. Plus, you get this beautiful Ghana Bolga Lidded Laundry Hamper. Your contribution will support the African village weavers of the Frafra tribe in Bolgatanga, Ghana, and help launch and bring Fliexer to market.

This laundry hamper has a lid and two sturdy swiveling handles that meet at the top for ease of carrying. It works well for storing blankets and linens.

You will receive the exact basket pictured above. Colors may vary.


FREE US Shipping. Please add $25 for Int'l Shipping.


$550 -- Mali Pro Djembe - 13x24

Premier Early Supporter Badge. Plus, you get this high quality Mali Pro Jembe. Your contribution will support the Madinka tribe village craft makers in Mali and the Gambia, and help launch and bring Fliexer to market.

13x24 Mali Pro Djembe is a standard size instrument for most adult drummers, suitable for women or men who want an exceptional sounding, easy to play African-made djembe. Our Mali djembes are crafted by expert carvers using specialty hardwoods, finished with top-rate skin and rope, and feature a 2 or 3-top ring tuning system. Shells are selected from Hare, Lenke, Dugura, and Acajou, healthy and well seasoned. At proper tension these 13x24 Mali djembes have a nice semi-dry sound quality, with easy tones and slaps and strong bass. It is the favorite of the djembe master drummer called “djembefola” in Mandinka.

The term “djembe” originates from the Bambara language in Mali saying “Anke djé, anke bé” which translates to “everyone gather together in peace". The djembe drum is most commonly associated with the Madinka people native to Mali, Senegal, the Gambia, Guinea, Ivory Coast, Burkina Faso, Sierra Leone, Liberia, Guinea-Bissau, Chad. Bambara and Mandinka  or Manding languages are similar.

You will receive the exact Djembe Drum pictured above.

FREE US Shipping. Please add $12 for Int'l Shipping.

$145 -- Ghana Dondo - Small

Premier Early Supporter Badge. Plus, you get this high quality Ghana Dondo - Small. Your contribution will support the  village craft makers in Ghana, and help launch and bring Fliexer to market.

A smaller version of the full size Ghana talking drum, this dondo creates all of the right sounds, just on a softer, higher pitch. Its size is manageable for smaller hands and smaller budgets, and doesnt sacrifice authenticity or quality.

  • solid one-piece construction, carved of Nyame Dua wood
  • strong synthetic brown or burgundy verticals with shaved goat skin head
  • handcarved, curved beater included
Nyame Dua literally means GOD’S TREE in Akan Twi the language of the Ashanti people of Ghana. God’s Tree is the sacred site where the powers of Heaven and Earth unite and where human beings come to know who they are.  It is a place of magnificent change, growth, and infinite possibility.  It is where we may learn the truth of seasons, cycles, and regeneration; where we can appreciate endurance, patience, introspection, adaptability, rootedness, and reach.  Under God’s Tree, the wise gather to ensure the balance and harmony of the people.

You will receive the exact Dondo Drum pictured above.


FREE US Shipping. Please add $12 for Int'l Shipping.


About the Team

Kofi Agbakpe

Kofi Agbakpe is the founder of Fliexer. A dual certified CPA who also holds a Masters Degree in Business Administration (MBA), Kofi has a comprehensive background in accounting, audit, and information technology services.

Beginning his career at the largest insurer in his native homeland, Ghana, where his highly motivated self-starter approach to work quickly catapulted him into senior management, Kofi championed a major ERP system implementation project at the SIC Insurance Company of Ghana. He overcame organizational resistance to change through peer leadership, resulting in greater operational efficiency, streamlined accounting operations, and faster reporting times. Kofi was later hired to assist a retail chain in Southern Africa with a computerization project, where working across Botswana, Namibia and South Africa, he streamlined distribution and accounting systems, and championed the y2k rollover. While still in Botswana, Kofi advised the military on selecting systems to manage and account for its many operations across the country.  In the USA he successfully navigated Angel Health Care, Inc. of Columbus, Ohio from dysfunctional accounting operations to more streamlined accounting processes, clearing the company's three-year reporting backlog, and making faster monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting attainable.

In Houston, Texas, Kofi quickly cut off fraud and waste at Career and Recovery Resources, Inc., and effectively navigated this company from antiquated legacy systems to a connected technology environment resulting in more efficient communications, streamlined operations, and cost savings. Kofi's career also took him to Germany where he carried out audits of a global corporation across Europe. Kofi enjoys working in multinational, multicultural teams and loves cross-cultural food.

story:
Hello! We are Princess Nightmare. A small accessories company making our way back to NYCC (New York Comicon) this year! But we need a little bit of help! Throughout the year we have worked on some new and wonderful things. We currently sell handmade one of a kind and commissionable Swarovski crystal shoes and purses along with custom and one of a kind Monster High dolls! We also sell small accessories like movie related jewelry. We LOVE fandoms! Most of what we do and sell are based on our favorite and other popular nerdy fandoms.

The fundraiser is designed through a rewards system mostly consisting of cosplay photos as originally the company was started by and run by one person (Katia) and the initial page was for cosplay photos. Since then a business has grown. Chris joined as a partner this year and all bags, shoes, and dolls are customized by hand by either or both of us.

There are other rewards as well, just check out the list of perks! (And see them in the gallery!)

Hi!! I am Katia. Or Kate. Or Katie. Or as most of you know me Princess Nightmare. I am not spectacular with words so forgive me for this. If you have known me a really long time you know me as a friend, if you have known me for a few years you know me as a cosplayer, if you have known me only a couple years you may know me as a cosplayer half a costume company, if you have only known me for a couple months you know the huge new part of my life which is my custom accessories design (including Doctor Who, Harry Potter, Game of Thrones, other Literary references, and other nerdy custom accessories as well as custom bridal shoes and accessories). I am not going to sit here and give you the sob story of stuff that has happened to me in the past. I hate when people do that. There is no reason for it. This is about the future. My entire life I have dreamed big but big dreams have to start small. I am an artist, I am creative and ambitious-and the next step in my life is to make things happen.

This is it, it has been my dream since I was 5 years old to run my own company. I have been in partnerships, I have held key roles in other independent companies but it is time for it to be my own. Products I make, things I do. Time to make my own dreams come true.

So! Why donate and What do you get?

Our goal is what we need to get to NYCC

A lot of you have met us at NYCC in the past or seen us at Steampunk World's Faire. We no longer have backers or partner companies we are all on our own now! We are very excited but NYCC is our big event and it costs a fair bit. So, we need your help to raise the funds to get back to NYCC!!

*Please note this is not for cosplay. The rewards are cosplay related because of the community we generate the most attention from, however this is not a fundraiser to cosplay at a convention it is for a small business of fandom and custom nerdy accessories.

We were hoping to only have to do this last year but starting anew takes time so one more go at fundraising for NYCC. I hate asking people for money. This is my exception, I am determined to get back to continue on the fantastic path we have started!

Now for the Reward System!! This is the important part right! What do you get for helping us out! So, here we go! A lot of people on the Facebook page have been asking me to sell photos/signed/personalized photos of Katia's cosplay…so here it is! This is your chance to get those photos you have been asking about!! Some you have seen before if you have been on the page, and this time MANY are exclusive to this fundraiser!

Other rewards include products we make  and other things. You can read more about it if/when you are ready to make a contribution!

If we don't reach our entire goal-the funds still go towards the convention. It will make it either slightly or significantly more difficult depending on how short we fall of the goal, but no matter what all funds go towards the convention. In all honesty we are terrified of not reaching my goal. However, If for some reason we do manage to exceed the goal we will add some more things to our standard inventory as there have been a lot of requests lately! :-) As well as sending out extra perks to anyone that donated!!

ALL US SHIPPING IS FREE! 

Unfortunately it will be + $55 for international shipping :-( We are terribly sorry about this but it's the cost of postage, there is also the option to pick up rewards at the booth at NYCC-just let me know. FOR ANYONE NOT IN THE US--contact us with your paypal address and we will send a shipping invoice of $55 for overseas $10 for canada kate@princessnightmarecreations.com

Photos are glossy 8.5x11 (or close to 8.5x11 some are slightly off in dimension because they are more square etc but most are 8.5x11 and all will be printed on 8.5x11 paper).  All prints will be signed!

LASTLY to SEE the rewards GO TO the gallary!!

Please send a note to kate@princessnightmarecreations.com if you choose an advertising perk or a perk that contains multiple options and tell us what you would like us to advertise or which option you are choosing from the list on perks that have multiple options!! (AND you can buy digital perks multiple times to purchase all options!!)

Every little bit helps! Just $5 and sharing/spreading the word! We thank you so much for your time! Please visit us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter!

And thank you all in advance for your time and help!



****ALL PERKS WILL BE SENT WITHIN  will begin to be mailed or e-mailed after 75 days from the of the fundraiser, that is when the funds clear.   IF the goal is met, if the goal is NOT met they will be sent AFTER NYCC.  On the off chance we EXCEED the goal everyone will get an extra perk! If you donated for a digital perk you will get an extra bonus digital perk, if you donated for a print you will get an extra exclusive print, etc! :-)  ****EXCEPT advertising perk. If you need it to be immediate please just let us know!

However, If for some reason we do manage to exceed the goal we will add some more things to our standard inventory as there have been a lot of requests lately!  :-) As well as sending out extra perks to anyone that donated!!ALL US SHIPPING IS FREE! Unfortunately it will be + $55 for international shipping :-( We are terribly sorry about this but it's the cost of postage, there is also the option to pick up rewards at the booth at NYCC-just let me know. FOR ANYONE NOT IN THE US--contact us with your paypal address and we will send a shipping invoice of $55 for overseas $10 for canada kate@princessnightmarecreations.comPhotos are glossy 8.5x11 (or close to 8.5x11 some are slightly off in dimension because they are more square etc but most are 8.5x11 and all will be printed on 8.5x11 paper).  All prints will be signed!LASTLY to SEE the rewards  GO TO the gallary!!Please send a note to kate@princessnightmarecreations.com  if you choose an advertising perk or a perk that contains multiple options and tell us what you would like us to advertise or which option you are choosing from the list on perks that have multiple options!! (AND you can buy digital perks multiple times to purchase all options!!)Every little bit helps! Just $5 and sharing/spreading the word! We thank you so much for your time! Please visit us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter!And thank you all  in advance for your time and help!****ALL PERKS WILL BE SENT WITHIN  will begin to be mailed or e-mailed after 75 days from the of the fundraiser, that is when the funds clear.   IF the goal is met, if the goal is NOT met they will be sent AFTER NYCC.  On the off chance we EXCEED the goal everyone will get an extra perk! If you donated for a digital perk you will get an extra bonus digital perk, if you donated for a print you will get an extra exclusive print, etc! :-)  ****EXCEPT advertising perk. If you need it to be immediate please just let us know!

story:
The Night Market is returning to St. Paul, MN! Please consider becoming a partner of our Second Annual Night Market!

Last year, Little Mekong was successful in bringing vibrancy to the local Frogtown community in the evening hours by creating new opportunities for small entrepreneurs, artists, and cultural performers. The four-night initiative of Little Mekong not only opened a window into the festive night markets in Asian countries, they also fostered a space for cultural exchange between Minnesotans from all walks of life. In order to build upon the success of 2014, we need you to partner with us by offering financial help to expand and enrich this year's Night Market, which will be much bigger than. 


So, what is the Little Mekong Night Market? 

The Little Mekong Night Market is the Twin Cities’s only twilight Asian-inspired street market, located in the heart of the Little Mekong District -- the business and cultural section in St. Paul, MN that boasts a diversity of cultures, top rated restaurants, and unique shopping experiences. 

In 2014, the Night Market was held four times. There were 50 vendors and more than 200 artists and performers. The festivities brought together well over 9,000 people from all walks of life. On top of that, the Night Market made a huge impact on the local businesses and vendors. 

"David Simoukdalay, co-owner of Lao Thai Restaurant and one of the popular food booths at the Night Market, was surprised at the great sales. “We earned more in five hours than what we sometimes make in one day at the restaurant[.]"" (source)

The Night Market was, in short, an absolute success and it received rave reviews. 

"The vibe is eclectic and vibrant with an authentic Asian flair and a carnival atmosphere. The diverse neighborhood turned out when we visited, as did many kids and families from all over the Twin Cities. The beautiful Chicks on Sticks stilt walkers greeted market-goers from on high, while the main stage hosted a full lineup of entertainment including a local talent open mic, Asian dance troops, bands, solo performers, hip-hop artists, a house DJ, and film screenings." - Citypages, August 4, 2014

"I love the vibe of immersing myself in a community. It's the same experience I get when I travel and experience new places and cultures"  - Desdemona
"It's fun, exciting, and even a bit romantic for some people. Asian flavors with a Minnesota twang" - Saymoukda Vongsay
“I love the creativity of this event! Great people! Great Company! Great Food! And Fun Fun Fun!” - Pang Xiong, Night Market attendee
“Fabulous event!!!” - Hannah Stander Riederer, Night Market attendee


Expansion of the Night Market in 2015 

To build upon last year's success, the Night Market will be bigger and better. There will be more vendors, more food, more art, and more performances for attendees to explore, watch, and eat, and it will geographically cover a wider space. Instead of a small parking lot like last year, the 2015 Night Market (which will happen on July 3, July 4, August 7, and August 8 from 6:00 pm - midnight) will take it to the streets. 


The expansion will have a larger impact. There will be an increase in the awareness of small businesses and the vibrancy and diversity of the Minnesota Asian community. Artists and performers will have more chances to showcase their work at the Night Market. Furthermore, there will be additional opportunities for cultural exchange to happen between people from diverse backgrounds. And, like last year, we will focus on accessibility -- the Night Market will be free to all and vendors will pay a small fee to participate.



The 2014 Night Market budget was $100,000.  To accommodate the expansion, this year's night market has a budget of $200,000. 
To run the Night Market, we need essential things from having seating and rest areas, traffic safety, bike racks, artists and performers to water, lighting and electricity as well as more staff to make sure this happens.  
We're pleased to to announce that we have secured $148,000 from some incredibly generous foundations and corporations: the Knight Foundation, Twin Cities LISC, Springboard for the Arts, Mardag Foundation, McKnight Foundation, BlueCross BlueShield, Capitol Region Watershed District, AgStar, St Paul HREEO, UCare, and Target. Additionally, potential sponsors, including Healtheast Foundation, Bank of America and U.S. Bank, are considering offering their support as well. Total, we anticipate foundations and corporations will contribute $170,000 to the Night Market, but we need to make up the last $30,000 and that's where we need your partnership!  

 

What We Need & What You Get

The remaining $30,000 that's needed for the Night Market will help to cover some very important services and items that are pivotal to our success:

  • staging, sound, and lighting for artists and performers
  • artist stipends, art activities, and art supplies
  • volunteer appreciation
  • recycling and trash
  • tents, chairs, tables, and rest areas
  • traffic security
To show our appreciation, we have some great perks for you! Here are a few: 

  • $500: 2014 Qhia Dab Neeg Festival photographs
  • $75: One of a kind handwritten poetry from 2014 Night Market attendees
  • $50: Little Mekong Night Market tote bags
  • $5: Personalized shout out on social media
Plus, we'll be offering free events during the duration of our campaign, including: 
  • Friday, May 15 over the lunch hour in the Little Mekong District: a mini Pop-Up Street Market - food, arts, and community space
  • Saturday, May 30 at Dow Art Gallery (2242 University Ave W, St. Paul, MN 55114): MANIFEST - music, art, food sampling from Tin Whiskers and Sweet Science Ice-cream, and other activities


Risks, Challenges, and other ways you can help

Our biggest risk and challenge is our size. Considering the success of the 2014 Night Market, many will be surprised to hear that the core staff of the Night Market only consists of 8 members. Along with our great volunteers, we're all dedicated individual, but we're stretched thin.

story:
Why this is going to be great!

Hello, My name is Ryan Steele. (some of you know this ready)

I have a vision of building  a site with rental cabins in the mountain bike destination of Fruita, CO. It started with a simple idea and now I want to bring it into existence.

My vision is to have a place that is about the camaraderie and lifestyle that mountain biking brings. So even if you are not a mountain biker you will still have the best time during your stay in Fruita. 

Located between Fruita and the famous 18 Road trails you will be only 10 minutes from those trails, 20 minutes to the Kokopelli trails, 25 minutes to Rabbit Valley, 30 minutes to the Grand Junction trails and only 1.5 hours to Moab. 

Aside from the plethora of biking races and events hosted by the town of Fruita and the surrounding towns, this area also offers several other festivals for the arts, music and agricultural events what this means is that from March through November there is no shortage of people coming through the area looking for lodging. 

Our market analysis has shown that monies spent on lodging has increased by 225% in the last five years and with Colorado currently having the best economy in the nation, these numbers are very much likely to continue trending upward for quite some time! 

Our cabins will feature coffee roasted locally as our complimentary coffee. We will also feature local health and beauty products in our showers. The walls of the cabins will be displaying art work from local artist with the information as to how guests can purchase these items. 

Don't forget what else Fruita is already known for. Like the local gourmet pizza and hand crafted beer and a world famous bike shop. Which is only a short 4 minute drive from The Hyve Cabins.  

There will also be a Pump track, Dirt jumps and RC car track. I will also be building a mile long skills loop around the property. This will allow me to host the skills camps right on the property! 

There will also be a full bike repair station and bike wash.  

Later the two silos that you see on the property will be converted to an indoor climbing gym! 

Why is it called The Hyve?

When one person finds out how great it is they will certainly head back and tell everyone what great things are going on and that they need to go there and check it out for themselves. Like a bee that found a sweet flower and wants all the other bees to go there and get some of the goodness. 

What We Need

So here are the details:

What I'm looking for is startup funding to augment the funds that I have and give me some breathing room for the unexpected things. So that at this time I do will not have to secure a loan. Loans for startups, even one for an idea that is this good, are difficult to secure. I have about $55,000 of my own money that I am using to get this up and running.

The funds being requested will be for:

  • The purchase of the cabins which will be $50,000. This includes everything from the cabin itself, to completing the interior and have them ready for rent. 
  • Site preparation which will be $30,000. Things like a septic tank, foundations for the cabins, equipment rental, electrical work, access road and other requirements. 
  • Engineer, which will be about $10,000, to do the site plans and permitting.
  • And any other extra costs to get the first five, hopefully more, cabins up and ready for rent. 
  • This property already has power and water to it. So that is a large expense that I don't have to account for.

What You Get

What you will get for your donation will be great!

  • None of the perks are "feel good" perks. You will get something for your support.
  • It will range from something handmade with The Hyve branding. A mug, a shirt, cup coaster, hydration tube cover..... All the way to a weekend getaway with accommodations, skills clinic and trail tour of the local trails and much much more.

But if the goal isn't reached there is no need to worry.

  • The Hyve is still going to be built! It just might take a little longer.

There will be three cabin types built in phases

  • The first type will be the Premium Cabins.
  • These will feature a queen bed, bunk bed and full bathroom facilities.
  • The second type will be The Hyve Cabins.
  • These will feature a queen bed and two sets of bunk beds. The shower facility will be two community type shower houses. These cabins will be in circle with a large fire pit in the center.
  • The third type will be The Family Cabins.
  • These will feature a full service kitchen, bathroom and two bedrooms. 

What the additional funds mean to The Hyve.

What will the funds that are raised mean to this project? 

  • We will be able to have more cabins available when we open.
  • This is a new challenge for me. But I'm up for it! I'm dedicated and have a great lady behind me. 

Risks & Challenges

Of course there are a few risks. Mostly for me just trying to get a dream out of the sky and on the ground. 

Don't forget the challenges. I have to say that to myself regularly. 

The two biggest challenges are dirt and dollars. 

  • I am in the process of leasing some land off of 17 1/2 road (Maple Ave). I have talked to the County Planner and they seem to be in favor of this plan. The owner of the property is motivated because there has been no interested parties for 8 years. 
  • The second challenge is funding. Well that is why I am here. I have some but this will allow the startup to just be better.

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course it would be great it everyone could donate. But everything helps. let people know about this. If they donate make sure that you have them mention that you led them to me and we will figure something out. 

  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

The second challenge is funding. Well that is why I am here. I have some but this will allow the startup to just be better.

story:
I'm not the type of person that asks for help but if life has taught me anything, things change. I need some help.

Back in August last year my job at Glasgow 2014 ended and I was left unemployed. I knew this was coming and I had another job lined up, but in September it fell through and I was left unemployed and in debt. I couldn't pay for various bills I.e Phone bills and when I stopped my direct debit to them, the debt collectors came knocking. Although they never came knocking, I had no idea they were after me! why? My family and I had been evicted out of our home and we were living in temporary accommodation for 4/5 months. So to sum up, I was in debt, unemployed and living in temporary accommodation, great life for a 19 year old eh?

December came and I finally landed myself a job in a bank, dealing with PPI Complaint, WOO! January soon followed and we finally got a home that we could call ours, things were looking up. With a steady source of income, I decided to phone up my Phone supplier and pay off my outstanding bill. They informed me that my case had been handed over to debt collectors and they would be dealing with the repayment, okay whatever, I'll phone them up and get some sort of weekly payment set up, easy right? They wanted the full £1000 up front. I get paid weekly so I can't exactly pay an £1000 bill in one go, I needed monthy/weekly installments but the collector was having none of it! Being the scared/immature kid that I am, I hung up the phone and swept this whole thing under the carpet.

That brings us to today. They collectors have now found me and demanded that I pay the money up front in the next three weeks. I don't get paid that much and it's weekly so they're no chance I can do it myself. My Parents have enough money problems of their own and I don't want to burden them with mine. My friends have done so much for me already and I couldn't possibly ask them for any more. That bring me here internet, If I could even get half of what I'm asking for I would be eternally grateful. I've read so much about the kindhearted people that constantly give money to those in need on this site so if by some miracle i exceed my target, all profits will go to the charity Shelter Scotland,they help over half a million people a year struggling with bad housing or homelessness, the campaign to prevent it from happening in the first place. Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

After working as a nurse in a neonatal intensive care unit for 15 years, I have seen amazing medical advances that are not only keeping more and more babies alive from younger gestations.... but the outcome and lifelong health of these babies have dramatically improved.  While this technology has made great strides and made such a positive impact to neonatal care, I often see that the actual support that is provided by staff to families still has a long way to go. 

In order for babies to truly thrive and reach their full potential, deep and meaningful connections to their parents and family is key. Yet many NICU's still struggle with incorporating families fully into the care team. 

  • Some families still have to abide by visiting hours meaning there are times of they day when they can not be with their child
  • Families are sometimes told the plan of care, rather than being asked to participate in creating that plan
  • Families are often treated as visitors.... not parents
  • Parents feel incredibly isolated and alone! The NICU Journey is a rollercoaster of emotions, and often time there is not the support they need to get through this experience

I have a deep desire to help these families! I am a sought out national speaker on Family Centered Care practices to staff, but why not educate the families? Teach and support them on how to be empowered to be the best advocate for their baby! 

This campaign is to help me set up an interactive web based community class that will allow parents to connect with myself, as a professional neonatal provider, and with other parents trying to survive the NICU journey just like them! 

What We Need & What You Get

In a busy neonatal intensive care unit, parents often time feel alone despite being surrounded by other babies and families. Nurses, doctors, therapists, social workers, dietitians, chaplains, respiratory therapists..... there are so many people they meet and can lean on for support. Yet I often hear they still feel so isolated.

Many NICU's across the country work hard at creating and offering support groups, classes, activities and educational sessions for families, not only to provide local and convenient support, but to help them meet other families facing similar stressors. Unfortunately, these classes and opportunities are often poorly attended. Why? Parents don't want to leave their baby's bedside. Their time at the hospital is precious. When they are possibly juggling jobs, their home, other siblings, daily responsibilities, etc, when they have the time to be at the hospital they would rather spend quality time with their child and not in a class or support group. 

That is where this campaign comes in! This on line community will provide a platform for families: 

  • To connect with a non-biased professional nurse to facilitate discussion and offer up suggestions on how to advocate for their child
  • Meet other families across the country trying to survive the NICU experience as well
  • A safe and anonymous space to share stories, express fears, state frustrations, celebrate milestones and find validity that their feelings are normal
  • A way to connect with others and receive education in the comfort of being right at their baby's bedside
By supporting this campaign, you will help bring non-judgemental and 24 hour support to families in crisis. $2,000 will allow this campaign to be live on the web with unlimited number of participant seats and will even allow for multiple instructors to facilitate...... giving all families the opportunity to join in! 

The Impact

Families that have a child needing neonatal intensive care find themselves with many stressors that parents of healthy term babies don't necessarily experience:

  • Mounting medical bills
  • Higher divorce rates
  • Loss of jobs due to the time demands of caring for a fragile baby
  • PTSD after hospital discharge
  • Stress of juggling other siblings while one is in the hospital
  • Ongoing, and sometimes life long, medical care needed for their child after leaving the NICU
Yet research shows that with emotional support, and having a way to connect with other families to normalize the experience, these stressors lesson dramatically. And as mentioned above, parents will be able to access this support any time of day or night, from anywhere they have access to a computer. 
During my time as a bedside nurse and family support specialist in a very busy NICU, I often saw families comfortably sitting near their baby's bedside on their computer. The web is a place you can research various diagnosis, tests, the meanings of lab results, available support networks, etc. All from the comfort of where you are. This brings the support right to the unit.... right where the parent is. They don't have to leave their child for another hour to go sit through a class or support group. And they don't have to worry about trying to be there at the scheduled time. This works with their schedule!


Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can afford to financially support a campaign, and that's FINE! There are many other ways to support not only this effort, but other resources out there that focus on helping families.

  • Share the resource www.patientfamilycare.com to others
  • Support your local March of Dimes Chapter by volunteering or participating in their events. Their mission is to offer support to families and to find a day when ALL babies are born healthy. Visit www.marchofdimes.com for more information
  • Visit www.handtohold.org to see other ways you can help parents in the NICU connect with other parents
  • See if your nearest hospital has an NICU and if they have ways you can support them! (volunteers often time knit hats, make blankets, donate baby clothes, etc)
story_txt:
Short Summary After working as a nurse in a neonatal intensive care unit for 15 years, I have seen amazing medical advances that are not only keeping more and more babies alive from younger gestations.... but the outcome and lifelong health of these babies have dramatically improved.  While this technology has made great strides and made such a positive impact to neonatal care, I often see that the actual support that is provided by staff to families still has a long way to go. 
In order for babies to truly thrive and reach their full potential, deep and meaningful connections to their parents and family is key. Yet many NICU's still struggle with incorporating families fully into the care team.   Some families still have to abide by visiting hours meaning there are times of they day when they can not be with their child
Families are sometimes told the plan of care, rather than being asked to participate in creating that plan Families are often treated as visitors.... not parents Parents feel incredibly isolated and alone! The NICU Journey is a rollercoaster of emotions, and often time there is not the support they need to get through this experience  I have a deep desire to help these families! I am a sought out national speaker on Family Centered Care practices to staff, but why not educate the families? Teach and support them on how to be empowered to be the best advocate for their baby! 
This campaign is to help me set up an interactive web based community class that will allow parents to connect with myself, as a professional neonatal provider, and with other parents trying to survive the NICU journey just like them!    What We Need & What You Get In a busy neonatal intensive care unit, parents often time feel alone despite being surrounded by other babies and families. Nurses, doctors, therapists, social workers, dietitians, chaplains, respiratory therapists..... there are so many people they meet and can lean on for support. Yet I often hear they still feel so isolated.
Many NICU's across the country work hard at creating and offering support groups, classes, activities and educational sessions for families, not only to provide local and convenient support, but to help them meet other families facing similar stressors. Unfortunately, these classes and opportunities are often poorly attended. Why? Parents don't want to leave their baby's bedside. Their time at the hospital is precious. When they are possibly juggling jobs, their home, other siblings, daily responsibilities, etc, when they have the time to be at the hospital they would rather spend quality time with their child and not in a class or support group. 
That is where this campaign comes in! This on line community will provide a platform for families:   To connect with a non-biased professional nurse to facilitate discussion and offer up suggestions on how to advocate for their child Meet other families across the country trying to survive the NICU experience as well A safe and anonymous space to share stories, express fears, state frustrations, celebrate milestones and find validity that their feelings are normal
