This brings the support right to the unit.... right where the parent is. They don't have to leave their child for another hour to go sit through a class or support group. And they don't have to worry about trying to be there at the scheduled time. This works with their schedule!

story:
Who Needs YOU!

 

Can't get tickets to Gallifrey? Wish there was a Doctor Who event closer to home? Good news! San Diego Who Con is coming in 2016! The TARDIS will be landing at the Town and Country Resort & Convention Center September 30 through October 2, 2016. San Diego Who Con is a three day event where fans can gather, cosplay, meet fellow fans, and experience the Whoverse in a fun, family-friendly atmosphere. But we need YOUR help to make this the most FAN-tastic convention experience possible!  

Who Are We?

The San Diego Who Con organizing committee is an enthusiastic group of people who really want to bring the joy of Doctor Who to America's Finest City! Our all-volunteer convention team has a combined 60+ years of experience organizing and running conventions. So we know how much hard work, dedication, and determination it takes to make a large scale fan convention happen. We also know it takes money, and that’s why we are asking for your help! 

How You Can Help Who

Money, of course. Conventions are expensive, bigger conventions are VERY expensive! And every little bit helps! Every dollar raised goes directly into covering convention expenses (we are an all-volunteer group, so no one is getting paid to do this!). 

And when you make a contribution to San Diego Who Con, we have a variety of ways to say thank you . The Perks range from Your Name on our webpage and program Thank You pages to a Meet & Greet with our celebrity Guest of Honor (to be announced - spoilers!). Be sure to check out the full list of contribution levels and Perks available. Again, every little bit helps!

Why So Much?

Putting on a convention this size is not cheap! It takes money to reserve the convention space, put together an interesting and fun program of events, and, most importantly, arrange for a truly exciting Guest of Honor. We are a start-up convention, so we don’t have the cash reserves that established conventions do. That’s why we are asking for your help to get the ball rolling.

Where the money goes

Our budget:

Venue: $25,000-$35,000

Fundraising Events: $6,000-$8,000

Guests: $30,000 - $50,000 (guest fees, travel expenses, and hotel accommodations).

Marketing: $1,500-$4,500

Indiegogo Incentives: $1,800-$2,500

Registration materials, programs, signs, etc. - $15,000

Ok, that adds up to a lot more than our $10,000 goal! We can cover the rest with convention memberships, fundraisers and sponsorships, but that first $10,000 covers all the up-front expenses.

What You Get for Helping

Contributors at every level will be listed on our website and convention program Thank You pages (unless you choose to remain anonymous). Contributors at the $10 and higher levels will receive an exclusive San Diego Who Con ribbon (with “Supporter” written in Gallifreyan script). These ribbons will ONLY be available to contributors!

Check out the full list of perks and pick your contribution level -------------------->


What if?

What if we don’t reach our $10,000 goal? Well, it won't be the end of time! San Diego Who Con will still go on. But we might have to charge more for convention memberships, and scale back a bit on the fantastic events we have planned.

And Finally...

Like us on Facebook and visit our website (links are at the bottom of this page). We will be making regular updates with news and information about San Diego Who Con as it becomes available.

Help us get the word out by sharing on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Google+, Linkedin, etc. Because, we all want to say, "The Doctor is IN"... SAN DIEGO!

The Supporter ribbon


The Character ribbon set


The Doctor ribbon set


The Doctor’s pocket watch

story:
Why I am here....

First of all, thank you for clicking the link to my campaign. I am Flo Atkinson and I am a face painter/creative make-up artist. (The second one sounds better but essentially it's face paint first and foremost). The name of my business is Flourishes Face Painting. That is why I'm here asking for your help. I need the paint and equipment for all your lovely faces. I did have an ample kit, unfortunately it went walkabout (it walked off the bus!) one day near last Christmas when I was on the way home from work. This was a huge blow as it leaves me unable to work (Commercially or charitably) or fulfill any practice.

I love my job so much, but I am in the initial stages of growing my business. This means taking as much time as possible to perfect and learn new skills so I'm able to continuously progress towards making it a full-time profession. There are many costs to starting up, and before losing the kit I was well on the way to creating enough income from a few events to fund a proper marketing campaign. I needed/still need to gather a full gallery of images to contribute to a proper website in order to become accessible to a wider audience.

There are many other things that would definitely help enhance my business, but I'd like to feel confident that those things can come from my own hard work and perseverance. At the moment I feel useless and static without my paints. I love to be involved in as many community events as I'm asked to participate in, it's been really difficult to turn people down - especially when I know it's time I could have spent becoming better at what I do.

For me, there is no better feeling than transforming somebody into a work of art. The process of creating something, which comes from visualing an individual as a canvas. Taking in their personality and applying the paint to suit; enhancing their character/beauty. Feeling/seeing the joy this manifests is priceless.

Help me get my paints back people! 

What I Need & What You Get

  • I need £500 to get the basic kit back - all of the colours, brushes and glitter that were lost. This will provide me with enough paint to see me through spring and summer. This will allow me to take part in community events which are done as a charitable donation of time and skill.
  • Whilst I do work commercially I also contribute to the community by doing free charity gigs. Please feel free to contact me about any projects that I can offer my skill to.
  • I am a completely self-taught artist. All of my designs are created through a mixture of specific techniques and improvisation. They are customised to the individual client. I offer a range of different services and would be honored to provide something really special for any sponsors.
  • The North East is a wonderfully exciting place to be at the moment. The amount of creative cohesion across the arts is really stepping up and I feel lucky to be witnessing that unfold. I hope to one day be able to place myself within that network of incredible artists, the collaboration of vivid minds that bring the arts community together in a powerful unison. 
  • Any funds that are contributed will go into materials which will allow me to broaden my skill set and create designs which are unique.

The Impact

  • I did a lot of soul-searching to whether launching this campaign was the right thing to do. The main thing that kept springing to mind was IS FACE PAINTING IMPORTANT ENOUGH? After asking myself this question, popping out of my mind at a rate of knots came to me many reasons why face painting is important. Here are a few:

  • It is a form of therapy, for both the painter and the painted. A creative exchange between the two; a chance to bring to life a very pure expression of character.

    It can allow individuals to become the characters that live in their imagination, to truly embody them. This transformation is a powerful and inspiring thing to witness.

    Face paint and make-up art for me feels like a domino effect. Once you paint somebody, it inspires creativity within them as they walk through the world as a canvas; an enhanced being, a new character.

    It blends beautifully with other art forms; enhancing theatrical/musical performances.

    Face painting is one of the first arts; an art which dates back to the origins of human culture. It's use as a symbol of spirituality or status, as an expression of emotion, a tribal bond or simply to enhance beauty – it is ingrained in us all.

    And the most important of all in my eyes – it spreads joy! The one thing people say when I have doubts about the importance of this job is always. “You make people happy.” And that is enough for me.

  • I am lucky and very grateful to have worked with brilliant people that have allowed my business to become integrated with events across the North East. One special mention would be the organisers of the wonderful yearly Vamos Festival which I will be again taking part in this year. Also, Newcastle City Council who gave me the opportunity to create designs for the New Years Eve Winter Parade. 
  • I spent two summers working alongside the incredible Big Love Inflatable Church at some amazing festivals where I learnt the difference between using the same designs over and over (boring!) and improvising and customising designs to each individual. It was an invaluable and inspiring time in my life that I will never forget.
  • I have a small website which I'd love people to have a look at : https://www.facebook.com/FlourishesFacepainting
  • If anyone has any feedback on the page, tips on how to improve it, what they would like to see. Constructive criticism absolutely welcome.

Finally, no matter what the outcome of this campaign - my passion for face painting will remain. So hopefully if you've read this, you'll see me around. I can paint your face or I can paint at your event and hopefully you'll understand what I'm talking about. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this.

Best wishes,

Flo the Face Painter.

    Other Ways you can help....

    • It would mean the world if you kind people could help me spread the word! Even if I don't reach my target, it will let people into my face paint world, giving out the message of who I am and how to contact me so I can continue my joy spreading mission!
    • Now you know about Flourishes Facepainting - if you like what you see, spread the word about the business! Feel free to calltext/facebook/email me anytime to discuss what I can offer.
    • Please use the share tools on this website - and spread through facebook/twitter all of those world wide web wonders!

story:
The Opportunity

Help to build the schooner Mermaid and by doing so help return daily classical schooner tours back to America’s “Clipper City,” Baltimore, Maryland.  There has not been such an activity in Baltimore since the schooner Clipper City left in 2006. This event ended almost a two decades of local service.  Known for its schooner traditions, Baltimore’s two active classic schooners provide valuable non-profit education programming or travel the world as iconic ambassadors of Baltimore and the State of Maryland.  Daily access for local public sails on these vessels is very limited.

The Goal

Brenda and Matt Rajkovich have established Schooner Mermaid, LLC to bring classic sail tours to Baltimore.  By donating to their effort you can be a part of the launch of a 48 passenger classic sailing vessel for service in Baltimore's Inner Harbor.  By offering sailing tours as well as a venue for special events and excursions, the Mermaid will show residents and visitors an enjoyable perspective of the city and its waters that echo back to the golden age of sail.

The People

Born in Baltimore, Brenda Rajkovich is a Maryland native.  She returned to the city in 2011 after her husband retired from active military service.  She is an accomplished jewelry designer and avid sailor.  Matt Rajkovich completed 20 years of service in the US Marine Corps which included combat tours in both Afghanistan and Iraq.  He is now being licensed as a 100 ton vessel captain.  With Baltimore as their home they have immersed themselves in the pursuit of a livelihood that encompasses their deep passion for sailing.  They are currently serving as crew aboard commercial motor and sailing passenger vessels.

The Challenge

Traditional lenders have closed their doors to this small business effort despite very strong credit, a highly regarded managerial background, and a successful business model.  However, the more funds they can raise through this campaign the easier it will be to attract private investors for the remaining funds needed.  With your help, they can launch the Mermaid and share the Baltimore Harbor, Chesapeake Bay, and the story of classic sailing with thousands of people each year.

Other Ways You Can Help

 If you're unable to contribute, you can still help! Please help us spread the word among your family and friends, and check out our social media pages: 

Facebook - Schooner Mermaid, LLC

Website - www.SchoonerMermaid.com

story:
*If you have a child with special needs and live in the San Antonio metropolitan area, please visit www.lkcsitters.com to sign up for our email distro. We will notify you when the permanent website is up and we start offering services.*

Loving Kind and Compassionate Sitters was born out of our experiences as parents of a unique and beautiful special needs child named Lilyana Kathryn Comstock (Lily Kate for short). Lily Kate has a rare genetic condition (Subcortical Band Heterotopia) that has left her with significant developmental delays and intractable epilepsy. As a result, she requires more attention, compassion, and patience than does a typical child. Finding a qualified and reliable babysitter for a child like Lily Kate, even in a city as large as San Antonio, is difficult to say the least. We've had several sitters come once, and refuse to come again, mainly because they are afraid Lily Kate will have a seizure on their watch. Now imagine children in a wheelchair, with a feeding tube, or with significant behavioral issues. How hard would it be to find and keep a sitter for a child like that? As every parent knows, having time for yourselves, time with your spouse, or time to get things done is the key to sanity.

That's where LKC Sitters comes in! Our babysitting company will cater to an under-served community of special needs families in San Antonio (approximately 40,000 children with special needs live in the San Antonio Metropolitan area, 2012 US Census). We will hire Special Education Students and Teachers, Occupational and Physical Therapy Students and Practitioners, as well as  Paraprofessionals to provide in-home respite and babysitting services. We can tell you from first hand experience that no service like this exists in San Antonio or most major metropolitan areas in the United States. Currently, special needs families have two choices; they can hire a sitter from a local babysitting service, or hire a sitter from a large national company, neither of which cater specifically to the special needs community or have sitters qualified to take care of a broad spectrum of special needs children.

This is a huge need that must be met, and we intend to meet it...with your help!

What We Need To Make This Happen

Cost Breakdown:

Website startup costs: We plan to buy a specially designed website with a fully automated scheduling system and an in depth special needs parental questionnaire that was created from scratch for a business exactly like ours. The cost of the site and the labor to get it up and running is approximately $7,000. 

Liability Insurance Cost: As you can imagine, liability insurance for a service like ours is higher than that or a normal babysitting company. Insuring our business  will cost approximately $3600 annually with $1,500 down. Some of what you contribute will go towards helping us pay for insurance while the business is in its infancy and not yet profitable.

Background Checks: All of our sitters will undergo rigorous background checks to ensure they don't have any type of criminal history. We are hoping to start the service with at least 15 sitters, meaning we will have to front the costs of 15 background checks at $35 each, for a total of approximately $525.

Advertising: We intend to print brochures and cards to be placed at as many local therapy facilities, family counseling centers, schools...etc. Printing 1000 business cards and 500 brochures will cost approximately $200. We plan to budget $1,000 to begin targeted online advertising on social media and special needs websites/blogs.

The Impact

By contributing to this effort you will help us make a huge impact in the lives of special needs families and children in Texas. No longer will they have to worry about finding qualified, caring, and patient in-home sitters for their children with special needs. You will be helping us meet a major need that is not currently being met by existing services in most major cities around the country.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you may not be able to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please use the sharing tools on the upper left-hand side of this page. You can copy/paste the link to Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, email...etc.
  • Thank you so much for your help!
  • If you have any questions about this campaign or the service in general, or think you might want to use the service in the future, please email us at LKCSitters@gmail.com

story:
Make sure to checkout the updates & Gallery!       

                  

We are Swankyz "Good Goods"  

Proudly Featuring

 "Michigan Made" 
USA & Fair-Trade!


We offer Unique, One of a kind  Gifts, Art and Fine Home Decor products and a large selection of Handmade / Michigan Made Items located in Manistee Michigan.

 Now we want to offer, with your help of just a small contribution, a much larger indoors and outdoor venue to help bring life back to our beautiful historic downtown !  

This isn't about us, we are happy to stay where we are, it's all about bringing life back to our  beautiful downtown, A place that most other towns would envy and a place for the whole community to enjoy...so come on and please get involved with this great idea! 

We have over 40 Artist and Master Craftsman in the store now and have so many other new prospects that would like to be here, we just can't fit all them in, there are so many wonderfully talented artisans and craftsman that need a place to showcase their work. We have found a building that would be awesome for a true Artisans Market Place, a place we believe for all the community to enjoy for years to come. A space where we could have our Artists and Craftsman inside like we do here at our current location now and then outside have room for more Artisans & Craftsman, plus plenty of room for local street performers, and community events, locally grown products and crafts, food vendors, music, kiosk rentals for local merchants that might want more exposure downtown and so much more! 

A place where we could have a festival type atmosphere year round that would draw in residents and visitors alike, with Artisans and Craftsman doing demonstrations, shows, fairs & exhibits to showcase their talent, and what a wonderful spot it would be for our sleigh-bell festival time as well! People love looking around and shopping in a Arts & Crafts fun type atmosphere.....it would be a all year long activity center for all to enjoy with something new each time you visit! 

The building needs a major amount of work to make it feasible to use for this purpose, The building itself will cost over $130,000 and conservative renovation estimates would be around $45-50,000 to get it in shape to even start this project.

 We are asking for $22,500 to help us with the start-up of this project and get the renovations started just as soon possible, before we commit to the building and now that spring is upon us we need to move on it quickly! 

I know this sounds like a lot of money, but if everyone on all our social media would get involved with just a small contribution, less than one spends on a cup of coffee, a App, a Music download or Slurpee, it's really not a lot of money for any one person!

This town has too many empty buildings downtown still, true some real good things are starting to happen, but this idea could really help put us on the map, a destination that would help bring visitors to the whole town which translates in more revenue more customers for all our merchants, restaurants, motels, etc....the entire community would benefit! 


Some of you already know us and we thank you for your awesome support here in Manistee! 

For those of you that don't, we opened our first store at 393 River Street Manistee Michigan in September 2013 after taking a ugly old martial art store and putting in many months of hard work, turned it into a beautiful new concept in Manistee, a Michigan Made-USA & Fair-Trade Store. (see the photos of both stores in the gallery) we were doing very well and received a very warm welcome by the community. But unfortunately our building was sold after just 6 months in business ( even though we had a verbal agreement to buy the building, live and learn!) never the less, we had to scramble to find another space in the middle of winter and we had a hard time finding one suitable, but eventually decided to rent a much smaller space just one block up from our old store, 363 River Street, but now sadly we are rapidly out growing this new space to accommodate all these fantastic Artisans that this new idea would allow. 

"Some people just can't contribute money, we completely understand that, but that doesn't mean you can't help;  Please get the word out on Facebook and share on all your Social Media, make some noise about our campaign and ask your friends to share this as well.....You might want to check out the Indiegogo share tools, and we would also appreciate and could use any volunteers once/if we get this project rolling."   


"Perks"
 We will have a "kudos" wall a fame with a name plaque for any larger contributors inside the store, plus many fantastic perks for all that contribute! If everyone shares this on "All Our Facebook Pages" and would contribute just a "BUCK", we can make this happen very easily with our social media help!  It would be such a great investment in our community that we all love and want to be a fun destination for locals and visitors alike, and we are confident we can make this marketplace a wonderful gathering spot the whole community will be proud to be a part of!  If we don't receive the full funding amount, we will use what funds we can to expand and/or re-configure our current location or possibly rent a larger retail space in downtown, if available, so we can accommodate as many Artisans possible.....Please Help!    


Thanks so much to all of you who give us your support!

"Team Swankyz"

Thanks so much to all of you who give us your support!
"Team Swankyz"

story:
Who we are

A group of friends and family united by their passion for all well-crafted things.  Willie and Duro, both long-time craft beer enthusiasts, started their homebrewing adventures six years ago.  A love of fantasy fiction and medieval history/culture inspired them to try other fermentations, and so began the quest for mead.  The rest of the companions are devoting their time and talents in other key areas, as well as learning to make mead themselves. Every partner has something they specialize in.  Julie, a graduate of LVC, is our financial taskmaster, making sure we stay on budget.  Jeanette is our party and event planner, skills she learned while working at the Lancaster IU13.  Stacy worked in logistics at Hershey and is turning that career's expertise toward our supply chain.  Alfonso is a jack-of-all-trades that can build or wire anything.  Last, but not least, Ken has a broad knowledge of the culinary arts, and is a gracious host.  Together we have the skills and expertise to succeed.

What is mead?

Mead is simply fermented honey, but that's not all.  In addition to being gluten free and delicious, mead is inspiring. Mead is one of the most mutable libations one can work with. Bending it to one's imagination takes artistry, experience, and skill.  Its complexity can rival that of any wine or whiskey, befuddling experts with every sip.  It can be as sweet as a desert wine or as dry as a bone.  Mead can be very high in alcohol, or lightly alcoholic like a domestic beer, and anywhere in between.  The flavors typically associated with mead are that of honey, fruits of all sorts, common or exotic spices and herbs...nearly limitless combinations.  Mead can be enjoyed next to a fire whilst being sipped from a snifter, quaffed from a horn at a revel, or in a ice-filled glass doing yard work.  It is truly an amazingly versatile beverage!

What is Meduseld?

Meduseld is a word from Olde English (it ain't old enough until you add that extra 'e'), which when translated to modern English means Mead Hall.  Tolkien, who would never let a good name go to waste, borrowed it for the name of King Theoden's Hall in The Lord of The Rings.  Back in the day, a mead hall is where everything important happened in a given community.  Celebrations, battle or raid season planning, weddings and wakes all took place in the mead hall.  Our mead hall will be a welcoming place where we can explore the amazing versatility of mead, a place where you can redefine your traditions.

Our Location

An old tobacco warehouse built near the turn of the last century provides our space with great wooden floors and beams.  The YMCA operates a daycare on the second floor here.  We make mead in the basement, and teach classes on how to do so as well.  Our small part of the first floor will serve as our mead hall...it's even hall shaped!  The surrounding area has seen lots of small business call it home, and it continues to attract that sort of growth.  The Lancaster Arts Hotel is right across the street, as well as The Fridge.  Our parking is across the street, next to the Lancaster YMCA proper.  It is a stone covered parking lot that has room for sixty vehicles.  The entire building is handicapped accessible through wheel chair lifts and an elevator.

Our needs

Our funding is just enough for us to start producing and getting the mead to flow in Lancaster, but we want to be able to do so much more for our customers.  Our small budget took a huge unexpected hit from permitting and licensing that siphoned money away.  We've been floating the business expenses while waiting on our licensing to be approved.  Add to that a new set of laws this August which allow us to sell Pennsylvania beer and spirits, for consumption on our premises, and you have a perfect storm of potentially missed opportunities.  We want to provide our patrons with the best experience possible.  Those same law changes opened up possible collaborations with some of the areas finest craft beverage artisans, but we need additional equipment, and cashflow to cover the overhead to do it right.  The money you donate will help us with purchasing additional tools and equipment for our mead hall and production.   We will also buy fermenters, tap systems, glassware, amazing spirits, mixers for cocktails, and fund our collaborative beer program.  It will also allow us to start robust barrel aging, something we are very excited to get underway!

What you get

We built each tier by trying to keep a balance in mind for you, as well as provide us enough money to make a huge dent in our needs.  The stacking tier model is one that we favored, because it allows the customer to choose a comfortable level to donate, while allowing for a building relationship between us and the customer.  We want to meet you and thank you in person.  Recognition for your generosity is important to us, that is why the Wall of Honor is important to us.  It will serve as a constant reminder of the people who helped us make our dream real.

Risks and Challenges

We have a strange set of obstacles ahead of us.  First, we need to familiarize people with mead again.  Our marketing strategy consists of a lot of outreach on social media, hosting events with other related businesses, and some traditional paths for getting the word out.  Second, our limited budget has kept our production capacity down...we can only afford so much fermenter space.  We have some workable solutions to that, such as purchasing more tanks as money comes in, and bulk storage in barrels...which will free up fermentation space.

Other ways you can help

If you've read this far, thank you for your time and attention.  If you can't or don't want to help us with money, you can help us by sharing this with your friends and family, send us a message and say hello.  Stop in and try our product.

This wouldn't be possible without those amazing flying, buzzing creatures...bees!  Be kind to them and remember: No bees, no food.  Use pesticides sparingly if at all, and let your clover grow for the first few weeks of spring.

story: My name is Adriane Anderson and I am born and raised in New York City. I am the youngest daughter of three, and the very good fortune of having a pleasant childhood. Currently I live in Westchester and work as an Operations Manager at a local cable company. Since a young age I have been responsible for both catering small family events as well as a family baker making a host of character themed cakes for special events. I’ve always had a passion for cooking/baking. For me, cooking alongside family has created an amazing bond within our household that you never outgrow. My dream is to have a few successful restaurants across the US and have Southern Accents become a household name.

story:
My name is Gary Lee. I grew up in the Missouri Ozarks. I'm a Veteran Soldier of over 8 years, an artist, and I love making awesome Whisky. I've been married 14 years to Misty and we have one daughter, and one on the way. Needless to say, I value family, community, and service to your fellow man. 

I came up with the idea in the Army while deployed in service to our country. I started making some promises to myself for what I would do when I got home and the order was a tall one: support local agriculture, create jobs, and promote tourism in the Ozarks. Our product is for the people that work the land, work with their hands, and tip tap all day long on the keyboard wishing they could be out in the woods making some shine.  
This campaign will allow me to realize this goal. I could go to a bank and get another loan, but the money isn't why I'm here. I'm looking for your support too. I want people to be a part of this because I'm not just making whisky, I'm investing in the Ozarks. Ten percent of my profits are going to after school programs in the rural, underserved areas of Missouri and Arkansas.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need 17,900 dollars to put us over the top. We started with bare land and worked out the hardest and most expensive parts like having the distillery, equipment, electrical, and the parking lot constructed. However,  we still need minor equipment pieces like pressure tanks, digital hydrometers, A/C units, etc. Above all we need to purchase more barrels, bottles, and grain. In order to scale large enough to launch our product with overwhelming success, we will need to purchase about 10k in grain alone.
  • We have some super soft T-Shirts, whisky barrels, planters, and other handcrafted goods to show how much we appreciate you helping us out.
  • In the strange event that we don't hit our goal, we will be buying grain with whatever funds we do manage to acquire.

The Impact

Your contribution will allow us to start out on the right foot and positively impact the lives of people in the Ozarks. You will allow us to fully realize our dream to create a true grain-to-glass experience and benefit Ozark schools. I've served our country for over 8 years, and I still continue to serve as a Soldier in the Arkansas National Guard. Help us serve our community in an everyday way by supporting our campaign!

Risks & Challenges

We have got a lot of work left to do still and a lot of whisky to make. We need to purchase a lot of grain in order to be able to produce enough whisky to hit our distribution requirements - about 15 thousand pounds. There is also the issue of barrels, bottles, and packaging.

The good news is that we have a winning team! Mike has several years of experience in industrial production and Fred has been making whisky with me for a long time. With Misty on board crunching numbers and keeping us in the black, I will allow me to focus on distribution, sales, and marketing. 

Other Ways You Can Help

For only one dollar, you can contribute. However, if funds are tight (and believe me, I've been there), then help spread the word or roll your sleeves up and pitch in. There is still a lot of infrastructure projects around the distillery that we need help with and we want as much community engagement as possible!
story_txt:
My name is Gary Lee. I grew up in the Missouri Ozarks. I'm a Veteran Soldier of over 8 years, an artist, and I love making awesome Whisky. I've been married 14 years to Misty and we have one daughter, and one on the way. Needless to say, I value family, community, and service to your fellow man. 

I came up with the idea in the Army while deployed in service to our country. I started making some promises to myself for what I would do when I got home and the order was a tall one: support local agriculture, create jobs, and promote tourism in the Ozarks. Our product is for the people that work the land, work with their hands, and tip tap all day long on the keyboard wishing they could be out in the woods making some shine.  This campaign will allow me to realize this goal. I could go to a bank and get another loan, but the money isn't why I'm here. I'm looking for your support too. I want people to be a part of this because I'm not just making whisky, I'm investing in the Ozarks. Ten percent of my profits are going to after school programs in the rural, underserved areas of Missouri and Arkansas.  What We Need & What You Get

We need 17,900 dollars to put us over the top. We started with bare land and worked out the hardest and most expensive parts like having the distillery, equipment, electrical, and the parking lot constructed. However,  we still need minor equipment pieces like pressure tanks, digital hydrometers, A/C units, etc. Above all we need to purchase more barrels, bottles, and grain. In order to scale large enough to launch our product with overwhelming success, we will need to purchase about 10k in grain alone. We have some super soft T-Shirts, whisky barrels, planters, and other handcrafted goods to show how much we appreciate you helping us out. In the strange event that we don't hit our goal, we will be buying grain with whatever funds we do manage to acquire.    The Impact Your contribution will allow us to start out on the right foot and positively impact the lives of people in the Ozarks. You will allow us to fully realize our dream to create a true grain-to-glass experience and benefit Ozark schools. I've served our country for over 8 years, and I still continue to serve as a Soldier in the Arkansas National Guard. Help us serve our community in an everyday way by supporting our campaign!   Risks & Challenges
We have got a lot of work left to do still and a lot of whisky to make. We need to purchase a lot of grain in order to be able to produce enough whisky to hit our distribution requirements - about 15 thousand pounds. There is also the issue of barrels, bottles, and packaging.
The good news is that we have a winning team! Mike has several years of experience in industrial production and Fred has been making whisky with me for a long time. With Misty on board crunching numbers and keeping us in the black, I will allow me to focus on distribution, sales, and marketing.    Other Ways You Can Help For only one dollar, you can contribute. However, if funds are tight (and believe me, I've been there), then help spread the word or roll your sleeves up and pitch in. There is still a lot of infrastructure projects around the distillery that we need help with and we want as much community engagement as possible!

story:
What is oodles?

 

oodles is a new way in which individuals can contribute towards local, national, and international good causes as well as spreading the word for those good causes to colleagues, friends and family, and their online following.

 

We're a non-profit organisation registering as a charity in England.

Here's how oodles works:

 

Join oodles!

Once launched you can become an oodles member by purchasing a kit'n'kaboodle starter pack for £5. The starter pack contains an oodles noodle (a cord that can be used as a necklace, bracelet, or anklet) and their first oodle (a wooden bead to thread onto the noodle and start their collection). Within the starter pack there is also a unique 2D bar-code and serial number that can either be scanned or typed into the oodles mobile app or website.

 

 

Receive oodles

Once in the oodles mobile app or on the oodles website you will be asked to register your details and scan your code to be allocated 400 oodles credits. If you wish, you can set up a regular donation, however a key principle of oodles is that there is no minimum contribution and you can donate as and when you like.

 

 

Give oodles

Now that you have a stack of oodles to give away, you can view featured good causes, search for charities by category, or select from recent and favourite charities, and allocate your oodles as you wish. You can change where you allocate your oodles as often as you wish. You can support many different charities at the same time, and can even divert your donation if there is an urgent appeal.

 

Spread oodles of love!

Giving oodles to good causes is not the end of the story. In order to spread the word for the good causes you support, you can choose to post your allocation to social media networks such as Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn, and of course you can wear your oodles bracelet and tell everyone you know!

 

Earn oodles more oodles

By spreading the word and posting to social media, you will unlock achievements and earn new oodles beads for your bracelet. Special edition oodles, showing support for a specific charity, can be purchased from the oodles store.

 

 

oodles is a non-profit organisation currently in the process of registering as a Charitable Incorporated Organisation. As such we are required to post annual accounts with the Charities Commission. However we want there to be total transparency and trust in our organisation. Therefore we will post monthly accounts on the oodles website as well as publishing the salaries of all company directors. When operational, oodles will make every effort to ensure that as much of your donation reaches charities as possible. oodles will retain a maximum of 5% of the value of donations to cover operating costs and development, however this will be assessed and reduced where possible. 

 

We need your help!

 

Within 24 months of operation we aim to generate £3 million in grants to UK charities. It's an ambitious project but with your help we know we can get there!

We are busy building the oodles mobile and web apps, establishing the supply chain and raising the oodles profile, but we need your help. The oodles team is made up of volunteers, all investment so far has come from friends and family but we have reached the stage where in order to bring the project to fruition we need additional funds for hosting costs and manufacturing stock ready to launch.

 

So become a founding member!

 

You can help us by becoming a founding member of the oodles community. As a founding member you will receive a limited edition pre-launch oodles bracelet and bead that you can wear with pride and spread the word about oodles. You'll also receive a special founder's achievement on your oodles user profile that is shown whenever you share an allocation on Facebook or Twitter.

Each month oodles will feature a number of charities in each region of England and Wales. These features are designed to raise the profile of small local charities that are struggling to find the funds necessary to continue their good work. As a founding member you can also recommend a charity to become one of oodles very first featured charities.

Your contribution will be used to ensure the on-time development and launch of the oodles platform. It will not form part of the oodles charity fund. But you will be the first to know when the platform launches and you'll be able to purchase oodles credits and support your favourite causes straight away.

Charity should be inclusive. An integral part of the oodles community is spreading the word to friends, family, and colleagues. It's just as important as the donation itself. So even if you can't purchase a founding members pack, please follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and LinkedIn.

 

The Team

 

FAQ

 

What does oodles earn?

oodles is a non-profit organisation currently in the process of registering as a Charitable Incorporated Organisation. As such we are required to post annual accounts with the Charities Commission. However we want there to be total transparency and trust in our organisation. Therefore we will post monthly accounts on the oodles website as well as publishing the salaries of all company directors. When operational, oodles will make every effort to ensure that as much of your donation reaches charities as possible. oodles will retain a maximum of 5% of the value of donations to cover operating costs and development, however this will be assessed and reduced where possible. 

Where does this 5% go?

The 5% fee that oodles retain pay for the platform and business operating costs. These include hosting fees and software costs, office rental, marketing and PR, salaries (for full time employees, Directors salaries will be published on the oodles website), volunteer expenses. Full monthly accounts, including a breakdown of the total amount granted to each charity, will be published on the oodles website.

Where can I get the kit'n'kaboodle starter pack?

When the service is launched, the kit'n'kaboodle starter pack will be available in selected high street retailers and the oodles online store.

When is oodles going to launch?

Every effort will be made to fulfill orders for oodles accessories made through this campaign before the end of 2016. This way you can wear your oodles charms and tell everyone about the community. However due to being a small team, we will not be ready to launch oodles until March 2017. Don't worry, we will keep you updated every step of the way.

How are donations made?

Donations can be made online through the oodles web and mobile apps using Paypal. This does not mean that you need a Paypal account, Paypal can also securely process debit and credit card transactions without registering. Paypal charges are currently being negotiated.

story:
Overview:

 Currently we are working with hobby sized equipment which makes it difficult to keep up with demand. With your help we can take our business to the next level! We're offering amazing tokens of appreciation for different levels of contributions. By donating to this campaign, you'll help us purchase the equipment we need to grow our business. Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and especially sharing this within your community!

Who are we?

Being the mother of a son with autism I noticed the need to spend more time with my son. Working a 60 – 70 hours per week as Parts Manager at my local Harley Davidson dealership and my husband was traveling extensively for his job, leaving little time left to work with our son. He was beginning to slip. Hence BJ’s Powerhouse LLC was born. Started in 2015 the business has steadily grown to the point of where we are at now. 

I have been diagnosed with Fibromyalgia. The fibro limits the amount of time I can spend sandblasting or prepping parts, however with the proper equipment we can cut prep time down to a quarter of the time it takes now.  Last year my husband was laid off from his job due to the drastic downturn in the oil industry. We now work side by side powder and ceramic coating everything from car parts to crafts.

We are much more than the sum of our parts!

I am the vice president of “School of Wags” a large breed dog rescue. We work with them on a regular basis by donating our time, offering gift certificates for auction as well as financial portions of projects all while also fostering 8 of these gentle giants

We are also involved with “Throttle for a Cure”, another non-profit that helps raise funds and awareness for children with cancer and their families. This cause was founded by a friend of ours when his 12 year old daughter was diagnosed with Ewings sarcoma. We donate gift certificates and custom one off pieces to them for raffle and/or auction to help raise funds that pay for family expenses and treatment for these kids and families dealing with this nasty disease.

Impact

By contributing to this project, you are not only investing in us, but two very worthy organizations which are so dear to our hearts. With your contribution we can take that vital next step in making our business the success we know it is destined to be.

What We Need

After much thought, careful planning, and a lot of discussion we have come to the conclusion that the growth and expansion of our little shop will not only help provide for our family, but will allow us to help these other great organizations.

What funding is for?

To take our next steps toward success we estimate that we would need to raise $31,000.00 for the following equipment and fees

  • A commercial air compressor: $12,000
  • Commercial sand blasting equipment: $4,000
  • Laser engraver: $13,000
  • Indiegogo + credit card fees: $1000 (estimated)
  • Reward shipping cost $500 (estimated)
  • Reward materials cost $500 (estimated)

 

Our Way of Saying Thanks

We’ve designed custom Tokens of our Appreciation to say thank you for your support. Check out the donation perks below, and visit the Bj’s Powderhouse  Facebook page to see more pics of our progress.

  • Company logo hats, t-shirts
  • Custom personalized engraved drink glasses or coffee mugs
  • Custom powder coated and engraved Yeti or RTIC mugs or cups
  • Gift certificates for engraved items for Christmas, birthdays, Valentines day, anniversaries or just because

story:
Hello! Thank you for visiting our campaign, we hope you find both inspiration and education in our video as we raise awareness about the multitude of benefits cannabis provides.

As leaders in the cannabis industry, we have collaborated together to launch a campaign to support an amazing organization called Cannakids.

Cannakids creates life changing medicine to help those suffering from serious illness, and we are truly humbled by the success stories we've heard from some of the amazing Cannakids and their families.

Cannakids first success story Sophie Ryan with Her Mother & Father

Cannakids success story Kayce & Wyatt Akridge with their Mother Jennifer Akridge

Cannakids success story A.J. Kephart with his Mother Sheila Kephart

Our goal is to provide $35,000 of funding to help these families afford medicine for their loved ones who are suffering from serious illness. With this funding, patients will receive the unique Cannakids THC & CBD medicine, which eases the symptoms of such challenges like chemotherapy, PTSD, autism, epilepsy, and much more.

Our exclusive Grow Give collection will give 100% of the proceeds to the families of Cannakids to provide life changing medication for their loved ones who are suffering from serious illness.

story:
Lusanda Maqoqa

I'm 28 years old, and making a living as a domestic worker in Cape Town. But that isn't my destiny - I want to create jobs, and a stable future for my family. I'm business-driven, and I was born with a passion for making people happy. The best way to do that is with food.

Many years ago I had the vision to open my own eatery. I've found the perfect spot, with high foot traffic from surrounding businesses, schools, and taxi ranks. I have restaurant experience, and potential access to a well-equipped, secure container-kitchen. Now I need your help to unlock this opportunity. 

Lulu's Eatery

Lulu's will be a place friends and family can sit down, enjoy some good local food, and have a good time. It will also cater to employees, customers, school children, and the many other passers-by in the area with quick, affordable takeaway lunches. Lulu's will bring people together, offering them a space to relax at the end of a long day!

What we need:

A container

Kitchen equipment

Product supplies

Cash flow for the first few months of business

What success will look like:

A fully functional, equipped- and supplied container kitchen and service hatch staffed by myself and two assistants in Langa.

Profit and business growth.

A sustainable life for myself, my family, and my employees. 

The bigger picture:

I'm driven, I have ambition, and I have a realistic vision for success. But with a full time job with small earnings, and my son and my brother depending on me, I cannot do it on my own. I want to become self-sufficient, and create jobs for people in my community, where there were none. Help me, and be a part of my story.

story:
Building a Stronger and Healthier Hawaii by Making Strength Contagious

To me, Kū means to stand firmly in who you are, to become that symbol of strength for your family and community, and to take responsibility of your life.

Aloha I'm Daniel Aipa, Creator and Founder of Kū Performance, a private training facility.  After spending 10 years away from Hawaii going to school, working in the health and fitness industry, and climbing my way up to be the Head Strength and Conditioning Coach at the University of Redlands for 21 collegiate sports, I moved back home 4 years ago determined to start a movement.  I created a website called The Kū Project and started Kū Performance with a vision of helping Native Hawaiians and Hawaii at large to become healthier and stronger through improving overall human performance.

Over the past 4 years Kū Performance has developed into a strong community of like-minded individuals who embrace the philosophy of "Build a Kū Body and Live Kū" because we believe our health and fitness is the ultimate asset in life, and that strength is contagious.  Over the years we have grown and we now have our first official Headquarters in Kailua, Hawaii.  A place that integrates sports performance, fitness, health, creativity, Hawaiian culture, and the Kū Lifestyle all under one roof.

But we need your help!  

Our vision for our HQ is to have a workspace where people can experience and learn diverse areas of fitness, encourage one another, and perpetuate the Hawaiian culture.  If we can reach our goal of raising $15,000 in 30 days, it will greatly assist in our efforts to build out our space to best serve our community.

 

HOW YOU CAN KOKUA

If youʻve been following our journey, you know that Kū Performance started off as a health and fitness site thekuproject.com and with me training out of my driveway in Kailua.  All along Iʻve focused on building our online presence through our website and social media (Instagram, Facebook, YouTube).

Four yearʻs later, after renting space at a school and another gym, and even spending time back in the driveway where we began, it's time to stand Kū and take that next step to build out our own space.  But doing so is a big deal.  This will only work if we assemble the grassroots support and Aloha which we are built upon.  

Your support will help us cover:

  • Equipment and Furniture
  • Business Insurance for the year
  • Turf Area
  • Operational expenses

Our goal is to reach $15,000 to get us started.  Of course, surpassing our goal would put us on cloud nine and make us more than ready to bring something unique and special to Hawaii.

As mentioned before, we recently leased a warehouse space in Kailua, Hawaii and have been training with what we have and doing what we do best...building Kū bodies to live Kū lives.  We like to stick with simple equipment and have a no-frills approach because we believe it's not about what you have, but what you do with what you have.  

In addition to small group and private training, and classes for individuals of all ages and backgrounds, we plan to host seminars that educate the community on fitness, health, and the Hawaiian culture.  Having our own space also aids in the creation of more quality content for The Kū Project and other digital media platforms, which serves as a fitness and health resource for Hawaii.

When we reach our goal, we can complete the build out, and finalize the equipment we need to continue to grow and accommodate more people. 

In exchange for your donation, you will receive all sorts of Kū perks.  There will be an opening ceremony, Kū Body Camp Classes, seminars and workshops, private training sessions, Kū Apparel, and a bunch of shakas and high fives along the way.

 

THE KŪ MOVEMENT

This vision isn't something that I just thought of overnight. It's been years in the making with hard work, patience, and an amazing support group (family, friends, and the Kū Project Community). Kū Performance will serve as a hub for like-minded individuals to come together to train hard, learn about fitness and health, empower one another, and perpetuate the Hawaiian culture.  I believe that a small group of strong individuals can make a big impact, which is why one of our goals is to make strength contagious - the stronger you become leads to a stronger influence you have on yourself and those who come in contact with you.  

Although the center is based in Hawaii, I believe that by sharing what it means to Build a  Kū Body and Live Kū and the concept of striving to BE KŪ we can have a global affect on those who learn about what we do.

What is my experience?

I've been in the fitness and health industry for over a decade (14 years) working my way up from being a front desk worker in a fitness center to becoming the Head Strength and Conditioning Coach for 21 collegiate sports and the Fitness Center Director at a university in southern California.

I promised myself that when I moved back home to Hawaii that I would build something that would make a difference for Native Hawaiians and the Hawaii community at large.  This is something that my kupuna taught me growing up - go out into the world and learn as much as possible but don't forget about home, don't forget to come back and make a difference.  

Well...I'm home and I'm prepared to make a difference with your help.  It's been a vision of mine for years to build a place that is based around integrating human performance, creativity, and the Hawaii culture because I truly believe it is a very powerful combination that will inspire people in and outside of Hawaii.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our story with your friends and family through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, through email, or at the next pa'ina (party).  

Overall, we greatly appreciate your support and Aloha. 

Want to learn more about The Kū Project and Kū Performance? 


Follow us on Instagram or Facebook
story_txt:
Building a Stronger and Healthier Hawaii by Making Strength Contagious
To me, Kū means to stand firmly in who you are, to become that symbol of strength for your family and community, and to take responsibility of your life.
Aloha I'm Daniel Aipa, Creator and Founder of Kū Performance, a private training facility.  After spending 10 years away from Hawaii going to school, working in the health and fitness industry, and climbing my way up to be the Head Strength and Conditioning Coach at the University of Redlands for 21 collegiate sports, I moved back home 4 years ago determined to start a movement.  I created a website called The Kū Project and started Kū Performance with a vision of helping Native Hawaiians and Hawaii at large to become healthier and stronger through improving overall human performance.
Over the past 4 years Kū Performance has developed into a strong community of like-minded individuals who embrace the philosophy of "Build a Kū Body and Live Kū" because we believe our health and fitness is the ultimate asset in life, and that strength is contagious.  Over the years we have grown and we now have our first official Headquarters in Kailua, Hawaii.  A place that integrates sports performance, fitness, health, creativity, Hawaiian culture, and the Kū Lifestyle all under one roof.
But we need your help!  
Our vision for our HQ is to have a workspace where people can experience and learn diverse areas of fitness, encourage one another, and perpetuate the Hawaiian culture.  If we can reach our goal of raising $15,000 in 30 days, it will greatly assist in our efforts to build out our space to best serve our community.

 

HOW YOU CAN KOKUA
If youʻve been following our journey, you know that Kū Performance started off as a health and fitness site thekuproject.com and with me training out of my driveway in Kailua.  All along Iʻve focused on building our online presence through our website and social media (Instagram, Facebook, YouTube).
Four yearʻs later, after renting space at a school and another gym, and even spending time back in the driveway where we began, it's time to stand Kū and take that next step to build out our own space.  But doing so is a big deal.  This will only work if we assemble the grassroots support and Aloha which we are built upon.  
Your support will help us cover:

Equipment and Furniture
Business Insurance for the year
Turf Area
Operational expenses

Our goal is to reach $15,000 to get us started.  Of course, surpassing our goal would put us on cloud nine and make us more than ready to bring something unique and special to Hawaii.

As mentioned before, we recently leased a warehouse space in Kailua, Hawaii and have been training with what we have and doing what we do best...building Kū bodies to live Kū lives.  We like to stick with simple equipment and have a no-frills approach because we believe it's not about what you have, but what you do with what you have.  
In addition to small group and private training, and classes for individuals of all ages and backgrounds, we plan to host seminars that educate the community on fitness, health, and the Hawaiian culture.  Having our own space also aids in the creation of more quality content for The Kū Project and other digital media platforms, which serves as a fitness and health resource for Hawaii.
When we reach our goal, we can complete the build out, and finalize the equipment we need to continue to grow and accommodate more people. 
In exchange for your donation, you will receive all sorts of Kū perks.  There will be an opening ceremony, Kū Body Camp Classes, seminars and workshops, private training sessions, Kū Apparel, and a bunch of shakas and high fives along the way.

This vision isn't something that I just thought of overnight. It's been years in the making with hard work, patience, and an amazing support group (family, friends, and the Kū Project Community). Kū Performance will serve as a hub for like-minded individuals to come together to train hard, learn about fitness and health, empower one another, and perpetuate the Hawaiian culture.  I believe that a small group of strong individuals can make a big impact, which is why one of our goals is to make strength contagious - the stronger you become leads to a stronger influence you have on yourself and those who come in contact with you.  
Although the center is based in Hawaii, I believe that by sharing what it means to Build a  Kū Body and Live Kū and the concept of striving to BE KŪ we can have a global affect on those who learn about what we do.
What is my experience?
I've been in the fitness and health industry for over a decade (14 years) working my way up from being a front desk worker in a fitness center to becoming the Head Strength and Conditioning Coach for 21 collegiate sports and the Fitness Center Director at a university in southern California.
I promised myself that when I moved back home to Hawaii that I would build something that would make a difference for Native Hawaiians and the Hawaii community at large.  This is something that my kupuna taught me growing up - go out into the world and learn as much as possible but don't forget about home, don't forget to come back and make a difference.  
Well...I'm home and I'm prepared to make a difference with your help.  It's been a vision of mine for years to build a place that is based around integrating human performance, creativity, and the Hawaii culture because I truly believe it is a very powerful combination that will inspire people in and outside of Hawaii.

story:
Why we are flying the flag for Tibet

Can you imagine not being allowed to fly the flag of your country? Worse still, being arrested, imprisoned and even tortured for doing so? For the people of Tibet this is an everyday reality designed to suppress their identity as Tibetans and to force them conform to Chinese rule.

The Tibetan flag, which is also known as the Snow Lion flag, is a powerful symbol of Tibetan national identity but is banned in Tibet under Chinese rule. More than six million people face brutal imprisonment for owning, waving or flying their national flag. It is censored from any media in China. Today, the flag is an enduring symbol of the Tibetan people’s struggle for freedom.

Standing at nearly 100 feet high, the Tibet Balloon is the largest Tibetan flag in the world and a symbol of peace and compassion. The Tibet Balloon flies around the world providing a unique and eye-catching opportunity to draw attention to the Tibetan issue and raising funds for charitable organisations working to support the cause of Tibet.

The design of the Tibet Balloon faithfully follows the symbolism of the flag in a three-dimensional form. In fact the Tibet Balloon is actually two flags which means that the design can be seen from all angles. The images below show how we were able to transform the one-dimensional  plan  into a three-dimensional balloon.

The story behind Tashi Gyaltsen, the Tibet Balloon

The idea for the Tibet Balloon arose out of the passion and expertise of two people with an interest in both hot air ballooning and the issues facing the Tibetan people.

Heaven Crawley has worked with refugees for more than 20 years and most recently has been working with young Tibetans in Sikkim, North East India. Some of these young people visited the UK as part of the TibetXChange programme and during their visits to schools and colleagues talked about the importance and symbolism of the Tibetan flag. Heaven and her husband Paul Dopson are also commercial hot air balloon pilots who have flown at numerous hot air balloon meets and fiestas around the world. They know that balloons attract huge amounts of public interest and that the photographs of them flying are circulated far and wide on via social media.

Heaven and Paul have often flown the Tibet flag from their own balloon and many people have asked about its meaning and significance. One day they had an idea…why not build a hot air balloon in the design of the Tibet flag so that it could be seen by thousands of people raising awareness of the Tibetan issue?

And so the idea for the Tibet Balloon was born!

Over a six month period Heaven and Paul worked closely with the Office of Tibet and the Tibetan Community in Britain to develop their ideas and to raise funds for the project and over the months that followed a number of very generous individuals made donations to enable the balloon to be put into production.

In July 2015, after months of planning and fund raising, the Tibet Balloon took to the skies for the first time at the Buddhist Monastery of Garraf in northern Spain. The balloon was blessed by the Most Venerable Jamyang Tashi Dorje Rinpoche in front of a gathered crowd of monks, Buddhist practitioners, Tibetan supporters and the national media. During the blessing the Rinpoche gave the balloon a Tibetan Buddhist name, Tashi Gyaltsen, and she is now known affectionately around the world as ‘Tashi’.

 

What we’ve achieved so far…

Since her blessing in Catalonia (Spain), the Tibet Balloon has been seen by literally hundreds of thousands of people. She has flown in five European countries (France, the Netherlands, UK, Spain and Italy) and on November 2016 she made her first appearance in Latin America when she flew in Mexico.  Tashi has a very strong following on social media and many of the photos and videos taken at these events are shared around the world.

The sight of the world’s largest Tibetan flag flying in front of thousands of people has not gone unnoticed by the Chinese authorities.  

Mysterious individuals purporting to be Chinese embassy officials have made numerous attempts to ground the Tibet Balloon. Ahead of her first free flight in France, officials from the Chinese consulate  protested against Tashi's appearance claiming that it would undermine relations between France and China if the balloon was allowed to fly. In the UK the efforts of Chinese officials to prevent the Tibet balloon appearing at the Bristol International Balloon Fiesta made the front page of The Guardian newspaper generating further publicity about the story of the Tibet Balloon and, in turn, raising awareness about the situation of the Tibetan people.

Indeed Tashi hits the headlines wherever she goes, appearing in countless newspapers and on TV news programmes.

Just as importantly the appearance of Tashi provides an opportunity for members of the Tibetan community and their supporters to organise events and activities around her appearance which create a shared sense of solidarity. It also provides opportunities to explain the symbolism of the flag and the restrictions on the rights of Tibetans to express their language, identity and culture to a wider audience than might ordinarily be possible.

In The Netherlands for example, more than one hundred Tibetans and Dutch supporters of the Tibetan people travelled to Ballonfiesta Barneveld from the city of Amsterdam to welcome Tashi on her first visit. The International Campaign for Tibet, the Tibet Support Group and the Tibetan Community in the Netherlands gave a traditional Tibetan welcome ceremony in honour of the Tibet balloon. The pilots were offered traditional Tibetan ceremonial scarves (khata) by Tibetan monks and representatives of various Tibetan organizations. The story was covered extensively by the Dutch press taking the story of Tashi, and images of the Tibetan flag, to an even wider audience.

We have been told that news of Tashi the Tibet Balloon has even reached those living within Tibet. Knowing that they have not been forgotten gives the Tibetan people hope for the future.

Tashi’s European tour 2017

The Tibet Balloon has achieved everything we hoped she would but we have come to realise that it has the potential to do even more than we imagined. As a result we are looking to raise the funds to take Tashi to eight European countries during the course of 2017. We are already working with the Tibetan community and their supporters in many of these countries.

There are three main phases planned for the tour. The more funds we are able to raise the further we will be able to go and the more people will get to see the flag fly for Tibet!

Phase 1           Italy and Catalonia (Spain) (April, May)

Starting from our European base in Mondovi, Italy we will visit the Italian Lakes for a flight in the Alps before travelling to Catalonia in Northern Spain for the XXXIV International Mercat del ram Balloon Trophy.

Phase 2           France, Luxembourg and Belgium (July/August)

We start Phase 2 in Provence (Southern France) flying over the beautiful rolling hills of lavender, before travelling north to Chambley for Mondial Air Balloons, the largest balloon festival in Europe and then on through Luxembourg to Belgium (and potentially also Germany) where we will join with supporters of the Tibetan community.

Phase 3           Switzerland, Lichtenstein, Austria and Germany (September)

We start in Zurich, Switzerland which is home to Europe’s largest Tibetan population, and then travel on to Balloontage Toggenburg followed by the International Libro Balloon Cup in Kirchberg, Austria. And we’ll be visiting the Tibetan community in Germany, via Lichtenstein, before heading home!

How far will your money take us?

We need to raise £10,000 to cover the costs of travel, accommodation, propane and entry fees for the events we plan to attend.

£1,500 will allow us to complete Phase 1 of the tour.

£5,000 will allow us to complete Phases 1 and 2 of the tour.

£10,000 will allow us to undertake the full tour taking in eight countries across Europe.

Our time spent organising the tour, preparing for the events and flying the Tibet Balloon will be provided for free, as it always has been, using our evenings, weekends and holiday allowances from our day jobs. We operate the Tibet Balloon on a non-profit basis with any proceeds from raffles and other fund-raising activities going directly to the organisations that work to support the Tibetan community.

Contributor perks

£5 Social media shout out

The Tibet Balloon has thousands of followers on Facebook and Twitter who love to hear about our supporters! Your support for the Tibet Balloon sends a powerful message to Tibetans living around the world, and particularly those in Tibet, that they have not been forgotten.

£10 Pack of five Tashi postcards

A pack of five beautiful postcards of Tashi with information about the Tibet Balloon for you to share with your friends - or keep for yourself!

£25 Limited edition signed photo

A limited edition photograph (7"x5") of Tashi flying the flag for Tibet signed by the pilots with a personalised message of thanks.

£50 Limited edition pin badge

A very special pin badge designed by Tibetan supporters in Mexico for Tashi's Europe 2017 tour. A truly unique pin badge for a truly unique project!

£75 Tashi t-shirt

Show your support for Tashi and the Tibetan people with this Tibet Balloon Europe 2017 t-shirt featuring a special logo designed by our Tibetan supporters in Mexico.

£100 Your name on the Tibet Balloon

An opportunity to have your name printed on a banner that will take to the skies with Tashi as she tours across Europe raising awareness of the Tibetan issue.

£500 Flight for one person

Have you ever wanted to fly in the Tibet hot air balloon? Here is your chance! We are offering an opportunity for one person to fly in Tashi in one of the eight countries that will be part of her 2017 tour of Europe*.

*You will need to make your own way to the location of the flight. All flights subject to local weather conditions. Further details available on request.

£1,000 Flight for two people

Have you ever wanted to fly in the Tibet hot air balloon? Here is your chance! We are offering an opportunity for you and a friend to fly in Tashi in one of the eight countries that form part of her 2017 tour of Europe*.

*You will need to make your own way to the location of the flight. All flights subject to local weather conditions. Further details available on request.

Other ways you can help

If you are unable to contribute to the Tibet Balloon's tour of Europe that doesn’t mean you can’t support us in other ways!

  • Spread the word. If you can’t donate, please let others know we are here!
  • Share our website with others
  • Share your photos of the Tibet Balloon with us on Facebook or Twitter, use the hashtag #TibetBalloon
  • Send us a tweet on Twitter @TibetBalloon and tag us #tibetballoon
  • Like us on Facebook and share our updates with your family and friends

  • Learn more about Tibet and the work of the Central Tibetan Administration (also known as the Tibetan Government-in-Exile) at tibet.net

We need to raise money but raising awareness is just as important!

story:
(ENGLISH BELOW)

Hjälp oss växa

Efter några fina första månader i Malmö Saluhall har vi nu bestämt oss för att flytta till en större och mer centralt placerad lokal. Vår uppstart har gått bra, men det måste bli ännu bättre om vi ska kunna fortsätta driva butiken. Och med ditt stöd, en egen lokal med plats för fler spännande lösviktsprodukter så kan det bli verklighet. Se nedan hur din donation hjälper oss.

Vår nya lokal ligger vid St Knut nära till Möllan, Folkets Park och Triangeln. Här planerar vi för att göra plats för ytterligare 50 produkter och även börja sälja färsk, lokalt odlad frukt och grönt.

Grams grundare, Rowan, har personligen investerat i den första fasen av affären, men ber nu alla som älskar konceptet och vill se det växa att hjälpa till.

Vår nya lokal vid St Knuts torget

 

Vad vi behöver & vad du får

Vi har som mål att samla in 120 000 SEK / € 12500 för att täcka kostnaderna för:

  • Grundläggande utrustning och möbler för att göra butiker mer effektiv och erbjuda kunder fler valmöjligheter och produkter – kylar, en kaffekvarn, grönsaksdisplay, behållare till ca 50 nya produkter (varje bulkbehållare kostar ca. 800 kr).
  • En plats att hålla workshops och föreläsningar om ”zero-waste” och andra teman relaterade till hållbarhet.
  • Reparationer och renoveringar av den nya butiken – installation av ett litet kök, bygge av förvaringsutrymmen, omputsning av väggar, sätta upp belysning.

 

Förmåner/"Perks"

Som tack för din hjälp erbjuder vi en rad fina "perks". Vad sägs till exempel om ett ”zero-waste” starter kit som hjälper dig att komma igång? Ett års rabatt på våra produkter eller varför inte en personlig ”zero-waste” coachning med Grams grundare, Rowan? Välj den belöning som intresserar dig och din plånbok. Vi är tacksamma för all hjälp - litet som stort!

Handla zero-waste med en "starter kit"

Mer om Gram

Gram är Sveriges första förpackningsfria livsmedelsaffär. Vi banar vägen för ett mer hållbart sätt att handla mat. Allt säljs förpackningsfritt i lösvikt. Vi uppmuntrar och gör det lätt för människor att ta med sig sina egna återanvändbara förpackningar. Detta så att de slipper slänga något när de kommer hem.

Vi erbjuder idag ca 170 olika produkter, inklusive torrvaror (pasta, ris, bönor, müsli, nötter, kryddor, sötsaker, m.m.), flytande varor (oljor, vinäger, honung och sirap) och hushållsprodukter (diskmedel, tvål, tvättmedel, m.m.).

Butiken i Malmö Saluhall

Varför förpackningsfria?

I Sverige slänger vi ca 480 kg hushållsskräp per person per år. I en värld där temperaturerna ökar och haven fylls av plast, är det viktigt att vi tänker om. Så att vi hittar sätt att minska vårt avfall.

Gram har ambitionen att skapa en vändning i Sveriges skräpproblem, genom att tillhandahålla sätt att handla mat med färre förpackningar. Samt genom att skapa ett forum för inspiration och diskussion kring en ”zero-waste” livsstil.

Vi har redan kickstartat en rörelse i Sverige och hjälper nu andra butiker att öppna runtom i landet, till exempel i Stockholm och Lund. Men vi vill göra mer. Och med din hjälp kan vi göra det.

Andra sätt du kan hjälpa till

Om du inte har möjlighet att bidra ekonomiskt är vi ändå väldigt tacksamma om du hjälper till att sprida information om Gram och vår crowdfunding-kampanj på sociala medier och till dina vänner. Det hjälper oss också – många bäckar små! Du kan även höra av dig till oss om du är intresserad av att vara volontär och hjälpa till med den fysiska flytten av butiken – info@grammalmo.se

Tack, from the bottom of our hearts.

-----

In English:

 

Help Gram relocate and grow

Support us and help make Malmö’s zero-waste shop bigger and better

Sweden’s first package-free, ”zero-waste” shop is moving and expanding. And we need your help! If you love our concept, take this chance to support us and help Malmö continue to show the rest of Sweden the way forward in sustainability and zero waste.

Thank you!

Rowan, founder of Gram

Help us grow

After a great first few months at Malmö Saluhall, we’ve now decided to move to a bigger and more central location. Our start up has been good, but we need to develop in order to continue to run the shop. And with your help, our own premises with space for more great products, we believe we can do it. See below for what we'll do with your donation. 

Our new shop is in St Knut, close to Möllan, Folkets Park and Trianglen. The plan is to have space for an additional 50 products, and add fresh, locally grown fruit and vegetables.

Gram’s founder, Rowan, has personally invested in the first phase of the shop, and now we are looking to anyone who loves the concept and who wants to see us grow to help and donate.

What We Need

We are looking to raise 120,000 SEK / / € 12500 to cover the costs of:

  • Essential equipment and furniture to make the shop more efficient and provide customers with more options and products - fridges, a coffee grinder, vegetable display, containers for c. 50 new products (each specialist bulk container costs c. 800 kr).

  • A space to run events for the community on zero waste, and other sustainability themed talks and workshops.
  • Repairs and renovations to the new shop - installing a small kitchen, building storage, re-plastering walls, adding lighting.

 

Perks

In return for your help we have a range of fantastic “perks”, which are like thank you gifts. From a beautiful zero waste shopping kit to help get you started, to a year of discounts or personalised zero-waste coaching with Gram's founder Rowan. Take your pick, we’re grateful for any support, big or small.

 

More about Gram

Gram is Sweden’s first package-free food shop. We are trailblazing a more sustainable way to buy food. Everything is sold in loose and by weight and we encourage and make it easy for people to bring their own reusable containers so they have nothing to throw away when they get home.

We currently stock c. 170 products including dry goods (pasta, rice, beans, muesli, nuts, spices, sweets, etc.), wet goods (oils, vinegars, honey and syrup) and household products (washing up liquid, soap, clothes wash, etc.). 

 

Why Package free?

In Sweden, we each throw away c. 480 kg of household waste per person per year. In a world where temperatures are rising and oceans are filling with plastic, thinking differently about the amount of trash we create is vital.

By providing a way to buy food with less packaging, and creating a forum for inspiration and discussion around living a “zero waste lifestyle”, Gram has an ambition to turn Sweden’s trash problem around.  

We have already kick-started a movement in Sweden and we’re now helping other stores to open around the country in, for example, Stockholm and Lund. But we want to do more. And with your help we believe we can.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially, please help spread the word about Gram and our crowdfunding campaign on social media and with your friends. Every little action helps.

You can also get in touch with us if you are interested in volunteering to help with the physical move of the shop - info@grammalmo.se

Thank you, from the bottom of our hearts.
