Vår uppstart har gått bra, men det måste bli ännu bättre om vi ska kunna fortsätta driva butiken. Och med ditt stöd, en egen lokal med plats för fler spännande lösviktsprodukter så kan det bli verklighet. Se nedan hur din donation hjälper oss.Vår nya lokal ligger vid St Knut nära till Möllan, Folkets Park och Triangeln. Här planerar vi för att göra plats för ytterligare 50 produkter och även börja sälja färsk, lokalt odlad frukt och grönt.Grams grundare, Rowan, har personligen investerat i den första fasen av affären, men ber nu alla som älskar konceptet och vill se det växa att hjälpa till.Vår nya lokal vid St Knuts torget Vad vi behöver & vad du fårVi har som mål att samla in 120 000 SEK / € 12500 för att täcka kostnaderna för:
Grundläggande utrustning och möbler för att göra butiker mer effektiv och erbjuda kunder fler valmöjligheter och produkter – kylar, en kaffekvarn, grönsaksdisplay, behållare till ca 50 nya produkter (varje bulkbehållare kostar ca. 800 kr).
En plats att hålla workshops och föreläsningar om ”zero-waste” och andra teman relaterade till hållbarhet.
Reparationer och renoveringar av den nya butiken – installation av ett litet kök, bygge av förvaringsutrymmen, omputsning av väggar, sätta upp belysning.
 Förmåner/"Perks"Som tack för din hjälp erbjuder vi en rad fina "perks". Vad sägs till exempel om ett ”zero-waste” starter kit som hjälper dig att komma igång? Ett års rabatt på våra produkter eller varför inte en personlig ”zero-waste” coachning med Grams grundare, Rowan? Välj den belöning som intresserar dig och din plånbok. Vi är tacksamma för all hjälp - litet som stort!Handla zero-waste med en "starter kit"Mer om GramGram är Sveriges första förpackningsfria livsmedelsaffär. Vi banar vägen för ett mer hållbart sätt att handla mat. Allt säljs förpackningsfritt i lösvikt. Vi uppmuntrar och gör det lätt för människor att ta med sig sina egna återanvändbara förpackningar. Detta så att de slipper slänga något när de kommer hem.Vi erbjuder idag ca 170 olika produkter, inklusive torrvaror (pasta, ris, bönor, müsli, nötter, kryddor, sötsaker, m.m.), flytande varor (oljor, vinäger, honung och sirap) och hushållsprodukter (diskmedel, tvål, tvättmedel, m.m.).Butiken i Malmö SaluhallVarför förpackningsfria?I Sverige slänger vi ca 480 kg hushållsskräp per person per år. I en värld där temperaturerna ökar och haven fylls av plast, är det viktigt att vi tänker om. Så att vi hittar sätt att minska vårt avfall.Gram har ambitionen att skapa en vändning i Sveriges skräpproblem, genom att tillhandahålla sätt att handla mat med färre förpackningar. Samt genom att skapa ett forum för inspiration och diskussion kring en ”zero-waste” livsstil.Vi har redan kickstartat en rörelse i Sverige och hjälper nu andra butiker att öppna runtom i landet, till exempel i Stockholm och Lund. Men vi vill göra mer. Och med din hjälp kan vi göra det.Andra sätt du kan hjälpa tillOm du inte har möjlighet att bidra ekonomiskt är vi ändå väldigt tacksamma om du hjälper till att sprida information om Gram och vår crowdfunding-kampanj på sociala medier och till dina vänner. Det hjälper oss också – många bäckar små! Du kan även höra av dig till oss om du är intresserad av att vara volontär och hjälpa till med den fysiska flytten av butiken – info@grammalmo.seTack, from the bottom of our hearts.-----In English: Help Gram relocate and growSupport us and help make Malmö’s zero-waste shop bigger and betterSweden’s first package-free, ”zero-waste” shop is moving and expanding. Repairs and renovations to the new shop - installing a small kitchen, building storage, re-plastering walls, adding lighting.
 PerksIn return for your help we have a range of fantastic “perks”, which are like thank you gifts. From a beautiful zero waste shopping kit to help get you started, to a year of discounts or personalised zero-waste coaching with Gram's founder Rowan. Take your pick, we’re grateful for any support, big or small. More about GramGram is Sweden’s first package-free food shop. We are trailblazing a more sustainable way to buy food. story:
My name is Eric Flambeaux. I am a native son of New Orleans that's passionate about our city's history and traditions. My knowledge of the city exceeds research, I am a product of its culture. From rolling in Mardi Gras parades as a young teenager, getting my first job as a beignet chef at Cafe du Monde at age 16, and being steeped in our city's customs; I not only live in New Orleans, New Orleans lives in me.   

Flambeaux Bicycle Tours was born out of a desire to combine two passions: the history of New Orleans and bicycles. I give bicycle tours not only because it's the best way to see the city. I am passionate about bicycles and their possibilities as a transportation alternative in urban environments. 

Flambeaux Bicycle Tours will share the dominant narrative of New Orleans history, but will also tell the history of our city through the eyes of those who fought for social justice. Starting with the impact of the Haitian Revolution, we will touch on the German Coast uprising of 1811, the New Orleans Massacre of 1866, the L'Union periodical edited by Paul Trévigne, the heroic action of Homer Plessy, along with other topics that has brought our society closer to equality.

Your contribution will go towards starting a business that will be an asset to the New Orleans community. Not only will we give 1% of our profits to Bike Easy (bikeeasy.com), once established we seek to create programs for at-risk youth in the community. These programs will include an earn-a-bike program, teaching bicycle mechanic skills, and training tour guides that could one day be employed by Flambeaux as we expand.

To launch Flambeaux Bicycle Tours we need to raise $20,000. The following is a breakdown of where those funds will be allocated:

  • Business Insurance                      $5,000
  • Business Permit                            $500
  • Fidelity Bond *                                $1,500
  • Lease and First Months Rent    $4,000
  • 11 Handlebar Baskets                  $120
  • 11 Bells                                              $60
  • 11 Helmets                                       $130
  • 11 Head Lights                                $250
  • 11 Tail Lights                                   $180
  • 11 Quick Release                           $88
  • Grease                                              $20
  • Lube                                                  $15
  • Air Pump                                         $40
  • Mini-Pump                                      $30
  • Mechanic Tools                            $5,000
  • Bike Repair Stand                        $200
  • Truing Stand                                  $70
  • Tubes                                               $120
  • Signage                                           $800
  • Advertisement                              $1,877
  • Total**                                             $20,000

 

* The New Orleans Ground and Transportation Bureau requires that I have a $10,000 fidelity bond.

**$20,000 is the minimum that we need to launch. We are hoping to raise more then that to have an operating budget. If Flambeaux Bicycle Tours does not reach it's $20,000 goal, the funds will still be used to get this business started. Thank You!!!

Our promo video was shot by Harry Bartle of Ariel Projects.

story:
Why our campaign?

We started in 2013 with approx 2000€ (the money for 10hl of beer) and we re-invested everytime the profits till last year when we brewed 1000hl, this while we even helped unlucky people (and still do!).
Why? because for us beer is an art, and art is social!

Since the 2013 with our beers we won many awards like being voted 2 consecutive times in the Top10 of OBER Kerst Bier Festival in Essen and in the top50 beers imported in Sweden in 2015. We also have several beers in the italian top50 for Ratebeer as we are in the top italian breweries for Untappd.
We won for 2 consecutive times the Luppolo D'oro golden medal @ Birrinitaly and a silver medal at Nordic Beer Challenge in 2016.

 Through our beers we try to spread our emotions and passion.

We have planned to invest these money from part of our 2016 invoices profit, but one our customer hasn't payed the invoices (they are trying to steal our money with crazy excuses) so we need to take a lawyer, this of course cause some troubles on our plans, so we thought to open this campaign to be able in the meanwhile to buy more oak barrels and rent some more warehousing space for them.

Our goal would be to be able to  brew more oak aged beers, to experiment more and to give to people the chance to taste more crazy beers from our twisted minds.


FOR YOU:

We basically need to buy approx 20 oak barrels of which bourbon, rum, whisky, tequila, plus renting some space and then we will buy some racks to put the barrels on.

If we don't reach the entire goal, we will make sure to buy enough barrels to satisfy your palates :)

All our oak barrels purchases will be showed on our Facebook page with transparency. 
We are in the market since the 2013 and we are exporting our beers in many countries. we are extremely trustable people!

SUPPORT OUR CAMPAIGN:

Please, donate us your help and if you want choose an item in exchange!

Please Note:
^shipping rate is not included and may vary per each country^
^All the items will be shipped in a time that may vary from september 2017 to beginning 2018"
^We are not sure that we can ship packages everywhere, so please check the laws of your country"
^For producing the beers and the t-shirts we need to win the campaign"

Other Ways You Can Help?

Please spread the link and the word, the more you can. Thank you so much for your support!

story:
THE RESTAURANT
Love & Honey Fried Chicken is a local, take-out fried chicken restaurant that serves scratch-recipes of timeless comfort favorites.  Located in Northern Liberties, Philadelphia at 1100 North Front Street with plenty of area parking and one block from the Market-Frankford station on Girard Avenue.  The restaurant is 99% take-out and delivery but has a counter with about 12 seats.

 

HOURS
Monday: Closed
Tuesday: 11:30-10:00
Wednesday: 11:30-10:00
Thursday: 11:30-10:00
Friday: 11:30-11:00
Saturday: 11:00-11:00
Sunday: 11:00-9:00

OPENING MENU
FRIED CHICKEN

Have one piece or have many… you choose your mix:
Breast / Thigh / Drum
3pc w/ Cornbread and Honey Butter (breast, thigh & drum)
6pc w/ Cornbread and Honey Butter (2 breast, 2 thigh & 2 drum)

SIDES
Cornbread w/ Honey Butter
​Slaw
Mac & Cheese w/ Crispy Breadcrumbs
Braised Collard Greens w/ Smoked Turkey Leg
Pimento Cheese w/ Toast
Dill-Pickled Vegetables
Hoppin’ Jawn  (We had to get one “jawn” in, cause you know… Philly. 
Our take on Hoppin’ John: a rice dish and black-eyed pea dish with bacon and pickled peppers.)

Don't know what a JAWN is? Watch this clip from the 2015 movie Creed.

 
PIES
Banana Pudding – not a pie, but trust us you won’t care.
Sweet Potato Pie
Chocolate Cream Pie
Seasonal Pie

Bottled Beverages
Awesome Local Coffee

Whole pies are available to order!

THE CHICKENS – NO ANTIBIOTICS EVER.
When we started searching for a purveyor we had a few non- negotiables in mind.  First, we would only procure the most humanely raised and processed birds.  Second, we would only serve chicken that was free of hormones and antibiotics. And third, that we would be able to meet the farmers and the chickens in person.  We are so fortunate to have been able to find exactly what we were looking for in Coleman Natural Foods™. Shortly after meeting the team from Coleman, we were invited to spend a morning on one of their chicken farms in Dover, DE – about 80 miles south of Philadelphia. We learned so much about how the birds are raised, what they eat and how they are ultimately processed.  We saw healthy, happy birds that live in a temperature controlled house with lots of light – and on warm sunny days can leave their shelter to roam free on the farm’s property.  Most importantly, Coleman birds are NO ANTIBIOTICS EVER. This is different from Antibiotic Free – and it’s an important distinction to understand.  Antibiotic Free means that a farmer can give the birds antibiotics up two weeks before processing believing it should be metabolized by the bird before it reaches your plate.  NO ANTIBIOTICS EVER means just that…  Coleman does not use any antibiotics ever with their birds. 

Here’s a great video from our day at the farm and further explanation on the difference between antibiotics free and NO ANTIBIOTICS EVER.

After the farm we headed another hour south to the Perdue Processing Plant in Milford, DE. We were so impressed with the humane methods this plant uses in processing the birds and the safety and sanitation practices that are enforced throughout the entire plant. We’re so proud to be able to say we’re in business with Coleman and the iconic American brand Perdue.

 

OUR STORY
(We know this is in 1st and 3rd person, but we don't always follow the rules.)

Our story starts in 2007 when we met at The Culinary Institute of America.  Laura, a ‘95 CIA grad and went back to work at the school in 2006 where Todd was a student… scandal.  We bonded over our love of Philadelphia; coincidently both being from this area but having met in upstate NY.  The PG version of this story is we met, flirted, fell in love, and have been inseparable ever since.  There is a much more indecent version of this story, but we don’t know you that well yet so don’t make it weird.  You get the picture.  In 2011 we moved back to Philadelphia together and had a foodie dream wedding at DiBruno Bros. 

Todd, an ACF Certified Executive Chef worked in restaurants for many years before heading to culinary school.  After moving to Philly, he was with Aramark at Citizens Bank Park and the LINC and most recently and notably was senior research and development chef for Campbell’s Soup across the bridge in Camden, NJ. We should mention that Todd is obsessed with basketball and says he is only doing the “chef thing” until the NBA calls.  (Insert Laura rolling her eyes here.)

Laura’s career started in Princeton, NJ area restaurants and catering companies before shifting focus to corporate food service, culinary brand development, marketing and consumer culinary education.  After CIA where Laura held the role of Director, Food Enthusiast Programs for five years she started  Good Dish Consulting - a food marketing company and Dish with the Yenta - a traveling cooking school in Philly.  After a year of running her own businesses, she accepted the role of Director of National Consumer Culinary Education for Le Cordon Bleu.  In 2015 when that school closed its doors, Laura & Todd decided it was time to take the plunge and venture out on their own.  Laura is addicted to Bravo TV and is gunning to be on the next season on The Real Housewives of Fried Chicken.

 

CHICKEN, SIDES & PIES
Why Fried Chicken?  Todd’s been perfecting his recipe for years… the brine, the spice blend, to buttermilk or not to buttermilk…  we ate A LOT of fried chicken. Everyone loves fried chicken.  It makes people happy when they eat it – in fact they don’t even have to eat it – just talking about it gives them the feels.  We were especially witness to this while standing in front of the Zoning Board of Philadelphia and after reviewing the menu all nine committee members looked up in unison and smiled.

 

The sides are all seasonal comfort food favorites – all made with fresh ingredients that are as local as possible.

And, save room for pies.  Really.  Laura worked hard on a buttery flaky crust recipe and doesn’t take kindly to when someone says they “aren’t a dessert person.”

HOURSMonday: ClosedTuesday: 11:30-10:00Wednesday: 11:30-10:00Thursday: 11:30-10:00Friday: 11:30-11:00Saturday: 11:00-11:00Sunday: 11:00-9:00
OPENING MENUFRIED CHICKEN
Have one piece or have many… you choose your mix:Breast / Thigh / Drum3pc w/ Cornbread and Honey Butter (breast, thigh & drum)6pc w/ Cornbread and Honey Butter (2 breast, 2 thigh & 2 drum)
SIDESCornbread w/ Honey Butter​SlawMac & Cheese w/ Crispy BreadcrumbsBraised Collard Greens w/ Smoked Turkey LegPimento Cheese w/ ToastDill-Pickled VegetablesHoppin’ Jawn  (We had to get one “jawn” in, cause you know… Philly. Our take on Hoppin’ John: a rice dish and black-eyed pea dish with bacon and pickled peppers.)
Don't know what a JAWN is? Watch this clip from the 2015 movie Creed.

 

PIESBanana Pudding – not a pie, but trust us you won’t care.Sweet Potato PieChocolate Cream PieSeasonal Pie
Bottled BeveragesAwesome Local Coffee
Whole pies are available to order!
THE CHICKENS – NO ANTIBIOTICS EVER.When we started searching for a purveyor we had a few non- negotiables in mind.  First, we would only procure the most humanely raised and processed birds.  Second, we would only serve chicken that was free of hormones and antibiotics. And third, that we would be able to meet the farmers and the chickens in person.  We are so fortunate to have been able to find exactly what we were looking for in Coleman Natural Foods™. Shortly after meeting the team from Coleman, we were invited to spend a morning on one of their chicken farms in Dover, DE – about 80 miles south of Philadelphia. We learned so much about how the birds are raised, what they eat and how they are ultimately processed.  We saw healthy, happy birds that live in a temperature controlled house with lots of light – and on warm sunny days can leave their shelter to roam free on the farm’s property.  Most importantly, Coleman birds are NO ANTIBIOTICS EVER. This is different from Antibiotic Free – and it’s an important distinction to understand.  Antibiotic Free means that a farmer can give the birds antibiotics up two weeks before processing believing it should be metabolized by the bird before it reaches your plate.  NO ANTIBIOTICS EVER means just that…  Coleman does not use any antibiotics ever with their birds. 
Here’s a great video from our day at the farm and further explanation on the difference between antibiotics free and NO ANTIBIOTICS EVER.After the farm we headed another hour south to the Perdue Processing Plant in Milford, DE. We were so impressed with the humane methods this plant uses in processing the birds and the safety and sanitation practices that are enforced throughout the entire plant. We’re so proud to be able to say we’re in business with Coleman and the iconic American brand Perdue. OUR STORY(We know this is in 1st and 3rd person, but we don't always follow the rules.)Our story starts in 2007 when we met at The Culinary Institute of America.  Laura, a ‘95 CIA grad and went back to work at the school in 2006 where Todd was a student… scandal.  We bonded over our love of Philadelphia; coincidently both being from this area but having met in upstate NY.  The PG version of this story is we met, flirted, fell in love, and have been inseparable ever since.  There is a much more indecent version of this story, but we don’t know you that well yet so don’t make it weird.  You get the picture.  In 2011 we moved back to Philadelphia together and had a foodie dream wedding at DiBruno Bros. Todd, an ACF Certified Executive Chef worked in restaurants for many years before heading to culinary school.  After moving to Philly, he was with Aramark at Citizens Bank Park and the LINC and most recently and notably was senior research and development chef for Campbell’s Soup across the bridge in Camden, NJ. We should mention that Todd is obsessed with basketball and says he is only doing the “chef thing” until the NBA calls.  (Insert Laura rolling her eyes here.)Laura’s career started in Princeton, NJ area restaurants and catering companies before shifting focus to corporate food service, culinary brand development, marketing and consumer culinary education.  After CIA where Laura held the role of Director, Food Enthusiast Programs for five years she started  Good Dish Consulting - a food marketing company and Dish with the Yenta - a traveling cooking school in Philly.  After a year of running her own businesses, she accepted the role of Director of National Consumer Culinary Education for Le Cordon Bleu.  In 2015 when that school closed its doors, Laura & Todd decided it was time to take the plunge and venture out on their own.  Laura is addicted to Bravo TV and is gunning to be on the next season on The Real Housewives of Fried Chicken. CHICKEN, SIDES & PIESWhy Fried Chicken?  Todd’s been perfecting his recipe for years… the brine, the spice blend, to buttermilk or not to buttermilk…  we ate A LOT of fried chicken. Everyone loves fried chicken.  It makes people happy when they eat it – in fact they don’t even have to eat it – just talking about it gives them the feels.  We were especially witness to this while standing in front of the Zoning Board of Philadelphia and after reviewing the menu all nine committee members looked up in unison and smiled. The sides are all seasonal comfort food favorites – all made with fresh ingredients that are as local as possible.And, save room for pies.  Really.  Laura worked hard on a buttery flaky crust recipe and doesn’t take kindly to when someone says they “aren’t a dessert person.”

story:
Barrel Room Craft Pub & Eatery will be south eastern Wisconsin's premier bar and restaurant that specializes in craft beverages and gourmet styled pub food. There will be a strong emphasize on craft beer and the rotation of the various different styles from the many different craft breweries. Other craft beverages like mead, cider, spirits and wine will play a big part in our inventory. The Barrel Room will also function as a bottle shop and growler station. We will have bottles, cans and growlers that will be for purchase to go. The food will be pub styled with a twist of class and flavor. We are taking it up a notch and will provide a menu that will spark your taste buds. There will be a daily, weekly and seasonal specials to add to the variety of delicious meals to choose from.

The plan was to open the Barrel Room at the end of the summer of 2016  but unforeseen life situations and expenses has put us in a situation to run this campaign and to ask for help, so we can bring the Barrel Room Craft Pub & Eatery to life. We are trying to raise enough capital to help make our dream place come true and to bring something different to the area.

We are extremely passionate about the craft beverage industry and would like to share our interest with everyone. Through in house literature and discussions, we want to share our knowledge and introduce different styles plus brands to people. We will also host special tastings and discussions with the makers of various craft beverage producers.

By contributing to our campaign, you will be involved in the development of a new and exciting place to dine and enjoy some drinks.  

 

What we need & What you'll get

We are seeking a minimum of $20,000 to help finish funding the start-up costs to open the business. As the development progresses, we will post the activity on social media and website to keep everyone up-to-date.

There are perks set up for almost everyone to be involved, everything from gift certificates, clothing, glassware, events and more. We want everyone who invests to be able to receive something for their support beyond our gratitude.

If we don't reach our goal, we will still continue  to try and make this happen. We will evaluate how far we are from achieving our goal and that will determine what we are able to do. If we are too far away and doesn't look possible, we will refund the money to everyone that invested. If we are able to successfully make it happen, we will continue on and honor the investments. Our minimum is set for $20,000 but could actually use more to help with any unexpected costs that may come up. The campaign will stay active after the deadline, feel free to continue with the support.

Most perks will receive a invite to our Soft Opening weekend. Everyone who is invited to the soft opening will have the opportunity to check out the Barrel Room before it's open to the public. All invites will receive 50% off drinks and meals, unless the inclusive soft opening invite is purchased. There will be more details about the soft opening once the date and times are announced. 

Here are layouts for some of the perks.  The shirts are available in various colors and most sizes, including tall. These are early examples of the items and may change a little before they are finalized.

  

 

 

The clothing and glassware perks will be fulfilled within the first 8 weeks of opening. When these perks are in, we will message everyone when they can stop by the Barrel Room and pick them up. Any purchases from outside the local area will be shipped to them.

 

The Impact

This business will have a different value to everyone. Local area people will be happy to have a new place to dine and enjoy some drinks. The people outside of the area may consider it a place to visit or just happy to help. Anyone that lives in the area or is planning on visiting sometime will benefit from having a new place to go. A place where they can enjoy some delicious food and enjoy a variety of craft beverages.

The owners of the Barrel House Craft Pub & Eatery will bring years of business and management experience to aid in the success.

Dave is a Kenosha native with over 20 years experience in the Restaurant and Bar Industry and has been involved in all aspects of operations. He has been involved in promoting Craft Breweries before the term was even coined. Dave is also home brewer and BJCP beer judge. His views of quality over quantity is the focus around the development of an establishment like the Barrel Room.

Catherine is a Texas transplant with many years of experience owning, operating and managing businesses. Her southern hospitality really shines from her kind and caring nature to go the extra mile to make people feel at home.

Combined they will have every aspect of the business operations covered.  

 

Risks & Challenges

The restaurant business is risky but when it's combined with a quality product and a trained friendly staff, the risk becomes less of a worry. Then the addition of alcohol for both on premise and off premise purchases will increase business, as well as our customer base. Our location will not be too big and will not have a high operating cost. This will keep us in the safe zone of operating at a cost that won't hurt us.

The impact of craft beverages upon a business is becoming a big benefit to the people who enjoy the products and to the people who are wanting to know more about the various styles. The problem with many establishments that try to start serving craft beverages is they don't really know what they are serving and usually find the worst examples to stock. When this happens, the people that are curious and want to try something new are often turned off and relate this as a negative experience. We will provide a variety of quality products that are picked by people who are experienced, so we can provide a positive experience for our guests.

Over the past 10 years, the craft beverage industry has exploded. Craft beer has been on the forefront of this explosion with nearly tripling the amount of breweries. The larger brewing companies have taken notice to this and are purchasing some of the successful craft breweries.

View statistics relating to the number of breweries.

View Wisconsin Craft Beer Sales for 2015.

Since Kenosha is close to Illinois and not too far from Chicago, we should consider statistics from Illinois as well.

View Illinois Craft Beer Sales for 2015.

Another consideration would be the upward growth of Kenosha, WI over the past ten years as well. Many businesses and people are relocating to the area, which increases the amount of money coming in and spent within the area. The city itself is developing it's attraction to tourists as well as new citizens. The once dying city has been redeveloped for a more prosperous future. In 2015, Kenosha County ranked fourth in the state for tourist money generated and with projection of it increasing in the years to come.  

 

Other ways you can help

If you're not able to help us financially but would still like to help, the best way is to help us spread the word.

  • Spread the word - The more people know about this, the better chance we will have to raise the money and open sooner.
    • Share this campaign on social media.
    • Tell people you know or meet.
    • Email this campaign to anyone you feel would be interested.
  • Referrals - Receive perks for supporting us and referrals.
    • Click here for directions.

Thanks for viewing and we hope there is enough interest in helping us get this business off the ground.

story:
About Ourselves:  

Hello everyone, our names are Milan and Andoni. Milan is the coordinator of Indra Organic Village and I am a student volunteering in Nepal. Milan has been developing this idea for long time ago and I am just helping him starting the project. We are planning to develop the whole idea in the long term so the crowd funding campaign will be just the beginning. We hope that this first step is successful so we can continue to work in this project and many others to come.

About Project:

Indra Organic Village is a project established to help connecting local grassroots level farmers to organic aware consumers for promoting their locally grown organic products in the villages of Nepal. The main objective of the project is to improve the livelihoods and day by day lifestyle of local communities by marketing their locally made organic products. By producing organic products in an eco-friendly way we aim to optimize quality production in all aspects of agriculture and environment, making sure it is the best for both the customer and the soil.

We appeal you to be a part of our social cause by supporting our Indiegogo campaign; which will greatly help us to expand our network and provide fair prices to more farmers. We take responsibility for the entire supply chain - from production to packaging and distribution - and eliminate the unnecessary role of middlemen in order to ensure economic empowerment of more farmers who have been exploited by middlemen till now! Let’s make this collective effort a great initiative for helping the small farmers in Nepal! 

What We Need:

Our campaign is aimed for raising the amount $ 3000 needed to establish and organic shop outlet for Indra Organic Village. 

 

Your contributions will be used to cover:

 

  • Shop Outlet rent
  • Lorries rent for Product Shipment.
  • Buying products (To anticipate money to the farmers)
  • Packaging Products
  • Operations, Taxes and Media Outreach  

 

When costs are covered the remaining money will be used with social purposes in the local community, in projects like community learning centers, children schools or farmers training.

 

 

How We Reward You?

 

You can help us achieving this goal by donating our Indigogo campaign, and you will be given different gifts in gratitude. We value greatly every donation and any amount of Contribution from you, but if you give more than US $ 50, to thank you we would like to offer the choice of the following gifts:

  • $ 50 and above      Indra Organic Village Green Tea from Nepal (250 gm.)
  • $ 100 and above    Indra Organic Village Green Tea from Nepal (500 gm.)
  • $ 250 and above    Token of Love + Indra Organic Village Green Tea from Nepal (500 gm.)
  • $ 500 and above    Token of Love + Indra Organic Village Green Tea from Nepal (1 kg.)
  • $ 1000 and above   Farm Visit (one week) + Token of Love + Indra Organic Village Green Tea from Nepal (100 gm.) 

Note:

Once you have donated, please send an email us to info@indraorgicvillage.com  Saying:

  • Date / time and amount you donated,
  • Your address and contact email and/or telephone. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute to the campaign by direct cash donation but still there are many other ways you can help us; the success of this campaign is directly correlated with our ability to connect with the greatest number of people possible. So, please help us sharing our campaign with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, and by email.

You can also help us joining the different volunteering and internship programs in Nepal. We kindly invite you to visit the Indra Organic Village web page http://www.indraorganicvillage.com  and to write to info@indraorganicvillage.com  if you are interested in any of our volunteering or internship project in Nepal.  

Thank you for your Great Contributions towards helping local farmers and uplifting their communities through Sustainable Agriculture Developments in Nepal Villages!

story:
Short Summary


  • My Name is William Kirby, I am an IT technical support analyst for the NHS, and in my spare time I am a gamer. I have been running audio-surf 2 competitions Every year for the last few years, with our biggest give-away in prizes last Christmas. This year I wanted to make it even bigger, by Donating to Great Ormond Street Hospital.

  • One thing that I know and love is Music, and there is something about it that soothes the soul, calms and heals me, and many others too when they are feeling a little down.

    So bringing music and charity and gaming together in seems like a great Idea, people love to win prizes, people also enjoy listening to music, and people love playing games. yet there are many kids out there that don't get to enjoy these simple pleasures, and it is with this in mind that I am looking to Donate a minimum of £3000 to the G.O.S.H Charity.

  • As a contributor to the campaign not only will you be helping the children in one of London's most prestigious Childrens hospitals, you will also be participating in one of the biggest Audio-surf 2 Christmas competitions to date.

    We plan to have £500 worth of prizes for the players enjoying the game, and a £5000 to give to charity. but our Goal amount is £3000

What We Want & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Ultimately we will want to raise £5000 over the course of the next month, the funding breakdown and what it will go to are as follows.

    £500 - this is for the gamers Prizes, which will be broken into 2 competitions in total. The Mono and Pro gaming competition.

     - £200 Mono - For newer or less skilled players of the game. Lower prize value but still notable - there are a number of individuals that will not be able to participate in this they will be informed.
     - £300 Pro - Open for all people, with a much higher prize pot for players.
    All prizes will be rewarded via steam gaming vouchers.

    £500 is to be kept to pay for the costs of the campaign and to enable the individuals supporting here on indiegogo to receive their goodies, which will be things like - small game bundles (purchased via Humble bundle, (which in itself is another charity donation) Tee-shirts, and other supporter goodies. which you can read about here later.

    All the rest of the money that is raised will also be going to G.O.S.H. and if we beat our target then we can be certain that that is also going to G.O.S..H.

  • UNIQUE Perks,
    For those that are supporting the Campaign, we have various perks and things lined up for you. including, memorabilia such as the "2015 GOSH XMAS Gaming" tee-shirt through to Humble Bundles.

  • If We don't reach our goal the funds that are raised will be going to the prizes and the Charity as a guarantee. 

About Great Ormond St Hospital

After a long campaign by Dr Charles West the Hospital for Sick Children was founded on 14 February 1852 and was the first hospital providing in-patient beds specifically for children in England. it is now one of the worlds leading hospitals for children and currently has 387 beds specifically for children. For more information about the hospital you can read up Click here

Our Campaign will help to enable the following to happen over the Christmas period. and with enough supporting funds, will allow us to go beyond the Christmas period too, here is the impact that even a small donation from each of you can help.

  • Fund parent accommodation so that mum and dad can stay with their child when they need them most.
  • Support research into pioneering new treatments that can save children's lives.
  • Rebuild and refurbish the hospital so we can treat up to 20 per cent more patients.
  • Pay for specialist medical equipment to give our patients the best possible chance of recovery

Risks & Challenges

The Biggest challenge is to raise the awareness of the campaign to a level that everyone will be able to participate. and be aware of. what with it being Christmas, we know everyone is tightening their belts, but Christmas is about giving and that is what we are here to do.

  • We Promise, that when we give the cheque to G.O.S.H. there will be evidence of our handing the money over to them.
  • if we raise enough money to warrant the need for a cheque payment there will be a photograph of us handing this cheque over to them - and it will be posted on our website for you to see. if we are able to do the donation on-line then we will post the screen-shots as evidence for you all.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to contribute to the campaign or you choose not to, you could do us a favour and spread the word, to all members of the community, around the world.

  • If you are in the UK you can Visit our Shop on tboom by following these links and buy one of our t-shirts
  • https://www.tboom.co.uk/game-for-gosh
  • https://www.tboom.co.uk/as2-competition
  • https://www.tboom.co.uk/gaming-for-gosh
  • Get the word out and make some noise about what we are doing here, be it on social media, via facebook or twitter, or word of mouth, let people know.
  • and use the Indiegogo share tools! to tell people about us!

And that's all there is to it.

they are feeling a little down.So bringing music and charity and gaming together in seems like a great Idea, people love to win prizes, people also enjoy listening to music, and people love playing games. yet there are many kids out there that don't get to enjoy these simple pleasures, and it is with this in mind that I am looking to Donate a minimum of £3000 to the G.O.S.H Charity.
 As a contributor to the campaign not only will you be helping the children in one of London's most prestigious Childrens hospitals, you will also be participating in one of the biggest Audio-surf 2 Christmas competitions to date.We plan to have £500 worth of prizes for the players enjoying the game, and a £5000 to give to charity. but our Goal amount is £3000
    What We Want & What You Get Break it down for folks in more detail:  Ultimately we will want to raise £5000 over the course of the next month, the funding breakdown and what it will go to are as follows.£500 - this is for the gamers Prizes, which will be broken into 2 competitions in total. The Mono and Pro gaming competition.  - £200 Mono - For newer or less skilled players of the game. Lower prize value but still notable - there are a number of individuals that will not be able to participate in this they will be informed. - £300 Pro - Open for all people, with a much higher prize pot for players. All prizes will be rewarded via steam gaming vouchers.£500 is to be kept to pay for the costs of the campaign and to enable the individuals supporting here on indiegogo to receive their goodies, which will be things like - small game bundles (purchased via Humble bundle, (which in itself is another charity donation) Tee-shirts, and other supporter goodies. which you can read about here later.All the rest of the money that is raised will also be going to G.O.S.H. and if we beat our target then we can be certain that that is also going to G.O.S..H.
 UNIQUE Perks,For those that are supporting the Campaign, we have various perks and things lined up for you. including, memorabilia such as the "2015 GOSH XMAS Gaming" tee-shirt through to Humble Bundles. 
 If We don't reach our goal the funds that are raised will be going to the prizes and the Charity as a guarantee.  
    About Great Ormond St Hospital

After a long campaign by Dr Charles West
 the Hospital for Sick Children was founded on 14 February 1852 and was 
the first hospital providing in-patient beds specifically for children in England. it is now one of the worlds leading hospitals for children and currently has 387 beds specifically for children. For more information about the hospital you can read up Click here Our Campaign will help to enable the following to happen over the Christmas period. and with enough supporting funds, will allow us to go beyond the Christmas period too, here is the impact that even a small donation from each of you can help. 

Fund parent accommodation so that mum and dad can stay with their child when they need them most.
Support research into pioneering new treatments that can save children's lives.
Rebuild and refurbish the hospital so we can treat up to 20 per cent more patients.
Pay for specialist medical equipment to give our patients the best possible chance of recovery
   Risks & Challenges  The Biggest challenge is to raise the awareness of the campaign to a level that everyone will be able to participate. and be aware of. what with it being Christmas, we know everyone is tightening their belts, but Christmas is about giving and that is what we are here to do.  We Promise, that when we give the cheque to G.O.S.H. there will be evidence of our handing the money over to them.
if we raise enough money to warrant the need for a cheque payment there will be a photograph of us handing this cheque over to them - and it will be posted on our website for you to see. if we are able to do the donation on-line then we will post the screen-shots as evidence for you all. 

   Other Ways You Can Help Even if you are unable to contribute to the campaign or you choose not to, you could do us a favour and spread the word, to all members of the community, around the world.  If you are in the UK you can Visit our Shop on tboom by following these links and buy one of our t-shirts 

https://www.tboom.co.uk/game-for-gosh
https://www.tboom.co.uk/as2-competition
https://www.tboom.co.uk/gaming-for-gosh
Get the word out and make some noise about what we are doing here, be it on social media, via facebook or twitter, or word of mouth, let people know.
 and use the Indiegogo share tools! to tell people about us!
   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Madiba Restaurant is at risk of closing. 

Madiba has been a ‘Place of Love’ in Brooklyn, NY, since 1999. Resembling the spirit of a traditional South African Shebeen and honoring Nelson Mandela. We have attracted some of the most colorful people and have fostered innumerable relationships. We know that our tenure has been, in great part, due to our loyal community of customers, whom we now consider friends and family.

 Madiba is more than a restaurant For 17+ years not only have we offered quintessential culture, cool vibes and awesome cuisine we have also made an impact by serving the diverse people of NYC and South Africa We created Handup to promote education, social justice, urban renewal, equal LGBT and racial rights initiatives .

We have supported:

INFINITE FAMILIES / UBUNTU EDUCATION FUND / AMANDLA DEVELOPMENT / PRATT AREA COMMUNITY COUNCIL / INTERNATIONAL GAY & LESBIAN HUMAN RIGHTS COUNCIL / PS 20 CLINTON HILL SCHOOL / GAY MEN'S HEALTH PROJECT NYC / and many others.

In lieu of rising costs, increasing rent, questionable lease renewal ,an ongoing tax dispute combined with the unfortunate demise of the Madiba Harlem venture I am at risk of closing Madiba restaurant.  As one can imagine the wear and tear after 17 busy years has taken its toll and Madiba is also in need of updated equipment and internal repairs.  Depending on how much money is raised and the questionable said lease will determine Madibas’ future success and be a deciding factor for its location.

We know that Madiba has become your second home. We want to continue to offer the menu, experience and support that have put us on the global map.  We encourage you to still come and dine with us, as any support will help to protect our future. Furthermore, we are hoping we can rely on our family and friends to recommend and consider Madiba for corporate parties and caterings during the holiday season.

Thank you for your support. No matter how large or small your contribution is greatly appreciated.

story:
For the Love of Nature, Lavender, Roses & Tea!

We are pleased to introduce to you, "Thoughtful Expressions of Nature,"  Blue Dreams USA's signature collection inspired by nature, lavender, roses and tea. With your support you can help us achieve our dreams and campaign goal. Your support will also allow us to provide help to others, including scholarship funds for needy students, maintain the agricultural nature of our farm, and produce thoughtful gifts for the love of nature and Mother Earth.
We thank everyone who has helped us to get to where we are, including recent media news. 
IN THE NEWS: BLUE DREAMS USA - Thoughtful Expressions of Nature

PERKS FOR YOUR EARLY BIRD SUPPORT:

We hope our dreams, passion, music and story will inspire you to join us in our journey. In return for your support, our lovingly handmade, hand-painted, hand-blown perks are here ready to delight you.  Each gift has a story. Each was inspired by nature, lavender, roses & tea. Each item claimed will give back for the love of nature as we work hard to plant more lavender, roses and tea plus other trees!

Early birds get the perks in time for gift giving for your loved ones this holiday season!  Check out this video for details. 


WORKING HARD FOR OUR DREAM

Our dream is a simple dream, simple joy, but grand in spirit!  We hope you will be inspired to read our full story, and come along with us in our new journey.  Our campaign is a short period of time, but the impact of your help and support is long lasting.  With your help, we hope to create a legacy to give back to Mother Earth through our farm,  and to continue making our love for nature the core of what we do.

Jeff working hard to make our lavender field and rose gardens beautiful.

Watering and taking care of our land means a beautiful field for our family and community to enjoy!

Thousands of friends and followers joined us in Facebook in just a few months since we first publicly shared our journey and plans for Blue Dreams USA in late Spring 2015. We were and still amazed and grateful for the overwhelming response.  Now, we need all our Facebook friends, the Indiegogo community, all our friends, loved ones, and you!  Join us in our journey to create a lasting legacy for the love of nature, lavender roses and tea. 

As a gift to her wife, Jeff planted roses that bloomed profusely in spring.

Your gift of support is a gift that gives back to Nature! For example, we plan to plant more fruit trees, vegetables, lavenders and roses for everyone to enjoy.  A portion of proceeds for those who become is also going to be donated to RMHS Global's Scholarship Fund serving the needy students.  

As a rose is the single most symbol of love, respect, dedication, and admiration, the Gift of Rose is a fitting show of love in appreciation of your support.  It fits perfectly in the palm of your hand ready to delight your heart and join hands with us through our exclusive Radiant Red Rose.  Get it as a perk, and may it spark your heart to read our story and dream with us! 

    The Radiant Red Rose Hand-blown Glass - A Gift of Love & Beauty!

OUR STORY:  

Jeff & Imelda, Owners, Blue Dreams USA Farm and our dog Raleigh

Blue Dreams USA - For the love of nature, lavender, roses & tea!

Our dream for Blue Dreams USA began in a barren land in Frederick, Maryland. We bought this small farm in 2004 with a dream rooted from our love for nature, fruits, vegetables, flowers, and a clean, eco-friendly environment.  Just like millions of people, we set aside our dreams for a long time for a more stable corporate career.  It was only about two years ago that we realized the opportunity to fulfill our dreams through our farm.  We took a leap of faith, gave up a lot of life's conveniences, and downsized our home.  

We began a new journey planting seeds of hopes and beautiful flowering plants, trees, vegetables, and more.  Many friends followed our journey in Facebook, and joined us in the spirit of friendship.  Their moral support took away the perspiration from hard work of tilling our land to plant our first lavenders, roses and trees. The blue birds and the butterflies were also there to perk us up inspiring some of our signature work.   

We want to share this awesome feelings with you as we capture this inspiration from living elements in our farm. For example, take a look at this nine-inch tall vase inspired by Blue Fortune flowers and blue butterfly, and a stunning blue birds glass nest with three eggs.  This last piece captures a moment with grand kids hunting eggs during Easter. Both exclusive glass arts come with a wish for good fortune and happiness. It is one of the perks to thank you for your support!

"The Blue Fortune Flowers and Sapphire Butterfly Vase, and the Blue Bird Delight glass nest with three eggs come with a wish for good fortune and happiness. We have put some of our eggs and love into this nest, so to speak, to hope one day our efforts will multiply. We pass them to you as perks with a wish for good fortune and delightful abundant life! Your gift of love means more birds and butterflies will have a safe haven, more kids can play safely at our farm!"- Imelda

THE CHALLENGE OF FARMING

Since we moved to our farm in March 2014, we learned first hand that farming is not an easy thing.  We have come to appreciate farmers even more.  It means hard work, perspiration, physical pain, not to mention poison ivy, weeds, snakes, stink bugs, plant diseases, harsh weather, and more.  This is especially true for Jeff who retired from corporate work.  Now, he is doing most of the hard work in our farm.

Planting our first lavenders in Fall 2013

But, just imagine if we do not support our farmers and agricultural lands.  This made us more passionate about our dream and commitment to sustain and maintain the agricultural nature and natural beauty of our farm for you, our family, and community to enjoy.  

OUR VISION: From the food we eat, to the drink we drink, to products we bathe with and put on our skin, over time, we envisioned to pull together various elements in our farm that will showcase our love for nature and Mother Earth.   Our goal is to maintain the agricultural nature and make our farm sustainable, eco-friendly.

To ensure we achieve this goal, we are now developing a farm-based business around Lavender, Roses & Tea, three plants we love most.  After all, lavenders are known as "Blue Gold" for their diversity of uses and amazing values. Roses are the most beloved flowers and our favorite; while the tea is the most consumed beverage next to water.  The simple joy of being around nature and what we love made us feel young!

Aside from live plants, we are developing value-added natural products derived from these plants.  In the future we have other plans for additional products, fruits and vegetables. As we progress, with your help, you will find these products available along with various tea blends, handmade soaps, essential oils, sachets, and much more. You will be able to buy all our products and visit the farm when we open our farm to the public in 2016. 

THOUGHTFUL EXPRESSIONS OF NATURE
Despite the challenges of farming, we love our peaceful farm and our new home. This new life has inspired us in many ways. The farm has become our creative playground. The lavender, roses, tea, butterflies, bees, birds and other living elements have become our regular companion inspiring us with "Thoughtful Expressions of Nature."  In a short period of time, we were able to develop thoughtfully designed exclusive products we think are worth sharing.  As nature inspires art and beautiful music in our hearts, our signature collection is full of music, colors, stunning details, and unique artful designs reflecting the immense beauty of nature around us.

This signature exclusive collection brings back the magic of handmade, hand-blown and hand-painted products. At senior age, our creative imagination has been refreshed, renewed, and sharpened by nature.  All the designs are based upon natural elements we see in and around our farm.  Imelda personally designed every piece and even wrote songs inspired by Blue Dreams USA, and our love for the world we live in.  Check the video, to see how how one of our hand-blown glass vases was made.  Each piece takes three days to cure.  
 
The Cobalt Lavender Blossom Vase is one of the perks in this campaign.
We also have  many beautiful and stunning photographs that have been turned into works of art.  In 2016, we will publish and release a "tea-table" colorful book to share our moments with nature, our Moments with Raleigh, our dog who enjoyed our farm so much, but he is no longer with us to enjoy the fruits of our hard work. Diagnosed with cancer to live for only three months, he stayed on for over a year enjoying Imelda's lavender cookies.  We also have so many beautiful photos showcasing our "Thoughtful Expressions of Nature" and "Raleigh's Moments."

Embarking in something fresh, creative and beautiful is a new challenge, but tremendously exciting and purpose-driven!  You can begin a new life at any age and our exclusive product designs capture the imagination of all ages.
Our very first Indiegogo campaign focuses on our exclusive signature collection, "Thoughtful Expressions of Nature," nature-inspired gifts handmade lovingly. This includes handpainted  "Tea Time Moments" Tea Pot Sets Collection, hand-blown glass, arts and more.  


Our Blue Dreams USA Farm

Strategically located near major cities of Washington, DC, Baltimore, Northern Virginia and other outlying areas of West Virginia and Pennsylvania, we hope one day you can come visit us and a spend a moment with us.  
The gift of nature all around us a gift we wish to share back to our community and you! We were blessed to be stewards of this land and it is not our own to just keep for ourselves. Hence, despite the challenges of getting permits to open this to the public, we expect to open in late Spring-Summer 2016. In the future, we see our farm not only bursting with natural scents and colors of flowers, but will showcase what we can do with a small farm like ours. 

The Impact - Simple Dream. Grand in Spirit!

The work we do in our farm is a celebration of the importance of farming and the love for nature. We have year-round crops planted by farmers who rely on soya, corn, barley, and wheat for a living.  We also have other plans in the future for vegetables and fruit bearing trees, so your help will help us continue what we have began. For the love of nature, our goal for our farm is for it to be sustainable and eco-friendly.  

Our small contributions will help in the world's conservation efforts.  Every plant and tree we plant will help in this.  The almost ten acres of forest space is one that we value that in July 2014, we entered in Forest Stewardship Plan with the State of Maryland. This means that we are committed to keeping the trees surrounding our open space and to maintain this forest through effective weed control practices and crop tree management.

However, we recognize that farming is not easy so we have designed our agri-business in such a way we have other sources of revenues like our exclusive products you see in this campaign. This will allow us to sell online in addition to live plants we will only sell in our farm.  Your gift of support will give something to all of us to enjoy.  In return we will give you our nature-inspired perks only available at Blue Dreams USA.  

As we are on retirement age, yet a life of new beginnings, we also hope the success of our venture will prove that dreams can be attained at whatever age we are in.  Our love for nature is also a commitment to pass on this legacy to our children and grandchildren.  This is the grandest of all!

In our farm, our children and grandchildren can play safely just like what we had when we were young.  Everyone, young and old can visit our farm and enjoy the beautiful scenery. Walk through the fields or hike through the woods.  This we hope is our ultimate legacy to our community. 

For Your Gift of Support - A Gift of Nature!

From our farm to your home, please bring the love of nature into your home sweet home through our Thoughtful Expressions of Nature signature collection.  Your support will help us continue what we have begun in our farm to make it a place worth visiting and a moment to remember for you and our guests. It will help us sustain its agricultural nature for our community to enjoy!  For  now your "Moments with Nature" comes in the form of perks all inspired by nature. 

Through your early support, order and feedback, we can also determine which among the exclusive products will be popular. With this valuable input, we can focus our funds to producing those that are more viable designs.  We will use the funds to produce larger quantities and carry those popular items in our farm boutique and in our online store for larger numbers of people to enjoy. Your help will also bring additional products such as lavender soaps and oils, and special blends of tea to drink.  We hope to grow more plants and trees for generations to enjoy!

In exchange for your help, you will be among the first to receive our exclusive designs as perks.  We have limited quantities available for delivery before the holiday gift giving.  Those perks are marked "EARLY BIRD."  All others will have to wait when we open our farm boutique in late Spring/Summer 2016. 

Perk Up Your Holiday with a Gift of Nature!

Our creative designs bring back the magic of hand-painted, hand-blown, handmade artisan quality items.  We have produced limited quantities for immediate delivery so you can see that these designs are all REAL and not just a concept.  

Being able to introduce our exclusively designed signature collection inspired by nature, lavender, roses and tea here at Indiegogo is heartening.  

Shipping & Other Info

WHEN WE WILL SHIP:  Early bird supporters will get the items in time for the holidays.  Orders received for the final week of the campaign ending December 10th, will be shipped the week of December 15th. 

WHERE WE SHIP:  Depending on the item, we will ship to the US 48 Contiguous States and Canada on "Early Bird" perks such as teapot sets and hand-blown glass. 

WORLDWIDE SHIPMENT:  For music and books, these are available for worldwide shipping at book rate, with digital music ready for immediate downloads.  The "tea-table" book will be shipped when it is released in Summer 2016.  

International delivery of hand-blown glass pieces and tea pot sets may be arranged with shipping cost to be paid by buyer based upon locations. You may contact us for shipping and you can pay the extra shipping cost by way of contributions. 

SHIPPING & HANDLING COSTS:  Our tea pots set and hand-blown glass pieces require extra handling and most of them are substantially heavy.  Hence, the estimated shipping and handling costs reflect rates for 48 Contiguous USA and Canada only.  

LIMITED QUANTITIES:  Once this initial limited quantities are all claimed or sold out, we will accept pre-order for 2016 delivery.  Hand-painted tea pot sets and hand-blown glass take time to finish.  Hence, our next shipment after we sold out will be late Spring/Summer 2016. 

NATURE OF PRODUCTS: The challenge of producing hand-painted, hand-blown and handmade products is the limitation on how many we can produce. To this end, we hope you act early so you can be among the first to get some pieces available for immediate delivery. 

Due to the nature of handmade, hand-painted, and hand-blown products, details such as colors, detailed finish, and weight may vary.  

REFUND POLICY:  We stand by our commitment to deliver as promised.  We will adhere strictly to Indiegogo's refund policy. We reserve the right to cancel the order once all inventories are claimed unless you request pre-order delivery for 2016. 

The success of our efforts will be dependent not only on our passion and dedication, but also on our supporters.  Thank you everyone for your support!

Jeff and Imelda

Roses @ #BlueDreamsUSA, Spring 2015

Strategically located near major cities of Washington, DC, Baltimore, Northern Virginia and other outlying areas of West Virginia and Pennsylvania, we hope one day you can come visit us and a spend a moment with us.  
The gift of nature all around us a gift we wish to share back to our community and you! We were blessed to be stewards of this land and it is not our own to just keep for ourselves. Hence, despite the challenges of getting permits to open this to the public, we expect to open in late Spring-Summer 2016. In the future, we see our farm not only bursting with natural scents and colors of flowers, but will showcase what we can do with a small farm like ours. 
  The Impact - Simple Dream. Grand in Spirit! The work we do in our farm is a celebration of the importance of farming and the love for nature. We have year-round crops planted by farmers who rely on soya, corn, barley, and wheat for a living.  We also have other plans in the future for vegetables and fruit bearing trees, so your help will help us continue what we have began. For the love of nature, our goal for our farm is for it to be sustainable and eco-friendly.  


Our small contributions will help in the world's conservation efforts.  Every plant and tree we plant will help in this.  The almost ten acres of forest space is one that we value that in July 2014, we entered in Forest Stewardship Plan with the State of Maryland. This means that we are committed to keeping the trees surrounding our open space and to maintain this forest through effective weed control practices and crop tree management.
However, we recognize that farming is not easy so we have designed our agri-business in such a way we have other sources of revenues like our exclusive products you see in this campaign. This will allow us to sell online in addition to live plants we will only sell in our farm.  Your gift of support will give something to all of us to enjoy.  In return we will give you our nature-inspired perks only available at Blue Dreams USA.  
As we are on retirement age, yet a life of new beginnings, we also hope the success of our venture will prove that dreams can be attained at whatever age we are in.  Our love for nature is also a commitment to pass on this legacy to our children and grandchildren.  This is the grandest of all!

In our farm, our children and grandchildren can play safely just like what we had when we were young.  Everyone, young and old can visit our farm and enjoy the beautiful scenery. Walk through the fields or hike through the woods.  This we hope is our ultimate legacy to our community. 
For Your Gift of Support - A Gift of Nature!
From our farm to your home, please bring the love of nature into your home sweet home through our Thoughtful Expressions of Nature signature collection.  Your support will help us continue what we have begun in our farm to make it a place worth visiting and a moment to remember for you and our guests. It will help us sustain its agricultural nature for our community to enjoy!  For  now your "Moments with Nature" comes in the form of perks all inspired by nature. 


Through your early support, order and feedback, we can also determine which among the exclusive products will be popular. With this valuable input, we can focus our funds to producing those that are more viable designs.  We will use the funds to produce larger quantities and carry those popular items in our farm boutique and in our online store for larger numbers of people to enjoy. Your help will also bring additional products such as lavender soaps and oils, and special blends of tea to drink.  We hope to grow more plants and trees for generations to enjoy!
In exchange for your help, you will be among the first to receive our exclusive designs as perks.  We have limited quantities available for delivery before the holiday gift giving.  Those perks are marked "EARLY BIRD."  All others will have to wait when we open our farm boutique in late Spring/Summer 2016. 


Perk Up Your Holiday with a Gift of Nature!
Our creative designs bring back the magic of hand-painted, hand-blown, handmade artisan quality items.  We have produced limited quantities for immediate delivery so you can see that these designs are all REAL and not just a concept.  
Being able to introduce our exclusively designed signature collection inspired by nature, lavender, roses and tea here at Indiegogo is heartening.  


Shipping & Other Info


WHEN WE WILL SHIP:  Early bird supporters will get the items in time for the holidays.  Orders received for the final week of the campaign ending December 10th, will be shipped the week of December 15th. 
WHERE WE SHIP:  Depending on the item, we will ship to the US 48 Contiguous States and Canada on "Early Bird" perks such as teapot sets and hand-blown glass. 
WORLDWIDE SHIPMENT:  For music and books, these are available for worldwide shipping at book rate, with digital music ready for immediate downloads.  The "tea-table" book will be shipped when it is released in Summer 2016.  
International delivery of hand-blown glass pieces and tea pot sets may be arranged with shipping cost to be paid by buyer based upon locations. You may contact us for shipping and you can pay the extra shipping cost by way of contributions. 
SHIPPING & HANDLING COSTS:  Our tea pots set and hand-blown glass pieces require extra handling and most of them are substantially heavy.  Hence, the estimated shipping and handling costs reflect rates for 48 Contiguous USA and Canada only.  
LIMITED QUANTITIES:  Once this initial limited quantities are all claimed or sold out, we will accept pre-order for 2016 delivery.  Hand-painted tea pot sets and hand-blown glass take time to finish.  Hence, our next shipment after we sold out will be late Spring/Summer 2016. 
NATURE OF PRODUCTS: The challenge of producing hand-painted, hand-blown and handmade products is the limitation on how many we can produce. To this end, we hope you act early so you can be among the first to get some pieces available for immediate delivery. 
Due to the nature of handmade, hand-painted, and hand-blown products, details such as colors, detailed finish, and weight may vary.  
REFUND POLICY:  We stand by our commitment to deliver as promised.  We will adhere strictly to Indiegogo's refund policy. We reserve the right to cancel the order once all inventories are claimed unless you request pre-order delivery for 2016. 
    
The success of our efforts will be dependent not only on our passion and dedication, but also on our supporters.  Thank you everyone for your support!

Jeff and ImeldaRoses @ #BlueDreamsUSA, Spring 2015

story:
Pe bunica mea, din partea tatalului, o chema Elena Cazacu.  De profesie era contabilo-bunica, iar pasiunea ei cea mai mare era prajituritul. Bunica mi-a fost alaturi doar 11 ani, dar si azi imi aduc aminte de ea, de prajiturile si torturile minunate pe care le pregatea, de ceaiul de la ora 5 servit alaturi de prajiturele cochete, de vizitele de dupa-amiaza la prietenele ei unde eram servite cu vestita dulceata pe farfurioara, de paharele pline cu sifon, de zilele de sarbatoare in care pregatea cele mai bune torturi cu etaj sau de minunatul Martipan, pe care noi il consideram cea mai buna prajitura din lume, de “Tavalita”, de“Odessa”, si de multe alte minunatii  care  aduc copilaria mai aproape. 

Bunica a colectat si adunat intr-un caiet cu coperti rosii peste 100 de retete de prajituri, placinte si torturi, a decupat si pastrat bucatele de ziar, de calendar pe care erau scrise bucatele vremii, a cules cu grija de la prietene sau colege retetare si toate acestea s-au adunat in caietul cu coperti rosii, unul dintre putinele lucruri pe care le mai am de la ea.

Si pentru ca timpul trece repede tare... si pentru ca viata si ritmul in care mergem nu e intotdeauna cel mai cumsecade, intr-o zi de februarie - sa tot fie un an si ceva de atunci - , mi-a venit ideea transcrierii acestui caiet, astfel incat si familia, prietenii  si cei care au nostalgia gusturilor de altadata sa se poata bucura de mirosul prajiturilor, de gustul torturilor,  de serile calde in care crapam un  harbuz rece ca sa ne racorim, de dupa-amiezele cu sifon & sirop de capsuni, de duminicile presarate cu placinte si prajituri, si intr-un fel sa ne aducem cu totii aminte de copilarie. 

Caietul cu retete nu va mai fi doar al meu, si va lua viata sub forma unei carti pe care am reusit sa o redactez in fiecare clipa libera, de-a lungul unui an lung, printre mailuri, sedinte, avioane, in aeroporturi si gari, iar cu cu ajutorul vostru voi putea sa transform acest caiet de retete si amintiri intr-o carte plina de retete de prajituri - editie speciala, editie de odinioara.

Caietul de retete va aparea in apropierea Craciunului, gata sa fie daruit de Sarbatori tuturor celor care iubesc darurile deosebite, pe care nu le poti cumpara din orice magazin.

story:
We are Cycles, a new shop servicing the North Philadelphia and Temple University communities.  We will be offering new and refurbished bikes, parts, repairs, classes and a bicycle co-op where anyone can come in to use our tools and equipment to fix their own bikes with help from a professional mechanic.

Cycles, on Susquehanna Avenue, is the former North Philadelphia location of Neighborhood Bike Works, Philadelphia’s prominent community bicycle project.  We are continuing the work that Neighborhood Bike Works did in the neighborhood, seeing the shop as equal parts "bicycle community center" and typical retail bicycle setting.

Cycles is made up of Jake Kenney and Mike Tonkinson, two friends and avid cyclists with an eye for design and the desire to empower people through cycling.  


Jake, a recent graduate of Temple University’s architecture program, was the assistant manager of the Neighborhood Bike Works shop prior to its closing as well as an instructor in Neighborhood Bike Works' adult repair class.

Mike comes to the shop with a background in industrial design, with the knowledge and experience to give Cycles a brand that will help us to succeed.


What we are doing is different than typical bike shop in that it focuses on encouraging the customer's understanding just as much as it allows the customer to hand over their bike to fix as in a typical setting.  For many people, the bicycle is their main source of transportation.  Whether this be by necessity or choice, we want to help these people as well as anyone else who rides a bike to have the tools necessary to understand and care for the machines that they are using. 

To do this, we will be hosting classes on a monthly (maybe even weekly!) basis that will address issues such as bicycle maintenance, safe riding techniques, and sustainable lifestyles.  We have connected with the Office of Sustainability at Temple, who will use the space for sustainability workshops and awareness.  Once these classes are established for out adult constituency, we hope to introduce youth programming to the shop.  This will consist of after school, weekend and summer programs and classes available to those under the age of 18.

Our co-op, or open shop program, will open our doors after closing hours one to two nights per week to allow folks to come in to use our tools, equipment, knowledge and piles of cheap used parts to fix their own bikes.  The co-op and classes will work together, giving those interested both the technical knowledge and hands on experience necessary to understand the bicycle.

Using all of these programs, we want to draw people in both from the surrounding communities as well as from the university.  Neighborhood Bike Works did a fantastic job providing cycling services and education to the neighborhood, and we will continue this.

The shop's old sales floor

Our location on Susquehanna Avenue is one block off of Broad Street and two blocks away from Temple University.  We have the perfect location to bring folks from both Temple and the surrounding neighborhoods through our doors.  

On top of our programming, we will be a full service bike shop selling new and refurbished bikes, parts, and repairs at reasonable rates.  Our goal with this is to provide bikes and parts that are accessible to the most people possible.


The unfortunate side of all of this is our start in the dead of winter, which any bike shop owner would (and has) told us is bordering insanity.  We need to pay rent, insurance, utilities, phone, internet, and so much more with very little income.  This is why we need your help to get on our feet.  Every donation made comes with some sort of thank you – but any thanks we could send is not enough.  By donating, you are becoming part of our family and a major part of the shop’s success.  Our goal of $3,000 gets us started by covering our first 2 month’s rent and other recurring payments as well as helping us get the tool stock we need to run our classes and co-op programs. 

Besides the perks listed on the right, anyone who donates will receive an invitation to our soft opening barbecue to mix and mingle with us and other fellow bike nerds!

Thanks to you all for reading, our support thus far has been overwhelmingly positive and we cannot wait to open our doors to everyone in January! 

Check out this story about the shop from Temple News!
