story:
ABOUT US

Dear Friends,

Century Books of Pasadena opened its doors on December 17, 2011 on beautiful Green Street, just two blocks away from Caltech - one of the world’s top educational institutions.  For four years with the help and support of our community the bookstore and art gallery became a small cultural center.  From the wonderful books that surround us to the art gallery and lecture hall, to the smallest Einstein Museum in the world, we’ve been living our dream.  We have been curating our eclectic selection of books for many years, and from the beginning we had talented local artists and musicians, featuring and selling their artwork, and have great performances.  In about two months after opening our bookshop, we started to have live music on a weekly basis, live jazz every Saturday night, enchanting classical concerts, and many special music events.  We host author events, we are a home for two very lively book clubs, and many great lectures and discussions, on literature, history, science, many by famous scientists,  and lots of unique topics, i.e. "The Train and the Cosmos: Visionary Modernity" by Matilde Marcolli, Mathematical Physicist, or another personal favorite....  “The history of chocolate” (with tasting) by Dr. Lee Theissen, and great group discussions, and as a friend said it, scientists and artists, a unique mix, can come together and exchange ideas in a completely informal and yet very intellectually stimulating environment.  And last, but not least, we became the home of “The Relatively Small Einstein Museum”, the only (mini) museum on the West Coast, near the Einstein Papers Project at Caltech, that celebrates one of the most important scientists of the 20th century, at the time of the 100th Anniversary of Einstein’s Theory of Relativity.  


 Courtesy of Douglas Kirk  ©2015


It’s hasn't been easy… and we have a really big challenge to overcome in order to be able to keep our beautiful location for years to come, where all this great events are part of our community life… and this is where we need your urgent help!

But let me take you back in time for a moment…


I’m Judith Marosvolgyi, the co-owner of Century Books of Pasadena. When my husband Steve and I first planned opening the bookshop, we started to curate all the books, added our own library, worked extremely long hours, and with the help of the nicest friends you can imagine –Isaac, Robert, whose support has been unbelievable, Gabor, Kathy, Marjie – just to name a few, we were able to raise the money we needed.  Steve drew this cartoon of the two of us, which is still my favorite.  Our first business plan started to read like this:

“You know those places in Paris, London, or New York, where you have a street lined with beautiful trees, in effect a picturesque shady lane, filled with charming cafés and shops. It is a place where you want to go and forget about time on a pleasant afternoon, to leisurely walk the street, visiting all its nooks, and enjoying all it has to offer. 

Well, our dream is to open a small bookshop on a beautiful street in Pasadena.  This place has lush trees arching over the lane with charming little restaurants and stores.  This city boasts numerous historic buildings designed by world-renowned architects.  It is just a few blocks away where Albert Einstein roamed the campus at Caltech in the 1930s, and it is a short walk to the famous Pasadena Playhouse.  This is where we would love to have a bookshop, a place where people can enjoy a fine cup of coffee or some tea with delicious pastry and get lost in some of their favorite books”.  

And so it happened… our dream came true…

and we were so excited to start… it didn’t matter to us how much time and energy it would take … we just loved every moment of it, and love it since… If you love to read, and love books, you know that magic surrounds them.  


But we are also aware of the reality of the business.  We are making changes to our model to make sure that we’ll be able to sustain and become profitable with the bookstore for many years to come.  In order to do that one of the steps we made is that we are transforming the Art Gallery and the The Relatively Small Einstein Museum into a non-profit organization.  This way, in addition to all our existing special events, we'll be able to add many new lectures, events, educational programs, including small group tours from our Einstein Museum to the Einstein Papers Project and other parts of the beautiful campus of Caltech, and it will not take resources away from the bookstore.  In the meantime a group of professional friends of our bookstore, generously offered their time and started to help us with business consulting to help us turn the business around, which has been invaluable.  


WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER…

Our lease is up, and the landlord(s) who have been very patient and gracious to us throughout the years, will only renew our lease if we are able to prove that we are a viable business and we have six-months rent in reserve.  In the meantime we are also working on several very exciting new projects for the store… And this is where we need your help. It was under extraordinary circumstances that we were able to lease this space on the first place, where kind friends came and helped us start from nothing.  But this was the perfect place for all the things that we have envisioned from the beginning, so we persevered.  Our close proximity to Caltech has been invaluable to us.  Students, teachers, and everyone have been a great support to our store.  If we would have to relocate, we might not be able to have the unique lectures, which we and our community have been so fortunate to participate in.  Also, in the case of relocation, the cost of the move would be significantly higher, not counting the loss of sales due to relocation and preparation of a new space. 

So we ask for your help to make all this possible… We are grateful for any contribution, so we put together the perks with that in mind.  This was possible with the help of many generous artists, musicians, professors, businesses, individuals, and we hope you’ll love our unique perks as much as we love to put it together for you…

Art opening with live jazz music, Krys Mach, Saxophone, Donn Cunningham, Guitar  

Keith Harrop's great artwork 

Our Children's Books Nook 


THE IMPACT

This campaign and the funds that we raise here will determine the future of Century Books.  If you would like to see the bookstore continue as a creative community space at this beautiful location, please join us and contribute here and spread the word to your family, friends, and colleagues.   We are inviting you to be a part of this next chapter of Century Books and all the projects the shop has created and we are looking forward to more exciting events at the bookstore.  We ask you to join us!  


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can't make a donation to the campaign, you can still help Century Books succeed by contributing in other ways.  We would greatly appreciate it if you would:

  • Spread the word!  Please forward this campaign on to all family, friends, and colleagues who may be able to assist us with donation of any amount.   Let them know how important Century Books is to the community and help us get the word out about this campaign and drum up support!

  • If you can volunteer some time, we would love for you to get involved.  Please send us an e-mail for more info.   

We would like you to know how much we appreciate all your support and help, and it is you and the community's support that makes this store special!  Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I am Kalisha Abercrombie Tucker, early childhood educator, wife, mother of many, nana of numerous littles, hat wearer extraordinaire, and founder of the DROP ZONE. My passion and love for children, concern for families, and a strong sense of community is what drives me.

Recognizing families as the cornerstone of every community while vividly recalling the lack of support while raising my own children, I have yearned for an opportunity to provide for parents what I so desperately wished I had - peace of mind and extraordinary childcare. This is what every parent wants and needs while their children are in the care of another.

I have met and watched hundreds of parents struggle to properly care for their children while simultaneously trying to fulfill numerous daily obligations. How many times have you witnessed the frustration and stress of a parent in a supermarket, at the doctor’s, or a restaurant vacillating between the task at hand while caring for the children?

To that end, I felt compelled to create a dependable, easily accessible drop in childcare option that addressed the shortcomings of traditional childcare centers--serving the unique needs of families in my community--which is exactly what "Ms. Kalisha" was born to do!  

So, in 2017, after researching non-traditional and part time childcare options in the greater Fayetteville area and finding only two in my immediate area, I decided to embark on opening a short-term childcare center for parents in need of childcare while they run errands, attend an appointment, enjoy a date night, or simply unwind and relax for a few.

The DROP ZONE will be centrally located in the heart of Fayetteville. We will offer hourly short-term childcare, before and after school care, workday and summer camps, special activities, and classes for children 6 weeks to 12 years old. Certified, licensed and experienced providers, visually stimulating and inviting environment, cognitively creative activities, and cutting-edge equipment are just some of the characteristics that differentiate our facility from any other. What better way to help parents lighten the load, than dropping their little ones off at The DROP ZONE? Parents manage their day, while we manage their children in a fun, safe, caring and engaging environment! 

The DROP ZONE is perfect when needing exceptional childcare:

  • In a pinch
  • To go shopping
  • To run an errand
  • To enjoy a date night
  • To go on a job interview
  • To go to an aerobics class
  • To enjoy lunch with your friends
  • To go to a nail or doctor's appointment 
  • Or to just wind down and relax for an afternoon

Just Exactly Who Is Mrs. Kalisha

The lady who's passion and call in life is to nurture children and families. I hold an associate degree (HNR) in Early Childhood Education, have earned Infant Toddler Care, Child Care Development, Child Care Professional, and Child Care Administration certifications. My career working with children spans more than 30 years, and my experience includes preschool teacher, Child and Adult Care Food Program/Summer Food Service Program administrator, elementary/middle school substitute, after school program coordinator, summer camp counselor, group home administrator, child care center administrator, and change agent for children. My life's greatest joy is my eight awesome adult children, and my twelve phenomenal grand babies. Your contribution will fulfill a lifelong dream of owning my own childcare facility and allow me an opportunity to partner with community parents to assist them with caring for their children -- because it truly takes a village. 

Let's Look At Fayetteville;

Now WE NEED YOUR HELP to secure a home away from home to support the families of our community. I am asking my family, friends, and community members to help me raise $55,000.00. This money represents one third of The DROP ZONE'S start-up budget, and will help to fund the first years rent, equipment and fit up, and serve as proof-of-concept/demand to our prospective property owner. 

SELECT YOUR REWARD AND BECOME A DROP ZONE START-UP ANGEL BY CONTRIBUTING TODAY! First Day and Featured Donors get a special value! >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

Zone In

Here's the breakdown!

My personal investment, business plan, and keen ability to get the best bang for our buck when it comes to acquiring office equipment, childcare management software, toys, books, materials/supplies, electronics, furnishings that will appeal to the senses of young people will take us part of the way. My personal investment will also secure licensing, insurances, professional services, marketing, and incidentals. But I need you to take us all the way home. I need your help with rent, interactive educational equipment, indoor commercial play equipment, renovations and fit up. 

​Total transparency, I want you to know exactly where your money is going. The expenses outlined below are estimates based on a 1700 square foot haven zoned for children...

  • Rent: 1700 square feet @ $17.00 per square ft (@ 12 months) = $28,900.00
  • Flooring: 1000 square feet Safe-Play Tiles (estimate) @ $7.68 per square ft = $7685.00, 700 square feet Eco Soft Foam Tiles @ $.95 per square ft = $760.00
  • Reception Area: Custom Check-in/Checkout Counter/Cubby System and School Ager's Zone @ $4,500.00 
  • Indoor Commercial Play System: 1 - Superior Play Systems Extreme Playcenter @ $7200.00 
  • Interactive Play Table: 1 - Play Table with 3 subjects @ $2500.00
  • Indiegogo deserves their cut for providing this platform for us to come together = 8% of funds raised + .30 cent per contribution (includes platform and credit card fees) + the cost of perks (shipping is included in perk cost).
  • Fit Up: Painting, Shelving, Signage etc. (estimate) = $2500.00 

Money raised beyond our goal will be allocated towards operational stability.

The Impact

Your contribution will:

  • make you a stakeholder, and you will be forever etched into The DROP ZONE DNA. 
  • provide parents peace of mind, knowing their children will receive proper care.
  • make this girl's dream a reality, allowing me to operate in my true calling.

Risks & Challenges

Financially feasible commercial spaces are few. Without your help, the centrally located facility we have selected will be compromised, which will in turn, compromise the entire project. Your help is needed expeditiously to secure our desired location. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute financially, no worries. You can still help us spread the word.

Share this fundraiser! Make some noise on our behalf! You never know who in your network might feel passionate about the same things we do. Please, call up your friends and say "Pull Up, Drop In, and Drop Off!"​ Use the Indiegogo share tools to help us get the word out as far and wide as possible. Use the hashtags #dropzonenc & #zonein and tag us! We're on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram @TheDropZoneNC.

And that's all there is to it. Come on, we got this!

My personal investment will also secure licensing, insurances, professional services, marketing, and incidentals. But I need you to take us all the way home. I need your help with rent, interactive educational equipment, indoor commercial play equipment, renovations and fit up. 
​Total transparency, I want you to know exactly where your money is going. The expenses outlined below are estimates based on a 1700 square foot haven zoned for children...


Rent: 1700 square feet @ $17.00 per square ft (@ 12 months) = $28,900.00

Flooring: 1000 square feet Safe-Play Tiles (estimate) @ $7.68 per square ft = $7685.00, 700 square feet Eco Soft Foam Tiles @ $.95 per square ft = $760.00

Reception Area: Custom Check-in/Checkout Counter/Cubby System and School Ager's Zone @ $4,500.00 

Indoor Commercial Play System: 1 - Superior Play Systems Extreme Playcenter @ $7200.00 

Interactive Play Table: 1 - Play Table with 3 subjects @ $2500.00

Indiegogo deserves their cut for providing this platform for us to come together = 8% of funds raised + .30 cent per contribution (includes platform and credit card fees) + the cost of perks (shipping is included in perk cost).

Fit Up: Painting, Shelving, Signage etc. (estimate) = $2500.00 


Money raised beyond our goal will be allocated towards operational stability.
The Impact
Your contribution will:

make you a stakeholder, and you will be forever etched into The DROP ZONE DNA. 
provide parents peace of mind, knowing their children will receive proper care.
make this girl's dream a reality, allowing me to operate in my true calling.


Risks & Challenges
Financially feasible commercial spaces are few. Without your help, the centrally located facility we have selected will be compromised, which will in turn, compromise the entire project. Your help is needed expeditiously to secure our desired location. 
Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute financially, no worries. You can still help us spread the word.
Share this fundraiser! Make some noise on our behalf! You never know who in your network might feel passionate about the same things we do. Please, call up your friends and say "Pull Up, Drop In, and Drop Off!"​ Use the Indiegogo share tools to help us get the word out as far and wide as possible. Use the hashtags #dropzonenc & #zonein and tag us! We're on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram @TheDropZoneNC.
And that's all there is to it. Come on, we got this!

story:
Who we are

We are a local SME events company based in Singapore. We started 6 years ago and have been working hard to grow our team and expanded our conferences from Singapore across the world. As the company founders, we have given back all we have to this company. 

How Covid19 has impacted us

Like many other event organisers, we have been negatively impacted by the ongoing coronavirus. Our conferences and exhibitions in Singapore and around the world had to be postponed due to social distancing, flight restrictions and lockdowns across the world. 

With no clear indication of when this global crisis will end, it is affecting cash flow for our business which has a direct impact on our ability to retain our staff. 

How we intend to use the funds

We seek short term help to cover expenses. The funds raised will cover rental, staff salaries and other operating costs. We are taking this time now to recalibrate and plan ahead for our events in Q3 to make sure things start on a bang once things return to normal. But in the meantime, we still have to pay the bills till then. 

Giving back to the community


In return for your kind donations, both our Directors will volunteer my time to help out at our local dog shelter. Every $100 contributed will be 1 hour of my time at the shelter walking the dogs and giving them much needed time outside the kennel.

 

Sincerely, 

Spire Events

story:
The goal is to create a unique opportunity for like minded individuals to pool their resources together and improve quality of life starting with Detroit. Our model embraces the idea of being “Stronger Together”. So we’re launching this campaign under the notion that everyone may not have time to physically improve the community, but everyone wants to see it improved. Through a lot of hard work and innovation we’ve developed a multi-phased plan that will tackle this challenge. Our collective approach will allow everyone to contribute to a program that’s revitalizing homes, starting businesses, saving money, while providing essential and financial services. You can be involved for as little as $5 dollars. 

Who Are We?

Welcome to C.E.O.!

We would like to formally welcome you to the future of
ownership and express our appreciation for the beginning of a long lasting endeavor to build legacy in the community for several individuals and their families.

We believe our biggest responsibilities are towards our community
with the trust of our partners being first priority. We assure you that this
venture will be collective and collaborative for the success and growth of C.E.O.

The founders of this project are 5 African American professional dedicated to creating a blue print for cultivating more owners and more ownership! Our goal is to create a platform that gives the everyday working class individual, aspiring business person, or seeking investor an opportunity for ownership.

Meet the team.

Robert Courtney Co-Founder (title), is the Founder and Facilitator behind - Robert Courtney & Associates, A Marketing & Branding Agency & Uneek Collection, A Lifestyle Apparel Brand & Events Company.  Expert in innovating disruptive business strategies, and a builder of community through digital marketing, branding, and service. A desire to invest into the development of people and their personal brand has been a vision of his for over a decade. 

In 2008, he founded UNEEK, a barbershop turned global fashion line and events company that has seen the likes of over 500 events and sales in Austria, Australia, and various parts of the United States. In 2013, Robert began consulting people to help establish and define their brands. One year later, following the death of his father, he decided to give more time to this aspect of his business. Months leading up to his passing, many of their conversations centered on the importance of philanthropy, and that has become the resounding theme of Robert's life. Helping people achieve a better presentation of themselves personally and professionally has become one of his main goals. A practical understanding of how to accomplish these things over social has created tremendous success in this regard. 

Robert Courtney & Associates is based around helping companies and individuals market and brand their ideas. The company teaches aspiring business owners how to articulate their brand stories and successfully communicate their ideas on social media and many other cost efficient platforms. 

Kirk McClung Co-Founder (title) is also Co-Founder of UneekCollection, Consultant for RCA, Co-owner of Refined & Aktiv events. Born and raised in Long Beach, CA.   He is behind the creative and marketing aspects of UneekCollection. He stays true to his brand, helping others reach their goals,  and finds ways to implement his knowledge in various collaborations.  

Charles Walker Co-Founder / Treasurer is a Human Services Specialist and Owner of We Haul It All junk removal services. Born and raised in Detroit, MI. Serial entrepreneur. Real estate, investing, and reinvesting in the community bring me joy. Outside of the day to day, I enjoy traveling, experiencing new cultures, and seeing new sites.

William Peay Jr Co-Founder / Digital Marketing Research & Development has been an entrepreneur, life coach and marketing expert for over 20years. Will started his career in Media and Entertainment marketing then soon turned to acting, producing, and directing while marketing independent films. After a few local successful productions, Will took his production and marketing talents to music platforms. In addition, he started Business Social, a concert and club promotional company, and then expanded into Digital Marketing.  Barbering and real estate was his beginning and current endeavors which include working fulltime as a master barber and owning several real estate investment properties. 

Windell A. Peay (M.B.A) Co-Founder / Director of Operations started his career as a Corporate Purchasing Intern in the Detroit Automotive industry while obtaining his Undergraduate Degree from Walsh Business College. After receiving his B.B.A. in Business Management, he worked at General Motors as an Advanced Purchasing Buyer for 4 years. Driven for success he chose to attend Graduate School at Northwood University and soon began to further his career as a Senior Corporate employee at  Sogefi Group as a Manager of Advanced Purchasing for continental North America. Currently he holds an M.B.A. in Executive Management, and has over 12 years of Business Operations and Purchasing within the Global Corporate Markets.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking to generate $80,000.00 to facilitate the following activities:

  • $30k will be used to fund 3 separate business owners and their ideas.
  • $50k will be used to purchase property in the Detroit area and to help facilitate revitalization in the community.
  • In the event these goals aren't reached completely, the funds will still be distributed between helping others own businesses and retrieving new property to offer up owner ship to partners.

The Impact

CEO is just what The Detroit Community needs.

  • This plan pulls together several elements that will help move the community forward. Individuals to participate in the CEO movement immediately becomes an owner of the property and businesses purchased by CEO.
  • Our team is surprised of a variety of resourceful individuals who well help make this project a huge success.

Risks & Challenges

The landscape in Detroit currently provides several opportunities to purchase properties and offers an extensive amount of intelligent aspiring business owners.

  • There's only a few risk that challenge us right now including the due diligence and consistent pursuit needed to find and secure properties.
  • And with the complex nature of our endeavors, our ability to accurately describe what it is were attempting to do. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you can't contribute thats ok! Please help by sharing our campaign with anyone you think might be open to making a difference!.

After receiving his B.B.A. in Business Management, he worked at General Motors as an Advanced Purchasing Buyer for 4 years. Driven for success he chose to attend Graduate School at Northwood University and soon began to further his career as a Senior Corporate employee at  Sogefi Group as a Manager of Advanced Purchasing for continental North America. Currently he holds an M.B.A. in Executive Management, and has over 12 years of Business Operations and Purchasing within the Global Corporate Markets.
 
What We Need & What You Get

$50k will be used to purchase property in the Detroit area and to help facilitate revitalization in the community.
In the event these goals aren't reached completely, the funds will still be distributed between helping others own businesses and retrieving new property to offer up owner ship to partners.


The Impact
CEO is just what The Detroit Community needs.

This plan pulls together several elements that will help move the community forward. Individuals to participate in the CEO movement immediately becomes an owner of the property and businesses purchased by CEO.
Our team is surprised of a variety of resourceful individuals who well help make this project a huge success.


Risks & Challenges
The landscape in Detroit currently provides several opportunities to purchase properties and offers an extensive amount of intelligent aspiring business owners.

There's only a few risk that challenge us right now including the due diligence and consistent pursuit needed to find and secure properties.
And with the complex nature of our endeavors, our ability to accurately describe what it is were attempting to do. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
If you can't contribute thats ok! Please help by sharing our campaign with anyone you think might be open to making a difference!.

story:
In a tradition that dates back centuries, my ancestors and I have created soap using olive oil and laurel oil. We perfected our craft in the city of Aleppo, and when the war that had torn apart Syria destroyed the soap factories, it was a major event throughout Europe and Asia, a tragedy to people who had sought out Syrian soap since Crusaders returning from the Middle East had introduced it to their ancestors in the 11th century. This is a part of our heritage, something that we take very seriously, and we are proud to carry it on today at Aleppo Savon.

 

 

Launched by a Syrian refugee, Sabouni, who has called Calgary home for two years now, Aleppo Savon manufactured all soaps in Canada, adhering to the strictest quality standards.

To us, this means that we use only natural, 100% vegetarian, hypoallergenic ingredients – no toxins, no preservatives, no fillers, no petroleum, no alcohol, no GMOs, no artificial lathering agents, and no animal byproducts. It also means going a step further than all that, though. We are also committing ourselves to transitioning away from plastic packaging and toward eco-friendly hemp packaging for all of our soaps and standing up for the conservationist mindset that we believe to be moral. Purchasing all of our ingredients carefully and ethically, we want to make Aleppoo Savon a model for what a soap company can be.

 

 

So, what is in a bar of Aleppo Savon? Some of the nurturing, moisturizing, brightening, oil-controlling, metabolizing, gentle ingredients that we use are herbal oils, herbal teas, and honey, and on every body butter, soap, and personal care product that you purchase from Aleppo Savon, you can count on a full disclosure of ingredients printed clearly on the packaging.

​

 

 

These are world-class soaps that protect the natural oils in your skin for a smooth and silky touch, and we want to introduce them to you.

This is where we could use some help.

 

 

We are also committing ourselves to transitioning away from plastic packaging and toward eco-friendly hemp packaging for all of our soaps and standing up for the conservationist mindset that we believe to be moral. Purchasing all of our ingredients carefully and ethically, we want to make Aleppo Savon a model for what a soap company can be.

 

 

 

Abdulfatah Sabouni is a fourth-generation soap maker. Making soap has been his family business for more than 125 years. Even his last name, Sabouni, means soap maker.

The centuries-old tradition of Aleppo soap making — which uses no chemicals or other additives —involves secret family recipes handed down for generations. In the 11th century, the Crusaders brought Aleppo soap back to Europe, starting a centuries-long love affair with the olive-oil and laurel oil-based soap said to be intensely moisturizing. Aleppo soap is thought to be one of the world’s oldest types of soap and also said to have been the inspiration for the equally famous Marseille soap of France. Although claims of its great antiquity abound, such as references in the popular press to Egyptian Queen Cleopatra and Queen Zenobia of Syria using Aleppo soap, these claims have yet to be verified by the Scholarly method.

Traditional soap factories in Aleppo were either destroyed or abandoned, creating a worldwide shortage of Aleppo soap. Newspaper headlines appeared in Europe, Saudi Arabia, and Japan, where the soap is highly coveted.

When Sabouni arrived in Calgary two years ago, his entrepreneurial dreams were never far from his thoughts. He threw himself into learning English and got the ball rolling, and opened Aleppo Savon to great success. The business continues to grow, and they have big plans for distribution across Canada and North America.

 

For Sabouni, making the world-famous Aleppo soap is his way of giving back to a city and country that has given him and his family so much.

 

 

 

 

This is a long and storied tradition for us, and we do not foresee any logistical challenges. If we do run into delays, we will be sure to keep all our contributors in the loop, remaining transparent about our progress.

 

Go ahead and tell all your friends and family what Aleppo Savon is and what we stand for. The more people hear about this soap, the smoother the next months and years will go for us.

We appreciate all your support.

Thank you!

story:
Who are we?

We are David Daniel and Gavin Facey, two Newport born colleagues and friends that you might have met behind the bar at the Westgate over the last year and a bit. David is also the director of The Escape Rooms Newport, another successful business that the people of Newport helped to get off the ground with a crowdfunder, a business that is now expanding and taking on more employees, while Gavin has worked in events management for years. Both of us were key organisers of events at Newport Rising Festival, the outstanding New Years Eve celebrations and more recently the very successful Art of Lockdown exhibition, all at the Westgate Hotel. In addition to our management team we’re partnered with the landlord and their team of representatives, who share our vision and are offering financial and practical support.

We’ve had the privilege of working at the Westgate Hotel for just over a year after gaining the permission of the owner to begin the clean up process and worked alongside the amazing volunteers from Our Chartist Heritage to turn a building that had been largely abandoned for 15 years from a dark, dirty and neglected ex-hotel into a bright, vibrant events venue in the city centre with so much potential. We love this building; the history it contains, what it stands for and what it could be and we’re dedicated to our mission to revitalise it and open it up to the public again, permanently.

Why now?

Recently and in previous years the Westgate Hotel has been broken into and damaged. A recent break in during lockdown resulted in further damage to the beautiful ballroom roof as thieves tried to smash their way through a floor to access other parts of the building. We cannot allow this iconic building to be damaged further or worse destroyed and must work to preserve it for today and for future generations. We think the best way to secure the building is to have people in it, using it and looking after it with upgraded CCTV, alarms systems and physical barriers. We do not accept the narrative that the Westgate or Newport’s city Centre should be condemned to continued decline; despite a series of blows including the recent coronavirus pandemic we believe that better is possible. This project is designed to be forward looking and a long term investment in Newport's future; coronavirus is not here to stay and we intend to rise to the challenge and be ready to launch in 2021.

We feel that the project at the Westgate has reached a crucial point, at which the venue could return to dereliction, suffer further break-ins or damage and be boarded up once more or, we can create something really special and unique in the city centre that includes and respects the heritage of the building while also looking to the future, providing bar, cafe, WiFi and flexible spaces for a range of uses and a new addition to the events and live music scene. We’re speaking to architects and conservation officers so that we can remove the ugly security hoarding on the grand main entrance and reinstall period appropriate front doors ready to welcome people once more. But that’s just the start...

We intend to;

  • Reopen the lower ballroom off Stow Hill to create a busy events venue, hosting music, arts, performance and heritage 
  • Reopen the 1st floor gallery as a mixed use cafe/bar with exhibition space, flexible working and business facilities, networking and small conference plus community hires
  • Reinvest in the building, improving the facilities and repairing historic damages and securing against break ins and malicious theft and safeguard for future generations
  • Bring new areas of the venue into use with potential use as small studios, meeting rooms, community hires and rehearsal rooms
  • Lay the groundwork for future redevelopment of the building so that the Westgate can be full of life from top to bottom once more.

Our convictions are based on more than just optimism; with our partners Newport Rising and others we’ve tested a variety of cultural, heritage and entertainment events, attracting over 2500 visitors to the venue in just two weeks for a graphic novel launch in June 2019, followed by a vibrant festival in November, multiple music and film events and the hugely successful New Years Eve celebration that raised thousands for charity and brought hundreds of visitors to the city centre through December to February 2020 before lockdown. Public interest was not deterred by the still present coronavirus and once restrictions were relaxed we held a highly successful art exhibition attracting over 600 visitors of all ages in two weeks of August this year.

Our Chartist Heritage has done so much to lay the foundations, we’re going to continue their efforts and guarantee a permanent position for them to continue to do their great work telling the Chartist story at the Westgate and adding new features for the 21st Century.

We've chosen to use crowdfunding so that we can deliver the project sooner and to a higher standard enabling us to achieve more on top of the money and time we will be investing ourselves. 

Through our many conversations with visitors to the Westgate we also know that lots of people have strong connections and memories of the venue and might like to be a part of a project to bring it back to use and protect it. You can be a part of this project; your support is absolutely essential and we hope to see you at the Westgate very soon to thank you. Working together we can protect this historic and still beautiful building and create something new and inspiring for everyone in Newport's City Centre.

 

What We Need & What You Get

There's lots of work to be done at the Westgate but every penny raised will go back into the building. We're not asking for a handout though, if you back us you get rewarded not just with the great perks but you'll get the satisfaction of making a big difference to Newport's City Centre at a time when the city needs us the most. Every time we open the Westgate, visitors tell us how they remember when it was the place to be in Newport; so many people have had their weddings at the venue, remember dancing in the ballroom and much more. For younger generations the Westgate has always been boarded up and closed. Let's work together to change that, to open the building up for everyone and protect it for the future.

Money raised will go towards architects fees, specialist conservation work required throughout the building, upgrading and improving facilities throughout and essential safety work.

We've set a goal of £10,000 which is only a fraction of what is required for the entire project but will get us off to a much better start. If we don't hit the target then some areas will be delayed and compromises made, but will still all go back into the building.  If we exceed the target then we'll continue to put everything back into the project, delivering more and to a higher standard.

 

Let's stick one in the eye of the naysayers and together create something that we can be proud of, will bring visitors to the city and shine a light on the best that Newport has to offer.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

In the short term, the coronavirus pandemic is undoubtedly a risk which we are fully aware of.  But we believe that a second wave will at most delay the project, not prevent it. Coronavirus isn't here forever and one thing the Westgate has is space - it's very possible to host people safely throughout the building which is something we're grateful for. We're also very lucky to have a great relationship with the landlord who understands our vision and wants to work with us to achieve it - this means we have some flexibility and ability to respond to challenges.

We've also got a great team of partners and supporters that share our vision and are ready to support in a number of ways, including;

Ringmaster Sports

Newport Rising / Our Chartist Heritage

Inspired Business Media

Tactile Bosch

Record One

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand times are tough right now. But that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us to get the word out and let people know about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share with your friends and networks. 
  • Get in touch if you feel you can help in other ways. 
  • Make sure you visit when we launch - we look forward to welcoming you!
story_txt:
Who are we?
We are David Daniel and Gavin Facey, two Newport born colleagues and friends that you might have met behind the bar at the Westgate over the last year and a bit. David is also the director of The Escape Rooms Newport, another successful business that the people of Newport helped to get off the ground with a crowdfunder, a business that is now expanding and taking on more employees, while Gavin has worked in events management for years. Both of us were key organisers of events at Newport Rising Festival, the outstanding New Years Eve celebrations and more recently the very successful Art of Lockdown exhibition, all at the Westgate Hotel. In addition to our management team we’re partnered with the landlord and their team of representatives, who share our vision and are offering financial and practical support.
We’ve had the privilege of working at the Westgate Hotel for just over a year after gaining the permission of the owner to begin the clean up process and worked alongside the amazing volunteers from Our Chartist Heritage to turn a building that had been largely abandoned for 15 years from a dark, dirty and neglected ex-hotel into a bright, vibrant events venue in the city centre with so much potential. We love this building; the history it contains, what it stands for and what it could be and we’re dedicated to our mission to revitalise it and open it up to the public again, permanently.

Why now?
Recently and in previous years the Westgate Hotel has been broken into and damaged. A recent break in during lockdown resulted in further damage to the beautiful ballroom roof as thieves tried to smash their way through a floor to access other parts of the building. We cannot allow this iconic building to be damaged further or worse destroyed and must work to preserve it for today and for future generations. We think the best way to secure the building is to have people in it, using it and looking after it with upgraded CCTV, alarms systems and physical barriers. We do not accept the narrative that the Westgate or Newport’s city Centre should be condemned to continued decline; despite a series of blows including the recent coronavirus pandemic we believe that better is possible. This project is designed to be forward looking and a long term investment in Newport's future; coronavirus is not here to stay and we intend to rise to the challenge and be ready to launch in 2021.

We feel that the project at the Westgate has reached a crucial point, at which the venue could return to dereliction, suffer further break-ins or damage and be boarded up once more or, we can create something really special and unique in the city centre that includes and respects the heritage of the building while also looking to the future, providing bar, cafe, WiFi and flexible spaces for a range of uses and a new addition to the events and live music scene. We’re speaking to architects and conservation officers so that we can remove the ugly security hoarding on the grand main entrance and reinstall period appropriate front doors ready to welcome people once more. But that’s just the start...
We intend to;

Reopen the lower ballroom off Stow Hill to create a busy events venue, hosting music, arts, performance and heritage 
Reopen the 1st floor gallery as a mixed use cafe/bar with exhibition space, flexible working and business facilities, networking and small conference plus community hires
Reinvest in the building, improving the facilities and repairing historic damages and securing against break ins and malicious theft and safeguard for future generations
Bring new areas of the venue into use with potential use as small studios, meeting rooms, community hires and rehearsal rooms
Lay the groundwork for future redevelopment of the building so that the Westgate can be full of life from top to bottom once more.

Our convictions are based on more than just optimism; with our partners Newport Rising and others we’ve tested a variety of cultural, heritage and entertainment events, attracting over 2500 visitors to the venue in just two weeks for a graphic novel launch in June 2019, followed by a vibrant festival in November, multiple music and film events and the hugely successful New Years Eve celebration that raised thousands for charity and brought hundreds of visitors to the city centre through December to February 2020 before lockdown. Public interest was not deterred by the still present coronavirus and once restrictions were relaxed we held a highly successful art exhibition attracting over 600 visitors of all ages in two weeks of August this year.

Our Chartist Heritage has done so much to lay the foundations, we’re going to continue their efforts and guarantee a permanent position for them to continue to do their great work telling the Chartist story at the Westgate and adding new features for the 21st Century.
We've chosen to use crowdfunding so that we can deliver the project sooner and to a higher standard enabling us to achieve more on top of the money and time we will be investing ourselves. 
Through our many conversations with visitors to the Westgate we also know that lots of people have strong connections and memories of the venue and might like to be a part of a project to bring it back to use and protect it. You can be a part of this project; your support is absolutely essential and we hope to see you at the Westgate very soon to thank you. Working together we can protect this historic and still beautiful building and create something new and inspiring for everyone in Newport's City Centre.
 
What We Need & What You Get
There's lots of work to be done at the Westgate but every penny raised will go back into the building. We're not asking for a handout though, if you back us you get rewarded not just with the great perks but you'll get the satisfaction of making a big difference to Newport's City Centre at a time when the city needs us the most. Every time we open the Westgate, visitors tell us how they remember when it was the place to be in Newport; so many people have had their weddings at the venue, remember dancing in the ballroom and much more. For younger generations the Westgate has always been boarded up and closed. Let's work together to change that, to open the building up for everyone and protect it for the future.
Money raised will go towards architects fees, specialist conservation work required throughout the building, upgrading and improving facilities throughout and essential safety work.
We've set a goal of £10,000 which is only a fraction of what is required for the entire project but will get us off to a much better start. If we don't hit the target then some areas will be delayed and compromises made, but will still all go back into the building.  If we exceed the target then we'll continue to put everything back into the project, delivering more and to a higher standard.
 
Let's stick one in the eye of the naysayers and together create something that we can be proud of, will bring visitors to the city and shine a light on the best that Newport has to offer.
 

Risks & Challenges
 
In the short term, the coronavirus pandemic is undoubtedly a risk which we are fully aware of.  But we believe that a second wave will at most delay the project, not prevent it. Coronavirus isn't here forever and one thing the Westgate has is space - it's very possible to host people safely throughout the building which is something we're grateful for. We're also very lucky to have a great relationship with the landlord who understands our vision and wants to work with us to achieve it - this means we have some flexibility and ability to respond to challenges.
We've also got a great team of partners and supporters that share our vision and are ready to support in a number of ways, including;
Ringmaster Sports
Newport Rising / Our Chartist Heritage
Inspired Business Media
Tactile Bosch
Record One
 

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand times are tough right now. But that doesn't mean you can't help:

Help us to get the word out and let people know about this campaign.
Use the Indiegogo share tools to share with your friends and networks. 
Get in touch if you feel you can help in other ways. 
Make sure you visit when we launch - we look forward to welcoming you!

story:
Who I Am:

Sherry Elizabeth Morrow a.k.a. LIZZY.  My mother taught me to sew when I was a little girl and I have been sewing ever since.  This has lead me to an over 26 year career in tailoring & dressmaking.  I found myself racing motorcycles in my 30's.  I started tailoring & customizing my racing leathers and this lead to my over 10 year business Lizzy Leather; repairing, tailoring & customizing leather motorcycle racing suits, jackets etc.

I want to move Lizzy Leather from my small home based workshop to a larger shop in my town of Philippi WV.   Here I want to expand into custom made leather goods and a retail store front to sell hand made leather goods (sewn by machine by my hands!).  Goods such as wallets, purses, corsets and more!  Hopefully with this expansion I can hire an assistant to help me and to teach them the quality and care that goes into my leather work.

I have already found the perfect space for this & will be signing the lease soon!

What I need to make this happen:

Licenses $100

Store fixtures $1200

Office supplies and equipment $900

Insurance  $500

Materials to produce leather goods for sale $2000

A second industrial walking foot sewing machine $2000

Promotional material & advertising $350

Total funds needed $7050.00

In return for your support I have several items and services to offer you!

Custom leather lettering or numbers on the back of your jacket or racing leathers.

Leather purses and wallets that I designed.

Tee shirts & stickers.

 

 

My Goal

With your support I want to continue giving you the highest quality and care in repairing, tailoring, cleaning & customizing your leather motorcycle racing suits, jackets etc while creating high quality leather goods that will be displayed for sale in the showroom!  This space will also house a small tattoo studio and art work by local kids.

 

Risks & Challenges

I have always had a dream of designing leather fashion.  This is the first real store front I will start.  I am a little nervous.....NO I am a lot nervous!  I hope for success and a continued growth. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please check out the perks!

Spread the word and share this on FaceBook (even if you are not able to contribute, this would be a tremendous help!)

story:
Short Summary

Desired Collective Spas started when LaToia Glatt opened Desired Esthetics at the end of 2018. Her dream to connect with you and bring you clean beauty products to achieve the skin of your dreams was being realized!

In 2019, after life threw her a curveball, Jimi Morrison found herself unemployed and against a wall. Understanding her situation and having known Jimi for several years, LaToia invited Jimi to bring Skin Body Sugar into Desired Esthetics. Jimi's passionate about offering holistic pain management services that help you get your life back. Most clients enjoy Jimi's slow, heavy pressure and look forward to enjoying Ashiatsu upon certification in 2021! On top of this, Jimi is also passionate about clean beauty services, including sugaring hair removal, and pole dance fitness!

Shortly after LaToia invited Sam Mills to bring The Body Mechanic in and complete the Desired Collective Spas. Sam Mills works with athletes to increase performance, decrease fatigue, prevent injury, and restore mobility. Now, he'd like to bring these services to you!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $60,000.00 to assist us with expansion costs including construction and new equipment. We really want to make the new space incredibly special, inviting, and beautiful so that you truly feel like you are in a safe and welcoming environment.

We're offering spa services at discounts for your help!

The Impact

What we have learned in the past 8 years as service providers is that people need spas. Not only to relax but to feel loved, cared for, and treated kindly in an inspiring atmosphere. Desired Collective Spas truly works from the heart and combines knowledge of the services it provides with great customer care. After the pandemic caused the forced closure of personal care businesses, we weren’t certain we would survive the hit. But we’re still here offering you the wellness experience you have come to expect, enjoy, and quite frankly deserve!

We genuinely believe that if the spa were in a more accessible location with more space to increase services offered it would grow even further. We will always maintain a very boutique style space to ensure individual care, but a larger space would ensure that more services can be offered to clients and it will allow for pole fitness classes to be added.

Risks & Challenges

We have no fear of the success of a new location, however, there are still some challenges in finding it. We have some very precise desires for the new location. We would like the space to stay in the North or East Chattanooga area to cater to its current clientele. We are also looking for a space with sufficient free parking as well as wheelchair accessibility. Lastly, we need a space that is large enough to include a fitness area but is also affordable. We are constantly looking for all options whether that be to buy a place or lease. And we know the perfect spot is just around the corner. The contributions from clientele and supporters will really help widen the possibilities so that we can move more quickly and efficiently. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to donate, please share the page and campaign with everyone you can. Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram are great tools to help spread the word. Please use the tools on Indiegogo's page to share with friends and family!

story:
Reserve

We're Mike and Mike from VinoWine. We're two military vets turned entrepreneur who have been heavily involved in the Virginia wine industry since 2013. And we're thrilled to announce that we will be opening Lynchburg's first winery tasting room and lounge, called Reserve, on the city's historic downtown waterfront later this summer!

VinoWine is a brand new Virginia farm winery and our goal is to bring great wine to the LBC in a relaxed, upscale environment. Our tasting room will feature our wines along with a collection of other great wines from all across Virginia that will rotate each month. We'll also be serving a selection of local breads, cheeses and charcuterie boards.

We've already found the perfect space for our tasting room so now our main objective is to raise the funds needed to do some small renovations and purchase some needed items. Our goal is to be up and running by late Summer 2019.

We invite you to watch our video, look over our campaign, and check out the variety of Perks we're giving away. You can buy as many Perks as you like and we'd be honored if you donated to our campaign or shared our link via social media. Thank you!

 

The Space

We're located at 1101 Jefferson St in downtown Lynchburg, Virginia. The space that we're moving into used to be a coffee shop so our main focus is to renovate it and make it our own. We're in the design phase now but the renovations will closely follow.

We're going for a rustic/industrial look so we'll repaint the walls, rip out all the tin, and really play-up the old brick, exposed pipes, and all the duct-work. We're incredibly fortunate to have a space with "old bones" that was built into a rocky bluff outcropping, so we'll be highlighting these features giving the tasting room the character and look we're going for.

Some other features we'll be adding to the tasting room to make it really standout will be small chandeliers, comfortable couches, and a fireplace for customers to sip wine next to.

 

 

 

 

 


 

How we're different

We're proud to say that we'll be Lynchburg, Virginia's first winery! And as a winery, we'll be featuring our wines front and center on the tasting menu. However, what really separates us from the majority of tasting rooms throughout Virginia and the rest of the country is our diverse tasting menu. In addition to pouring our own vintages, we'll also be featuring other great wines that are made in Virginia by other wineries, which will rotate on and off our tasting menu each month. In doing this, we give our customers a unique tasting experience each time they visit, giving them the ability to taste some of the best wines made in Virginia, all under one roof.

 

Risks & Challenges

No great undertaking is without its risks and challenges. The biggest risk we can think of is that there may not be a large enough market for wine in the Lynchburg area. But, so far, we've been incredibly blessed with word that Reserve is the talk of Lynchburg. It's gotten back to us several times how excited everyone is to have their first tasting room and lounge in the downtown area and we hope that this excitement, combined with our great location, will help make Reserve the huge success we hope it to be. 

Since the two of us are former infantrymen in the Army and Marines we're no strangers to plans going awry, no matter how well they're thought out in advance. However, two of our greatest strengths are performing under pressure and adjusting as needed. We're confident that with our hard work and your contributions, Reserve will be a huge success in Lynchburg!

In the end, no matter how much money we raise in this campaign, (even if it's less than our $50k goal) all the funds will still go towards the needed materials that will help put the finishing touches on our tasting room space. They'll be used for renovation expenses and to help us purchase all the furniture, glassware, lightening, equipment, machinery, etc. In the end, anything that's donated will be put to good use and will be greatly appreciated :)  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is in a position where they can contribute financially. So if you can't, we ask you to share our campaign with your family and friends to help us quickly spread the word before our 30-day campaign ends!

There are social media icons at the very top of our Indiegogo page that will allow you to share and post our campaign link to your social media accounts. Please feel free to do that because it will greatly increase our visibility to potential would-be donors that may come across it. Lastly, and most important, we'd really welcome everyone's thoughts and prayers for us as we move forward with opening Reserve in the upcoming months!

We're very grateful you checked out our page and we thank you in advance for your help! We look forward to seeing you soon and hosting you all this summer at Reserve by VinoWine.

story:
Our family run business needs you, and we would like to invite friends and our customers to celebrate with us and support our return after a year in the pandemic. 

  • Marvelosa is located in Budapest in the heart of the Hungarian Capital, some of you know us very well.
  • We opened Marvelosa Restaurant in 2008 and Marvelosa Apartment in 2020.
  • Marvelosa is a small gem and we (mum and I) do run it with love and passion.
  • The word "MARVELOSA" was created by us, it means a collection of the best things in life.
  • We would like to continue our beloved business, and re-open Marvelosa Restaurant & the Marvelosa Apartment.
  • If you treasure local, small and slow, and would like to help us, keep us, please pick a "perk" from the list, and in return of your donation you will receive some real treats from us. :)
  • KEEP MARVELOSA ALIVE & HAVE A TREAT!

||| - A MARVELOSA ÚJRAINDÍTÁS PROJEKT LEÍRÁSA MAGYARUL > lent olvasható - |||

WE WOULD LIKE TO RE-OPEN MARVELOSA, BUT IT WILL ONLY BE POSSIBLE WITH YOU!

  • All the funding that we'll receive here on our fundraising page will be used to keep our business, to be able to reopen and have a world of social life again, where people, friends, families can meet and celebrate, and enjoy a glass of drink or a dinner together.
     
  • Our unique "Marvelosa Celebration" Packages, (perks) include a selection of all our most loved ways to spend time at Marvelosa, the list of things to choose from include a dinner for two at Marvelosa Restaurant, a weekend away at our Marvelosa Apartment, or a unique handbag made by Agnes at the Agnes Toth Studio, which is a collaboration with Marvelosa.
     
  • There is also the rare opportunity to have your very own pattern and unique handbag designed by Agnes, or have an oil painting, a portrait painted by the artist Agnes Toth.
    If you would like the portrait to be entirely embroidered, that is also possible to choose.
    See her paintings here: www.agnestoth.eu
    And visit the Studio website, online shop here: www.agnestothstudio.com
     
  • If you are looking for something else that you cannot find in the list, please feel free to contact us, we are happy to discuss any unique desires and make them come true.
    contact@agnestothstudio.com or marvelosa.official@gmail.com

www.marvelosa.eu


Marvelosa Apartment is by the River Danube and the Chain Bridge in the Buda Castle area, in the Old Town of Budapest

Perfect location if you are looking to stay somewhere quiet but central. It is an ideal place for short visits, and the perfect way to enjoy what Budapest has to offer, we are walking distance from the Buda Castle, the Royal Palace Gardens and the Rudas and Gellert Thermal Spas. The apartment is overlooking the Chain Bridge; one of the many good things about staying with us.

  • All our offers you can select from have a great discount.
  • Every date will be discussed when you know your arrival date and would like to make a booking. The early bookings will take the best dates. (Holidays, National Day, Christmas, New Year is not included for reservations)
     

Come and see us...

It has been a long time without you, and we all had our experiences with the pandemic. We believe in the community spirit, and in the sake of good. Every contribution towards our aim to reopen Marvelosa will be a huge thing for us, and we can't wait to be able to have you at Marvelosa again! 

  • PLEASE SHARE OUR CROWDFUNDING, either by word of mouth or on social media!
    Every single help is a huge help!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Kedves Vendégeink, Kedves Barátaink!

A Marvelosa újranyitásához a Ti segítségetekre számítunk! Szeretnénk veletek együtt ünnepelni, hogy ismét visszatérhetünk több mint egy év után a vállalkozásunkhoz. Az újranyitáshoz egy kreatív ötlet keretében szeretnénk kérni Titeket, hogy a listában található csomagokból válaszatok, ezáltal támogatva minket adományaitokkal. 

Olyan gyűjtés ez, az Indiegogo oldalán keresztül, amely által újra egy jobb jövő felé tekinthetünk, az adományaitokért cserébe pedig számtalan izgalamas dologból választhattok, amely felhasználható a Marvelosa Étteremben, vagy a Marvelosa Apartmanban, illetve a gyűjtésben az Agnes Toth Studio is részt vesz. 

Amiket választani lehet, és mind kedvezménnyel jár:

  • Desszert és ital két fő részére
  • Vacsora Két fő részére
  • Családi ebéd
  • Egy hétvége az Apartmanban
  • Egy hét az Apartmanban reggelivel

story_txt:
Our family run business needs you, and we would like to invite friends and our customers to celebrate with us and support our return after a year in the pandemic. 

Marvelosa is located in Budapest in the heart of the Hungarian Capital, some of you know us very well.
We opened Marvelosa Restaurant in 2008 and Marvelosa Apartment in 2020.
Marvelosa is a small gem and we (mum and I) do run it with love and passion.
The word "MARVELOSA" was created by us, it means a collection of the best things in life.
We would like to continue our beloved business, and re-open Marvelosa Restaurant & the Marvelosa Apartment.
If you treasure local, small and slow, and would like to help us, keep us, please pick a "perk" from the list, and in return of your donation you will receive some real treats from us. :)
KEEP MARVELOSA ALIVE & HAVE A TREAT!

||| - A MARVELOSA ÚJRAINDÍTÁS PROJEKT LEÍRÁSA MAGYARUL > lent olvasható - |||



WE WOULD LIKE TO RE-OPEN MARVELOSA, BUT IT WILL ONLY BE POSSIBLE WITH YOU!

All the funding that we'll receive here on our fundraising page will be used to keep our business, to be able to reopen and have a world of social life again, where people, friends, families can meet and celebrate, and enjoy a glass of drink or a dinner together. 
Our unique "Marvelosa Celebration" Packages, (perks) include a selection of all our most loved ways to spend time at Marvelosa, the list of things to choose from include a dinner for two at Marvelosa Restaurant, a weekend away at our Marvelosa Apartment, or a unique handbag made by Agnes at the Agnes Toth Studio, which is a collaboration with Marvelosa. 

There is also the rare opportunity to have your very own pattern and unique handbag designed by Agnes, or have an oil painting, a portrait painted by the artist Agnes Toth.If you would like the portrait to be entirely embroidered, that is also possible to choose.See her paintings here: www.agnestoth.euAnd visit the Studio website, online shop here: www.agnestothstudio.com 
If you are looking for something else that you cannot find in the list, please feel free to contact us, we are happy to discuss any unique desires and make them come true.contact@agnestothstudio.com or marvelosa.official@gmail.com

www.marvelosa.eu






Marvelosa Apartment is by the River Danube and the Chain Bridge in the Buda Castle area, in the Old Town of Budapest
Perfect location if you are looking to stay somewhere quiet but central. It is an ideal place for short visits, and the perfect way to enjoy what Budapest has to offer, we are walking distance from the Buda Castle, the Royal Palace Gardens and the Rudas and Gellert Thermal Spas. The apartment is overlooking the Chain Bridge; one of the many good things about staying with us.

All our offers you can select from have a great discount.
Every date will be discussed when you know your arrival date and would like to make a booking. The early bookings will take the best dates. (Holidays, National Day, Christmas, New Year is not included for reservations) 


Come and see us...
It has been a long time without you, and we all had our experiences with the pandemic. We believe in the community spirit, and in the sake of good. Every contribution towards our aim to reopen Marvelosa will be a huge thing for us, and we can't wait to be able to have you at Marvelosa again! 
PLEASE SHARE OUR CROWDFUNDING, either by word of mouth or on social media!Every single help is a huge help!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Kedves Vendégeink, Kedves Barátaink!
A Marvelosa újranyitásához a Ti segítségetekre számítunk! Szeretnénk veletek együtt ünnepelni, hogy ismét visszatérhetünk több mint egy év után a vállalkozásunkhoz. Az újranyitáshoz egy kreatív ötlet keretében szeretnénk kérni Titeket, hogy a listában található csomagokból válaszatok, ezáltal támogatva minket adományaitokkal. 
Olyan gyűjtés ez, az Indiegogo oldalán keresztül, amely által újra egy jobb jövő felé tekinthetünk, az adományaitokért cserébe pedig számtalan izgalamas dologból választhattok, amely felhasználható a Marvelosa Étteremben, vagy a Marvelosa Apartmanban, illetve a gyűjtésben az Agnes Toth Studio is részt vesz. 
Amiket választani lehet, és mind kedvezménnyel jár:

story:
Anu Hall has 13 years of experience in working with people with disabilities. She is leading foundation Hea Hoog, which connects people with disabilities to job providers who are looking to hire. It’s still difficult, as at first, people are afraid to hire people who are different. Society is afraid of unknown and therefore they are afraid of us.

Just connecting job providers with our people is not enough. We need to take them back to the community, we want them to be part of our daily lives. Having a job is something that makes them happy, gives them energy and purpose. We want to give them all that by creating a cafe which specializes in educating our society in that topic.

In order to start with the cafe we need to collect 150 000 euros. We need to rent a place that is accessible in every way. This takes a lot of work and renovations – the entrance, accessibility, the toilets. In the perfect world even the kitchen has to be roomy enough to be accessible by wheelchair. We also need to provide special training and support. 

By being part of our project, you help us create so much more job opportunities and make people happy and healthy! We aren’t only creating jobs in that one cafe – we are breaking the prejudice of society and providing work opportunities in other fields as well. Let’s make disability an ability!


In case we can’t reach 150 000 euros with that campaign, we can start in different conditions. We can still provide job opportunities for some people, but without the right tools and environment we still have limitations and can’t provide opportunities to such a wide range of people.

We understand, that this topic is still a taboo and not too many people get excited by the idea, but if you understand what we want to achieve then you can help us out by spreading the word. If more people understand that people with disabilities are part of our society and they are more than happy to have a steady job themselves then we are already closer to achieving our goals and providing them with the jobs.

Please help us break the taboos of society and provide jobs to our hardworking people. You can help by donating and sharing the message. Thank you for being part of the campaign!

story:
Back Story of Kizzy’s

After searching high and low for a bookstore that had a large selection of African-American literature and not finding one, I developed the concept of Kizzy’s Books & More in 2008. Kizzy’s Books & More is named after the character Kizzy from the book Roots by Alex Haley. Kizzy’s Books & More is an independent bookstore that sells African-American literature and other products that embrace their culture. The intended location for Kizzy’s Books & More is in the Parramore neighborhood in west-central Orlando, FL.  The Parramore neighborhood is a historic community that is currently being revitalized. This community is in need of a bookstore that meets the needs of African-American consumers. The consumers in Parramore and the surrounding areas need a place that sells a wide range of African-American literature and products. There are places in surrounding areas that sell African-American Literature. However, the amount of African-American literature being sold at these stores is very limited and often times not accessible. Kizzy’s Books & More plans to fill that void.

 Kizzy’s Books & More is different from any other African American bookstore. What sets us apart from other African American bookstores is how we engage and connect with our customer base both online and at the store. To connect with our customers and those that are living in the community where we will be located, we have several events and workshops throughout the year. The following are the events and workshops that will be held at Kizzy’s Books & More:

  • Events
    • Mocktails, Books, & Conversations
      • Book lovers of different genres meet with like-minded individuals to discuss books over mocktails (nonalcoholic beverages)
    • My Soul Speaks
      • Spoken Word artists both local and national will recite poetry that speaks from the soul
    •  Story to Life
      • With this event, local actors of color volunteer their time and reenact Children’s story for children. This event exposes children to the arts.
    • Author book signings 
      • Held throughout the year
  • Workshops
    • How to get published
      • Teaches aspiring authors how to get published
    • Writing/Reading workshops to help children improve their writing and reading skills

We currently need your help with building a strong African-American Literary community in Orlando, FL.  I am asking my fellow lovers of African-American Literature and the culture to help raise $100,000, which represents a third of Kizzy’s Books & More total start-up budget. The money not only helps fund the initial inventory and technology costs, but serves as proof-of-concept/demand to prospective property owners and lenders. Every dollar we raise beyond the goal is a dollar Kizzy’s Books & More needs to take on start-up debt.

About the owner

I have a Bachelors in African-American Studies and Business Administration from Florida A&M University, a Masters of Business Administration in Marketing from Nova Southeastern University, and a Doctor of Business Administration degree with a Specialization in Entrepreneurship from Walden University. My background is teaching marketing and entrepreneurship at an alternative school and a university. I have also done consulting for small businesses.

For the last 10 years, I have been on this journey to learn as much as possible about the bookselling industry and the market. I have joined the American Booksellers Association where I was able to connect with other independent bookstore owners and talk with them about their experiences. In 2018, I completed the necessary training on managing and owning a bookstore through the Bookstore Training Group of Paz & Associates and was connected with future vendors. I also have a support team in place with Mark and Donna Kaufman of Paz & Associates to assist in any way possible. It has been a process to get to the level of readiness that Kizzy’s Books & More is at today. A lot of research was done to find the right vendors for our inventory. Majority of our vendors for our non-book inventory comes from black-owned businesses.

Making Kizzy’s Books & More a Reality

How much does it cost to open a Bookstore?

 It costs a lot of money to open a bookstore. Personal investments, my incredible business plan, funding received from other sources will cover renovations, fixtures & furniture, rent, licensing & insurances, professional services, marketing, etc. I need your help to purchase opening inventory and point-of-sale/inventory management system for Kizzy’s Books & More. The expenses below are estimates based on a 2,000 square foot space for Kizzy’s Books & More.

  • Books & non-book inventory: 1,700 sq ft of selling space @ $70/sqft= $119,000. To make this happen, we really need to hit our goal and a little bit more to give our readers the bookstore they deserve.
  • Point-of-sale/inventory management system= $10,000
  • Indiegogo deserves their cut for bringing us together= 5% of funds raised + 30 cents per contribution (includes platform and credit card fees) + cost of perks + cost to ship your perks to you (shipping is included in the perk cost).

Spread the Word

Use Indiegogo share tools to let others know about our fundraiser campaign. Visit our website www.kizzysbooksandmore.com, you can purchase books from our website. Also, visit our Facebook page @ kizzysbooksandmore. Please spread the word about us and let all those you know about the amazing bookstore named Kizzy’s Books and More that is coming to the Parramore area of Orlando, FL.

 

Thank you so much for believing in Kizzy’s Books & More.

 

Peace and Blessings,

 

Trenessa

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Jamison Sinclair. I am 43, I was born in California, and have been a skateboarder my whole life. 

I have been skateboarding for about 37 years (since 1977) and have watched skating go through so many changes. I have experienced, and learned so much through the simple act of just rolling on a board with 4 wheels attached to it. I now feel it is time to give back. My lifelong dream since I began skating has been to own my own company, and stoke other skaters as much as I was stoked by companies like Powell/Peralta, Dogtown, Girl/Chocolate, H-Street, and so many others who lived, and breathed skateboarding. I'm not here to "Just make a dollar" (money always helps obviously). I just want to repay skateboarding for everything it has given me, and I want to support and stoke the new generation. With Early Grab I seek to represent skating at a grass roots/DIY level, and keep it in the hands of the participants, not corporate interests. Early Grab is for skateboarders, all of you. My goal is to sell affordable (not "cheap") boards, clothing, and accessories that I would ride, and wear myself. This is my contribution to skateboarding. 

The money contributed to this campaign will fund my first run of product (Boards, T-shirts, hoodies, headwear, and promo items i.e. stickers) , and help with operating costs (yes, I am looking for riders to sponsor too) I already have several shops lined up, and will also sell online via an Early Grab webstore. I have done an initial run, and the feedback was very positive. I am fully dedicated to Early Grab, and skateboarding, and hope I can stoke others the same way I was 37 years ago.

J. Sinclair

story:
myVillage has provided online Event Registration, Email marketing, Subscription Payment service to for-profit, non-profit organizations and individuals with over 10 Million Transactions.

Please use indiegogo's share feature to share this campaign. every one who supports our campaign will receive receive a myVillage hate as well as their chosen Perk.


We are passionate about providing this Online service for Offline events where people get together to meet, to network, to hold events of all kinds. We make online event registration process fast and efficient. We provide Email Marketing that is designed to increase event attendance and reduce costs. At myVillage we leverage our big data capabilities responsibly to promote our Event Organizers events.

We have added Survey and Event Book Keeping features recently, and now looking to add Dynamic Maps everyone can use.


We are now looking to develop Dynamic Venue Maps at myVillage that Everyone can use for, for-profit, non-profit events, weddings and more; whereever people get together off line to network, to meet.


Maps for all occasions, corporate meetings, fund raisers, networking events, trade events, weddings and more, where ever people get together.

We propose to bring these maps to everyone in two steps:

1.  Manual maps; we will design these with you, per your event requirements and assign seating for you for your event of 50 people or more.

2. Dynamic Maps; In the mean time we will work on programming in a feature at ww.myvillage.us to automate the Map creation process for every to use for events of all types and sizes.  

We need your support to make this happen so every one can have access to this cloud based technology.

We will keep developing with your support until we meet the Stretch goals of 500 and 1,000 Event Attendees Venue.

Our team has over 200 years of experience in developing cloud based technology at myVillage. We hope to meet all of our goals on time and deliver to each one of our promises. We have over 10 Million transactions under our belt with technology that is state-of-the-art and stable at www.myVillage.US.

We hope to change the way people use Online system to meet Offline and need your help.

Risks and Challenges

While we do not expect it, current server capacity may become an issue to handle the throughput. We have a a number of technologies at our disposal that we can launch if capacity and throughput becomes an issue.

We are pretty good at handling projects, so hope to deliver everything on time, if there are any delays we plan to notify every one interested.
