story:
Passport SVP – worldwide travel in a box

Many of us have the urge to pack up and go travel the world. At some point many of us wonder what it would be like to experience the food, the music, the differing climates and hang out with the locals. We often hear tales of sleeping on beaches, eating unique cuisine and watching the sunrise over mountains in far off lands.

The reality however is very different for most people. Money is the number one reason people do not get to travel around the world, and although jobs, families and studies can get in the way of nomadic urges, now there is a solution to satisfying that wanderlust.

Passport SVP allows you to experience the delights of the world, without leaving the comforts of home.

Passport SVP will bring gifts, treats and a variety of artisan items to your front door, from all over the world, bringing with it the touch, feel and smells of the countries you dream of visiting one day, the images and stories of the cultures you often wondered about, all in the convenience of a gift box specially selected for you.

Forget the suitcase; the world is waiting for you in your mailbox. 

WHAT IS PASSPORT SVP?

Passport S'il Vous Plaît (SVP) is the brainchild of a guy who developed a case of wanderlust, and like many people, he never had the time or money to travel and see the world.

In the Summer of 2014, that all changed. He knew he had to go before it was too late. He decided to quit his job that provided security and support and backpacked his way through Europe and Asia.

After three exhilarating months on the road, he finally came back home to his normal, quiet life and started a new job, and while staring at his computer, thinking about all the wonderful places that he had visited he came up with the idea of putting those wonderful memories in a box for others to experience.

Passport SVP is delivered every two months to subscribers with a real interest in traveling, shopping, collecting and experiencing the many cultures of the world.

Passport SVP provides a platform for global artists to showcase their crafts, artworks and ideas with the world, while customers have the opportunity to discover the world in one box without leaving the comfort of their home.

WHAT IS IN THE BOX?

Each Passport SVP box contains 4 different artisan items from one specific country in a particular region that is of interest to the customer. Each item will be made and produced locally by talented artisans, bringing a new awareness to the Passport SVP customer of countries and items they would have little or no knowledge of.

Also included in the box will be literature with information on each item it’s origin, and creative text on the country itself.

The booklets, shaped like a handy passport,  will provide insight on cultural places to visit, local events, artists, trends, and cultural insight into music, customs and cuisine.

I understand that you don't want to commit to something right away, so I'm giving you two options to purchase the box. You can either buy a yearly subscription or buy a box every two months; the choice is yours. 

What Will The Money Be Used For?

To get Passport SVP off the ground, we estimate the total cost to be $5,000. The money will be used to curate the artisanal pieces that will feature in the box and will also help to provide recycled packaging, and promotional materials.

For helping us out, you will get some great rewards. The rewards are based on how much you pledge. The details are on the right side of the page. 


The Impact

This business will help spread the word on up and coming designers and bring their designs to the forefront.

Passport SVP is committed to supporting local artists and local economies and we always buy responsibly using fair trade policies to help support the local areas and regions of the artists.

We will also work with local translators and shipping companies, to keep the business within the regions, while ensuring completely authentic products are produced for our customers.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that everyone is not able to contribute financially, but there are other ways you can help.

-The biggest way you can help is by spreading the word via social media to all your friends and family.
story_txt:
Passport SVP – worldwide travel
in a boxMany
of us have the urge to pack up and go travel the world. At some point many of
us wonder what it would be like to experience the food, the music, the differing
climates and hang out with the locals. We often hear tales of sleeping on
beaches, eating unique cuisine and watching the sunrise over mountains in far
off lands. 
The
reality however is very different for most people. Money is the number one
reason people do not get to travel around the world, and although jobs,
families and studies can get in the way of nomadic urges, now there is a
solution to satisfying that wanderlust.
Passport SVP allows you to experience
the delights of the world, without leaving the comforts of home.
Passport SVP will bring gifts, treats
and a variety of artisan items to your front door, from all over the world,
bringing with it the touch, feel and smells of the countries you dream of
visiting one day, the images and stories of the cultures you often wondered
about, all in the convenience of a gift box specially selected for you.
Forget the suitcase;
the world is waiting for you in your mailbox. 


WHAT IS PASSPORT SVP?

Passport S'il Vous Plaît (SVP) is the brainchild of a guy who developed a case of
wanderlust, and like many people, he never had the time or money to travel and
see the world.
In the Summer of 2014, that all changed. He knew he had to go
before it was too late. He decided to quit his job that provided security and
support and backpacked his way through Europe and Asia. 
After three exhilarating months on the road, he finally came
back home to his normal, quiet life and started a new job, and while staring at
his computer, thinking about all the wonderful places that he had visited he
came up with the idea of putting those wonderful memories in a box for others
to experience.
Passport SVP is delivered every two months to subscribers with a real
interest in traveling, shopping, collecting and experiencing the many cultures
of the world. 
Passport SVP provides a platform for global artists to showcase their
crafts, artworks and ideas with the world, while customers have the opportunity
to discover the world in one box without leaving the comfort of their home. 

WHAT IS IN THE BOX?


Each Passport SVP box contains 4 different artisan items from one specific country in a particular region that is of interest to the customer. Each item
will be made and produced locally by talented artisans, bringing a new
awareness to the Passport SVP
customer of countries and items they would have little or no knowledge of.
Also included in the box will
be literature with information on each item it’s origin, and creative text on
the country itself. 
The booklets, shaped like a
handy passport,  will provide insight on cultural
places to visit, local events, artists, trends, and cultural insight into
music, customs and cuisine.I understand that you don't want to commit to something right away, so I'm giving you two options to purchase the box. You can either buy a yearly subscription or buy a box every two months; the choice is yours. 

What Will The Money Be
Used For?

To get Passport SVP off the ground, we estimate the total cost to be
$5,000. The money will be used to curate the artisanal pieces that will feature
in the box and will also help to provide recycled packaging, and promotional
materials. 
For helping us out, you will get some great rewards. The rewards are
based on how much you pledge. The details are on the right side of the page. 

The Impact

This business will help spread the word on up and coming designers and
bring their designs to the forefront. 
Passport SVP is committed to supporting local artists and local economies
and we always buy responsibly using fair trade policies to help support the local areas and regions of the artists.

We will also work with local translators and shipping companies, to keep
the business within the regions, while ensuring completely authentic products
are produced for our customers.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that everyone is not able to contribute financially, but
there are other ways you can help. 
-The biggest way you can help is by spreading the word via social media
to all your friends and family.

story:
What's the Story?

I’m so excited about creating a new, totally independent place for people to explore books and artisans' creations in the scenic Pikes Peak Region of Colorado!

Beyond Words Books and Things will carry inspirational books that create good spirits and support strong family values, also specializing in out of print, or off market books.  E-books are great, but there’s a place in most people’s hearts for real books – books that are familiar and beloved.  In today’s world of rough language and tough topics, Beyond Words’ books will be uplifting and energizing! 

Beyond Words Books and Things will also be a place where people can sell their arts and crafts in a family-friendly, faith oriented store.  It will be a bookstore, but just as much, it will be an artisans’ outlet.  I always wanted a place to sell my own creations – jewelry, woodwork, and handmade cards – but finding a supportive, year-round outlet is virtually impossible. Beyond Words Books and Things will be that kind of place! 

For shoppers interested in superior quality art and merchandise as well as faith and family friendly materials, I will carry a myriad of Christian resources  such as books, artwork, gifts, home decor, and clothing. I'm also thrilled to welcome Colorado Wildlife Artist, Ray Shaw, and Laurie and Scott Longberry of Berry Farms Studios in this endeavor.  And this is only a beginning!

What we need:

 It's a startup, so we need almost everything:

  • A space!  I have located several retail spaces for lease and need at least 3 months rent. Your help will determine which location we get in the busy spots or in the quiet spots.  We want busy!
  • Computerized point of sale and security equipment - installed.
  • Shelving and furniture, lighting and cabinets
  • Signs and miscellaneous supplies

And what you get:

Fun Perks!
Bookmarks

                                                                                                         


               

    


Sermons And Writings Of President Ezra Taft Benson - 2003 Gift Edition

The Book Bag

The Photo of Pikes Peak and Garden of the Gods

But Wait, There's More!

Check out other Great Perks in the list!  

Art Classes, Books and Open House Spotlights all about you!

  • There's something for everyone, even the smallest donations get a piece  of the action.  For $2 you have my grateful heart, and if you come into the store, you can have a hug and a kiss (chocolate, of course).  For higher donations, there are several Perks and Rewards to choose from! 
  • If you're an author, an artist or a crafter, I'm sure there's a place for you in my store! Check out my different levels of Rewards for your support! 
  • Come share the fun! Every week, we will have special events, from weekly children’s storytime with free cookies, to writer’s workshops, crafting demonstrations, book club members’ meetings - complete with yummy baked treats. We will regularly feature time to meet local artists, aspiring authors, and will share new ideas for family-fun! 

The Store Displays and Spotlighting Events

 I truly want Beyond Words to be a place for everyone to shine!  Check out the Perks that can benefit all of us!  I only ask that your works will be in keeping with the uplifting, family oriented theme of Beyond Words Books and Things. 


The Impact

Why this is a great project for everyone!

    Beyond Words Books and Things will work because there is a void in the Pikes Peak Region for personalized outlets like the one I want to build.  There are plenty of big name bookstores, but which offer no place for local artisans.  There are consignment stores, flea markets, and annual crafters shows, but those feature random collections of items that don’t meet the needs of a faith-based clientele who want specific materials. 

    I have researched the numbers and spoken with dozens of people who miss the similar store that closed years ago in our city when its owner retired.  It was a regular destination for many folks who relied on him to keep up with the religious books and articles wanted.  I was one of his regulars!  I have studied his very successful model, and know I can build on that model to open new doors for many people. Beyond Words Books and Things will support artisans and authors to make creating all the more rewarding!

What are the Challenges?

I'm so sure that this is a viable project that I'm willing to do whatever it takes to make things happen.  I've done all the preliminary set up that I can do without money.  And now it's down to the money!  But I realize that there are no sure things in business, so I've chosen an all or nothing campaign to start my bookstore - crafters' outlet.  I don't think it's fair to take generous help from anyone if I can't deliver the goods!  
My main challenge is that there are other bookstores in town.  None have the focus I have to share faith-oriented materials and merchandise in a family friendly setting. 
"The next challenge is online ordering and e-books.  There's a great void in Colorado Springs for the materials that I will focus on.  I know that there is no store within 50 miles that offers materials specifically for the more than 16,000 members of my own Church here.  They want a local outlet for the things they love! 
Why I'm so sure this will fly!
There truly will be no other store like Beyond Words Books and Things.
For decades I have held leadership positions in my religious organization and know the Christian culture of Colorado Springs and the Pikes Peak Region intimately.  I am comfortably familiar with several religious organizations. 

I have successfully managed many special events including formal and charity dinners, wedding receptions, community service projects, and youth activities.  I know how to work effectively!  It's fun!

I am also a crafter who has been involved for years with different crafts fairs and one of the largest crafters' guilds in the area. I know the ins and outs of consignment and marketing handmade creations.  I have sold jewelry, macramé (I'm dating myself here) and woodwork creations from children's furniture and quilt stands to candle sticks and curios.
As a widow, I know how to beat the odds and make good things happen even when challenges come!  With this in mind, I want to make this a success story not only to become an independent businesswoman, but also to help others with their creative dreams!
Other Ways You Can Help

If money isn't what you can give

  • Will you please share my project with your friends and contacts?
  • Will you please ask them to share my project, too?

And that's all there is to it.

story:
New Official Partnership Announcement: Toy's for Tot's & Shelter to Soldier...

We are proud to announce our official partnership with the Toy's for Tot's foundation. We are conducting a toy drive with your help. Our personal goal is to pre-sell 10,000 donated Super Stunt Motocross Dirt Bike toys for Christmas 2016. Each toy donation will be made in your name. just click the featured perk to pre-order your toy donation today.

Your single donation will help improve 3 lives – the life of a child, the life of a soldier, and the life of a shelter dog.  Each toy will be donated in your name. Just choose the Featured Perk to donate today!


When you donate a Super Stunt Motocross Dirt Bike toy you are not just helping a child in need have a better Christmas. Additionally, for every toy you donate to Toy's for Tot's, we here at the Varoom-A-Zoom toy company will also donate $3.00 to Shelter to Soldier, helping save two lives.

About Shelter to Soldier: Shelter to Soldier is a 501c3 charity that rescues shelter dogs from an uncertain future and trains them to be psychiatric service dogs for post 9/11 combat veterans recovering from PTSD, Traumatic brain Injury, and other combat-related psychological injuries.

Relationship Verification: To verify that we indeed are officially working with these two wonderful charities please feel free to contact the following personnel.

Toy's for Tot's - Col. Ted "Migs" Silvester Marine Corps Retired  at ted.silvester@toysfortots.org  or (703) 649-2021

Shelter to Soldier - Graham or Kyrie Bloem at  graham@sheltertosoldier.org or Kyrie@sheltertosoldier.org  (713) 447-4051 

_________________________________________________________________________


Our Campaign:

Hello, my name is Anthony. Most of us can remember that one toy we had growing up that meant more to us than any other. The toy that we could spend an entire day playing with. For me that toy was my Team America Super Stunt Dirt Bike. This campaign is to raise funding for a re-engineered 21st century version of this toy.

Whether you remember playing with this iconic toy as the great Evel Knievel, or as the re-branded version of Team America “Super Stunt Dirt Bike,” you my friend are very fortunate to have played with one of the bestselling toys the Ideal toy company ever made.  If you share these memories, it also means that you grew up with one foot in the 70’s and one in the 80’s. Arguably one of the best time to have been a kid. 

If you are anything like me, you have a very special place in your heart for this toy. Even though I could never get my toy to go like it did in the commercials, I lost hours of my summer going on back yard adventures with my Team America set... complete with the Black Marauder on his Super Stunt Chopper.

Unfortunately, when the video game industry boomed we kids found ourselves outside less and less and as a result sale’s of this awesome toy (and many others) fell.

I was so excited to see the re-release of this toy a few years back. I had big dreams of enjoying it with my kids. But, we were all sadly disappointed to find that the new version was low quality and didn’t hold up.


That’s why I’m here. My friend Vince (aka the 7-inch Dare-Devil) and I have teamed up to launch an awesome re-engineered modern version of this toy, while maintaining the integrity and the fun of the original design. We’ve designed a new launcher and the bikes are molded from a new kind of stronger plastic. Our new Super Dirt Bike is better, stronger, faster, more powerful, and jumps further

(Just check out this prototype video jumping over three full size cars).

Vince, is a true aficionado of this toy, and we are proud to bring you a superior Super Stunt Dirt Bike toy. Vince is the man behind the re-engineering of the Super Stunt Dirt Bike, and his passion shows through in the enhanced quality and design of the new product.

Our newly designed stunt bike has a patentable redesign; guaranteeing you and your family an out of the box play experience like you see in our prototype videos.

Our energizer/ launcher has been redesigned to be easier for a child to use. We have taken into account the body mechanics of a child to guarantee a great play time experience. 

We GUARANTEE…

  • Durable commercial grade re-enforced plastic.
  • No assembly required (all pieces will be sonic welded or molded as a single unit to guarantee durability).
  • High performance playtime thanks to new engineering and manufacturing techniques.
  • Assembly and key manufacturing will be done in America.
In order to maximize funds available for R&D and quality control, we are not seeking any major retail distribution. We will allow private labeling to ensure multiple collecting opportunities.
Additional Partnerships:
Ami "Moto" Houde & The World Motor Sports Breast Cancer Foundation.
For every Ami "Moto" Houde Moto Chick toy sold we will dentate $3.00 to the World Motor Sports Breast Cancer Foundation.


Manufacturing, Assembly, and Shipping…

Unless we can find an injection molding company in the U.S. that can give us a fair price, we are going to have to have the molding done over seas. However, other key protected parts will be made here in the U.S. to guarantee quality and to protect our intellectual property.

Additionally, 100% of the assembly will be done here in America. It is our wish and plan to have of the assembly and packaging done by the great people at Opportunity Village, giving us the opportunity to give back and help the community. Opportunity Village is a non-profit, based in Las Vegas, NV, that provides employment and training opportunities to those who are intellectually disabled.

Shipping will be handled by a (PP&S) Pick, Pack, and Ship company that has the means to accommodate our needs.  

Press Release:

Marketers Media Feb 3rd 2016


Facebook Page: Varoom-A-Zoom FB Page

story:
Bringing the World to You & You to the World
               

         

                 
                              

In these turbulent times that we live in, don't you wish that there was a company out there looking to bring people together and make the world a smaller place for everyone? At GVIC our two primary services will be business consultancy to assist companies with expansion into the ASEAN region and migration services, both commercial and pro-bono for people in urgent need. We will also be offering resume, career and job search assistance to job seekers around the world. GVIC grew from the vision of Simon, our Principal Consultant, who was fighting to overcome debilitating clinical depression and wanted to find a way to use his skills to help people find new opportunities in their lives. Our vision for Global Village is to create an amazing network of people from across the world so that people will always have a place to come for advice on expanding their horizons. We understand starting a business, migrating to a new place or changing careers can be a scary and lonely task, so we at GVIC are here to walk you through it, step by step.

                       

                                

Business Consulting: Our goal is to assist companies from around the world to offer professional services, sell products and expand their operations into the ASEAN region. If you'd like to operate in the region but don't know where to start we will provide the necessary tools for expanding and even investing in companies in the region. By utilizing our networks, local knowledge and on-the-ground presence to connect business people who are new to the region with the services they need, while providing end-to-end services including recruitment and ongoing monitoring for entrepreneurs who would like to run a business in the ASEAN region or invest in companies in the region.

Migration Services: These services would be for people who would like to come and work, travel, study or live in Australia or New Zealand. In addition to our for-profit activities, we're also going to devote time, energy and funds to offer free migration services to those in urgent need, both in the ASEAN region and beyond. We understand the difficulties and expenses associated with the majority of migration services. Unlike many companies doing similar things, we are in the process of applying for accreditation with the Australian and New Zealand governments to provide higher-quality, accountable services to all our customers. We are here to help!

           

                    
                                                           

          At GVIC, we are a group of business professionals with years of experience. 

                                                          

Simon Andrews: Our Principal Consultant Simon holds qualifications in corporate training and business management and has just completed a Graduate Certificate in Australian Migration Law and Practice. Having previously lived and worked in South-East Asia for nine years, Simon is conversational in several Asian languages and has a deep affinity for the peoples and cultures of the region. Simon has fought back and made an unlikely recovery after losing three years of his life to severe clinical depression, and is determined to make GVIC a success.

                                                           

Penny Chomboon: Our ASEAN Operations Manager Penny has five years of management experience in the highly competitive private education sector, where she has been responsible for overseeing sales, growth, quality control and administration for a group of private learning centers in western Bangkok. Penny's local knowledge, management skills and enthusiasm make her a vital part of the GVIC team.
story_txt: Bringing the World to You & You to the World                                                                       In these turbulent times that we live in, don't you wish that there was a company out there looking to bring people together and make the world a smaller place for everyone? At GVIC our two primary services will be business consultancy to assist companies with expansion into the ASEAN region and migration services, both commercial and pro-bono for people in urgent need. We will also be offering resume, career and job search assistance to job seekers around the world. GVIC grew from the vision of Simon, our Principal Consultant, who was fighting to overcome debilitating clinical depression and wanted to find a way to use his skills to help people find new opportunities in their lives. Our vision for Global Village is to create an amazing network of people from across the world so that people will always have a place to come for advice on expanding their horizons. We understand starting a business, migrating to a new place or changing careers can be a scary and lonely task, so we at GVIC are here to walk you through it, step by step.                                                       Business Consulting: Our goal is to assist companies from around the world to offer professional services, sell products and expand their operations into the ASEAN region. If you'd like to operate in the region but don't know where to start we will provide the necessary tools for expanding and even investing in companies in the region. By utilizing our networks, local knowledge and on-the-ground presence to connect business people who are new to the region with the services they need, while providing end-to-end services including recruitment and ongoing monitoring for entrepreneurs who would like to run a business in the ASEAN region or invest in companies in the region.Migration Services: These services would be for people who would like to come and work, travel, study or live in Australia or New Zealand. In addition to our for-profit activities, we're also going to devote time, energy and funds to offer free migration services to those in urgent need, both in the ASEAN region and beyond. We understand the difficulties and expenses associated with the majority of migration services. Unlike many companies doing similar things, we are in the process of applying for accreditation with the Australian and New Zealand governments to provide higher-quality, accountable services to all our customers. We are here to help!                                                                                                    At GVIC, we are a group of business professionals with years of experience.                                                           Simon Andrews: Our Principal Consultant Simon holds qualifications in corporate training and business management and has just completed a Graduate Certificate in Australian Migration Law and Practice. Having previously lived and worked in South-East Asia for nine years, Simon is conversational in several Asian languages and has a deep affinity for the peoples and cultures of the region. Simon has fought back and made an unlikely recovery after losing three years of his life to severe clinical depression, and is determined to make GVIC a success.                                                           Penny Chomboon: Our ASEAN Operations Manager Penny has five years of management experience in the highly competitive private education sector, where she has been responsible for overseeing sales, growth, quality control and administration for a group of private learning centers in western Bangkok. Penny's local knowledge, management skills and enthusiasm make her a vital part of the GVIC team.

story:
Short Summary

**Please note - even though $80,000AUD is the campaign target my main goal is to raise $8,500AUD which is explained below - the grand total displayed is a dream amount & all is explained below**

Firstly I would like to say Thank You for taking the time to learn about my campaign. My name is Kerry and Try & Guess is my baby. We are a gift & homeware store with a difference - A Little Store With A Big Heart.

What makes us different?

  • We support local & Australian artisan, designers & producers by stocking our store with totally amazing products.
  • We have room by room themes - (our shop is set up in an old weatherboard house so we thought this would be a cool idea to do). So we have a gift, homeware, kidz zone, bathroom & kitchen areas.
  • We support Ethically Trading companies & international indipendant artisans - if we stray off our shores to look further afield that's what we like to look for!
  • But the most important part & the reason why I want to have this business succeed - is that with every purchase made - we donate back to local charities & organisations - currently we have 3 groups but would love to grow this number - (this equates to approximately 2% of each sale given back)

About Me: I have been involved in retail for close to 30 years now, however, this is my first solo venture. Try & Guess has been operating now for just on 12 months, however, for us to complete our dream of helping our community the way we would like, we are going to need help.

This is where you come into the equation.

What We Need

So what is it that we need?

  1. First & foremost, our main focus is to grow our business. We feel by opening an online shopping store we can achieve this. I believe this is an essential part of the business, as it will help us reach a wider customer demographic, whilst we help promote our amazing Australian product.  With our current Point of Sale System in our store, we have been quoted $8,500AUD to get an on-line store up & running, so we can run both the bricks & mortar store and the online store simultaneously while keeping track of stock levels etc in both areas. All online sales will also have the same percentage of funds donated back to local charities/organisations as the bricks & mortar store.
  2. Secondly, we would like to set up our last room in the house. The way we set this room up will depend on how many funds we raise. If we don't meet our target, we will probably turn this into a small coffee/lounge area, and if we can't achieve that,  we will stock it with product. We are estimating $7,500AUD will be what we need to purchase some chairs & coffee machine etc to get this set up as a coffee room. The coffee room will also be donating a percentage of every sale back to various causes.
  3. Next, if we reach our target,  we would love to be able to extend the shop and create a new store room, disable access into the store, customer toilet and demonstration/course area. One of our ideas will be to have this area to run art/cooking courses etc, with all profits from these, going back to local causes.
  4. Lastly, if by some miracle we exceed our target and have funds remaining, we would love to heat & cool our store. As it is in an old home, only one room is heated/cooled and we feel this will make the shopping journey a little more enjoyable throughout the remaining store for our customers.

After all the above is done & achieved, and if we have any remaining funds left over, we would put the money back into advertising & product to go back into the store.

The Impact

Ballarat is a wonderful country town, however as with quite alot of Australia, we have a number of homeless youths, at risk women, children & men, low income families, who at times need a little help and even animal shelters who need a helping hand.

We are currently raising funds for the following groups, and have raised a little over $1,200 since opening, but our dream is to be able to donate that amount  each month. The groups are:

Eureka Mums - A vounteer run Not For Profit Organisation - who rehome new and pre-loved baby goods and nursery equipment to families in need. These donations are distributed to families experiencing hardship in Ballarat and surrounding towns through their partnerships with maternal & child health nurses and local social service agencies.

Aron Siermans Fund - Aron is a local boy who's mother was murdered by a man whilst he was on parole in 2013. Aron was 4 at the time of his mums murder and is now being raised by his grandparents here in Ballarat. Funds raised help them to raise & care for Aron until he is grown and can care for himself.

Ballarat Winter Appeal - This is an annual appeal which help to provide much needed items to families and individuals, who are experiencing hardship and need a little warmth, help & understanding during the colder months in Ballarat.

Future causes we would like to help - Ballarat Soup Bus (a food van which help to feed some of the homeless in Ballarat), StreetSwags (Swags for the homeless so they have a little warmth & comfort whilst living on the street), Share The Dignity (Sanitary products for those that cant afford to buy them), RSPCA (Animal Shelter plus Rescue) There will be others going on the list in the future as well.

Other Ways You Can Help......

If you can't contribute - we understand - but if you believe we are doing good & believe in our business and what we stand for, then can you please help by getting the word out for us and make some noise about our campaign. Please help to share this, and that's easy, just use the Indiegogo Share Tools on this page.

story:
My dream is to create a Serbian Grill Bar.


Balkan cooking is seasonal and sourced from local ingredients.  The Balkans is a fertile region and the dishes are based on fresh produce, though you can’t escape the love of barbecued meat. Ćevapi (or kebabi) are to be found grilled on the street in every city and my planned Serbian Grill House too.

Please find images about our fantastic meals:
